issue_details.Lead Manager: Kotak Mahindra Capital, Morgan Stanley, BofA Securities, JM Financial and Avendus Capital

all.styick_header_txt: Brainbees Solutions (FirstCry) Limited is going public with a fresh issue and an offer for sale. The issue opens on 06th August 2024.​​
all.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/26MLGzk1N9A" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

1.header: India’s largest multi-channel retailer for Mothers’, Babies’ and Kids’ products​
desc: Founded in 2010, the company has grown into the largest multi-channel retail platform for products aimed at mothers, babies, and kids. It initially launched as an online platform and soon expanded into physical stores under the brands "FirstCry" and "BabyHug." As of March 31, 2024, the company operated 435 company-owned company-operated (COCO) stores and 628 franchisee-owned franchisee-operated (FOFO) stores nationwide.

A key subsidiary of the company, Globalbees Brands, in which the company holds a 50.23% stake, specializes in funding and acquiring direct-to-consumer (D2C) businesses across various categories, including home utilities, fashion/lifestyle, appliances, and beauty/personal care. These investments in early-stage D2C companies have the potential to yield significant returns and unlock substantial value for shareholders.​

3.header: Reducing yet high dependence on Xpressbees for logistics
desc: The company heavily relies on Xpressbees for its logistics needs. In FY2024, 57.3% of the total logistics costs were attributed to Xpressbees, down from 82.8% in FY2022. Additionally, Supam Maheshwari, the Managing Director and CEO of Brainbees, serves as a director on the board of Xpressbees, which could present a potential conflict of interest.

Based on FY2024 financials, the company is loss-making asking for a market cap-to-sales ratio of 3.7x. Such a valuation is justified for a fast-growing company with potential for unlocking value through its funding and investment arm. We, therefore, suggest subscribing to the issue.

details: Objectives of the Issue Offer for sale – Rs 2,527.73 cr & Fresh Issue – Rs 1,666 cr

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. To fund the expenditure for: (i) setting up new modern stores under the ‘BabyHug’ brand; and (ii) setting up a warehouse, in India – Rs 108.10 crore
2. To fund the expenditure for lease payments for the existing identified modern stores owned and operated by the company, in India – Rs 93.10 crore​
3. To fund the investment in one of the company’s subsidiary, Digital Age for (i) setting up new modern stores under the FirstCry brand and other home brands of the company; and (ii) lease payments for the existing identified modern stores owned and controlled by Digital Age, in India – Rs 299.60 crore
4. Investment in one of the subsidiary, FirstCry Trading for overseas expansion by: (i) setting up new modern stores; and (ii) setting up warehouse(s), in KSA – Rs 155.60 crore
5. Investment in one of the subsidiary, Globalbees Brands towards acquisition of additional stake in our step-down Subsidiaries – Rs 169 crore​
6. To fund the Sales and marketing initiatives by the company – Rs 200 crore
7. Technology and data science cost including cloud and server hosting related costs – Rs 57.60 crore.
8. Funding inorganic growth through acquisitions and general corporate purposes – Rs 583 crore​
​

headervalue:
Schroders Capital Private​
Equity Asia Mauritius II ​

about: Brainbees Solutions operates India’s largest multi-channel retailing platform (in terms of GMV) for products catering to mothers, babies and kids through their proprietary “FirstCry” platform.

The company launched its “FirstCry” platform in India in 2010 with the goal to create a one-stop shop for all parenting needs. The company has since established presence in UAE and Saudi Arabia in 2019 and 2022, respectively.

The company offers products from third-party Indian brands, global brands and home-grown brands. Through deep data analysis, company has managed to develop and grow one of its own brands “BabyHug”, into the largest multi-category Mothers’, Babies’, and Kids’ products brand in India in terms of GMV in FY2024.
The company also operates through retail stores in India under the COCO and FOFO model. As of FY2024, the company operated 435 COCO stores and 628 stores through the FOFO model.
The company’s revenue grew by 170% between FY2022 and FY2024 and stood at Rs 6,481 crore for FY2024.
In FY2024, the company’s Return on Net Worth stood at (8.65%), an improvement of 411bps from (12.76%) recorded in FY2023.
For FY2024, the operating margins for the company improved to 4.23%, from 1.33% recorded in FY2023 and 4.01% recorded in FY2022.
The company has failed to generate profits for the last 3 years. The company posted a loss of Rs 321 crore for FY2024, compared to a loss of Rs 486 crore in FY2023.
​The company has failed to generate positive cash flow from operations for the last three years. The company reported a CFO of negative Rs 42 crore in FY2024.
​The company has a debt of Rs 1,422 crore (including lease liabilities) as of 31st March 2024.

issue_details.Promoters: ACEVECTOR LIMITED (formerly SNAPDEAL LTD), STARFISH I PTE. LTD., KUNAL BAHL AND ROHIT KUMAR​ BANSAL

all.styick_header_txt: Unicommerce eSolutions Limited is going public with an offer for sale. The issue opens on 06th August 2024.​​
all.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Rf1509Oeq1A" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

1.header: Dropping client retention over the past 3 years​
desc: Over the past three financial years, the company has seen an increase in the number of enterprise clients, growing from 470 in FY2022 to 795 in FY2024. However, this growth is primarily due to the addition of new clients, as the retention rate of existing clients has declined. The retention ratio for enterprise clients has decreased from 83.7% in FY2022 to 75.2% in FY2024. The company has also observed a decline in the retention rate for its small and medium business clients, dropping from 61.8% in FY2022 to 50.5% in FY2024.

2.header: Lower Revenue Retention from existing customers
desc: The company operates with a subscription model and the clients do not have any obligations to renew their subscriptions and continue with the company. Net Revenue Retention (NRR), a parameter which measures repeat business from customers which were present in the previous period, stood at 107.57% for FY2024 falling from 136.30% and 120% in FY2023 and FY2022, respectively.​

The company has categorized its clientele into enterprise clients and small businesses. Over the past two years, revenue from enterprise clients has grown at a CAGR of 22.94%. The contribution of enterprise clients to total revenue has increased from 83% in FY2022 to 88% in FY2024. Additionally, the company offers a distinct subscription plan for enterprise clients, ensuring a steady cash flow through an advance fee and providing premium services that result in higher margins from this segment.

Based on FY2024 financials, the company is targeting a PE ratio of 85x and a market cap-to-sales ratio of 10.7x. The company does not have a comparable listed peer. Such high valuations don’t justify a company with such small scale. Also, the company operates at lower margins compared to its peers in the IT – Software sector. We, therefore, recommend avoiding this issue.​

details: Objectives of the Issue Offer for sale – Rs 276.57 cr

about: Unicommerce eSolutions is a SaaS platform that enables end-to-end management of e-commerce operations for brands, sellers and logistic providers. The company offers a suite of services to small and medium businesses such as warehouse and inventory management, multi-channel order management, logistics tracking, courier allocation and payment reconciliation.
​The company is the country’s largest e-commerce enablement SaaS platform in transaction processing phase, in terms of revenues for FY2023.

The products of the company are sector and size agnostic and find uses in various types of e-commerce and retail enterprises, both online and offline. They also provide sub modules which are value added to their SaaS offerings such as procurement management, invoice and logistics management.
These products are such that they can be easily patched with the user’s website/application providing ease to the customer.
​The company’s revenue grew by 75% between FY2022 and FY2024 and stood at Rs 103.6 crore for FY2024.
In FY2024, the company’s Return on Net Worth stood at 18.98%, an improvement of 650bps from 12.48% recorded in FY2023.
For FY2024, the operating margins for the company improved to 13.92%, from 7.25% recorded in FY2023 and 8.54% recorded in FY2022.​
Profit margins for FY2024 stood at 12.63%, recording an improvement of 544bps from 7.19% recorded in FY2023.
The company has generated positive cash flow from operations for the last three years. The company reported a CFO of Rs 6 crore in FY2024.
The company has a debt of Rs 7.5 crore (including lease liabilities) as of 31st March 2024.

issue_details.Lead Manager: Kotak Mahindra Capital, BofA Securities, Axis Capital, SBI Capital, CitiGroup, Goldman Sachs, ICICI Securities and BOB Capital.

all.styick_header_txt: Ola Electric Mobility Limited is going public with a fresh issue and an offer for sale. The issue opens on 02nd August 2024.​​​​​​​
all.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/IZ7VUP5ZWd8" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

1.header: Heavy supplier dependence for critical material​
desc: The company relies heavily on several suppliers for essential components, including lithium-ion cells, magnets, and electronic ICs. The top 10 suppliers account for 60% of the total supplies. Additionally, the company has been increasing its reliance on China for these critical components, with China's share rising from 7.9% in FY2022 to 36.9% in FY2024. The company plans on increasing its reliance on China for the critical minerals required in cell manufacturing which Ola plans to undertake on its own.

For Ola's S1 Pro Gen 1 model, the cost of lithium-ion cells has increased from 26.3% of the total costs in FY2022 to 32.3% in FY2024. The company lacks long-term contracts with suppliers, making it vulnerable to fluctuations in the availability and pricing of quality cells.​

The company's strong sales have been largely driven by the FAME subsidies provided by the government for electric vehicle purchases. These subsidies have made Ola's electric two-wheelers price-competitive with current ICE vehicles. In the future, such subsidies may no longer be available, potentially making the company's path to profitability more challenging.

Based on FY2024 financials, the company has made a loss of Rs 1,585 crore and has been unprofitable for the past 3 years. The company is asking for a Price-to-sales of 6.7x which is higher than the legacy companies such as Bajaj Auto and TVS which trade at P/S of 5.8x and 3.1x of their sales after being profitable. Given the uncertainty of turning profitable, we recommend avoiding this issue.

details: Objectives of the Issue Offer for sale – Rs 645.46 cr & Fresh Issue – Rs 5,500 cr

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. Capital expenditure to be incurred by a subsidiary of the company – Rs 1,227.64 crore​
2. Repayment or pre-payment, in full or part, of the indebtedness incurred by a subsidiary of the company – Rs 800 crore​
3. Investment into research and product development – Rs 1,600 crore​
4. Expenditure to be incurred for organic growth initiatives – Rs 350 crore​
5. General corporate purposes – Rs 1522.36 crore​​

about: ​Ola Electric Mobility is an electric vehicle company that primarily manufactures electric vehicles and certain core components for electric vehicles such as battery packs, motors, and vehicle frames. As of 31st March 2024, the company held a market share of 35% in Indian E2W market.

Since August 2021, the company has launched seven new products and announced four. The Ola S1 Pro, the first EV model, was delivered in December 2021, followed by the Ola S1, Ola S1 Air, Ola S1 X and Ola S1 X+ in the following years.
On August 15, 2023, the company announced new EV models and a range of motorcycles including Diamondhead, Adventure, Roadster, and Cruiser.
The company operates through its own D2C network comprising of 870 experience centres and 431 service centres across the country.
The company’s revenue grew by 1241% between FY2022 and FY2024 and stood at Rs 5,009.8 crore for FY2024.
In FY2024, the company’s Return on Net Worth stood at 33.57%, an improvement of 537bps from 28.20% recorded in FY2023.
For FY2024, the gross margins stood at 12.58%, a significant increase from 2.3% and -28.78% registered in FY2023 and FY2022 respectively.
Consequently, Operating margins for the company improved to -19.84%, from -43.02% and -157.27% recorded in FY2023 and FY2022 respectively.
The company has failed to generate positive cash flow from operations for the last three years. The company reported a CFO of negative Rs 633 crore in FY2024.
​The company has a debt of Rs 2,710 crore as of 31st March 2024.

issue_details.Promoters: RAMNEEK SEHGAL, RAMNEEK SEHGAL AND SONS HUF AND RS FAMILY TRUST

all.styick_header_txt: Ceigall India Limited is going public with a fresh issue and an offer for sale. The issue opens on 01st August 2024.​​​​​​​
all.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/A8C1gNcspW0" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: The company is highly dependent on the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) for project opportunities, as it mainly engages in road construction activities. Additionally, its association with government agencies results in delayed cash inflows, which strains the company's working capital and leads to financial stress.

The company aims to diversify into other business models, including Build-Operate-Transfer (BOT) and Operation & Maintenance (O&M). These models are margin accretive and offer diversification. However, they come with challenges such as arranging financing, dependency on vehicle traffic, and managing daily operational costs.​

The company has demonstrated excellence in executing several projects earning them pre-qualifications in several upcoming projects. The company has completed 9 projects for the NHAI and have 12 projects ongoing. NHAI contributed to 80% of the total order book as of 30th June 2024.

Based on FY2024 financials, the company is targeting a PE ratio of 23x and a market cap-to-sales ratio of 2.3x. This is comparable to one of its recently listed peers, SRM Contractors, which currently trades at a PE of 22x. The industry average PE is 18x. The lower PE in the industry is due to the inherent financial stress caused by delays from government agencies. Therefore, we recommend avoiding this issue.

details: Objectives of the Issue Offer for sale – Rs 568.41 cr & Fresh Issue – Rs 684.25 cr

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. Purchase of equipment – Rs 99.79 crore​​​
2. Repayment/ prepayment, in full or in part, of certain borrowings availed by the company and its subsidiaries – Rs 413.40 crore
3. General corporate purposes – Rs 171.06 crore
​

about: Ceigall India an infrastructure company specializing in construction of roads, flyovers, bridges, tunnels, highways, expressways and runways. As on date, the company has completed over 34 projects and has been operational in 10 states.

The company majorly works with state and national government bodies to win projects and execute them within the given timeline. The company operates under three business models namely EPC, Hybrid Annuity Model and Operation & maintenance model.
As of June 2024, the company had 18 ongoing projects with an order book of Rs 9,471 crore, which included elevated roads, flyovers, metro projects, expressways and multi-lane highways.
As of now, the company is eligible to bid for NHAI projects of up to Rs 5,500 crore, demonstrating strong execution history of the company.
The company’s revenue grew by 167% between FY2022 and FY2024 and stood at Rs 3,029 crore for FY2024.
In FY2024, the company’s Return on Net Worth stood at 33.57%, an improvement of 537bps from 28.20% recorded in FY2023.
For FY2024, the operating margins for the company improved to 17.09%, from 14.29% recorded in FY2023 and 16.40% recorded in FY2022.
​Profit margins for FY2024 stood at 10.05%, recording an improvement of 196bps from FY2023.
​The company has failed to generate positive cash flow from operations for the last three years. The company reported a CFO of negative Rs 211 crore in FY2024.
The company has a debt of Rs 1,066 crore as of 31st March 2024.

issue_details.Promoters: SANJEEV JAIN, SANDEEP JAIN AND AKUMS MASTER​ TRUST
