1.header: Good Financials and a unique business model
desc: The company a good growth in their topline of 21% in the last two years. The company has also reported a very good ROE as well of 27% in FY23. The company has also consistently generated positive cash flow from operations in the last three fiscal years. However, the company’s Net profit declined in FY23 due to an increase in input costs. Despite this, the company has reported a healthy net profit margin of 22% in FY23.

The company is a Contract development and manufacturing Organization and has a unique business model as the company manufactures contrast media intermediates, which are agents used to make medical images clearer while doing an X-RAY, a CT scan, or an MRI. There are 4 companies globally that have the majority of the market share in the contrast media business and Blue Jet supplies a critical starting intermediate to all these companies. The company also supplies sweeteners to Colgate. Such a customer base will give investors confidence for future financial expansion.

The only concern with the company is that the technology with respect to medical equipment is constantly evolving and the company might not be able to keep its product up to date. Another concern is that the company derives 63% of its total revenue from one customer and 75% from its top 5 customers.

The company is asking for a PE of 37.5x and a market cap-to-sales of 8x. This might seem very expensive on the face of it but the company’s ask is justified due to its unique business model. It has no comparable listed peers and we believe that the company can improve its financials going forward. Hence, we recommend subscribing to this IPO.

1.header: Good revenue growth but a major decline in net profit
desc: IRM Energy, a player in the City gas distribution business, has experienced remarkable revenue growth over the last three years, with a fivefold increase. However, the company's net profit in FY23 saw a 50% decline compared to FY22 when the company performed exceptionally well. The primary reason for this decline was the company incurring higher input costs due to geopolitical instability in Ukraine and Russia.

The company’s decline in net profit of 50% would’ve been justified if the peers experienced a similar situation but no other peer has seen a decline in net profit of such magnitude. In fact, most competitors saw a growth in net profit in FY23. Also, the ROE of the company is below average as most peers have reported an ROE of 20% or more.

In March 2023, IRM Technology's request for a PE ratio of 33x and a Market Capitalization-to-Sales ratio of 2x appears relatively high when compared to competitors. This is notable given their lower profit margins. The industry typically sees an average PE ratio of around 20 and a market cap-to-sales ratio of less than 1x. These metrics indicate limited potential for capital appreciation.

all.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/dT9yQY1WxC0?si=E40fg1KDxWiZ8YmY" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

1.header: Good growth but below industry average financials
desc: Plaza Wires is a company that has demonstrated solid financial growth over the past two years, with its revenue and net profit increasing by 12% and 33%, respectively. This growth can be attributed to a notable decrease in the company's raw material costs as a percentage of its revenue, which has led to improved profit margins. However, it's important to note that even with these improvements, Plaza Wires still lags behind its peers in terms of profit margins.

Plaza Wires operates in a highly competitive industry with numerous players, and as such, it operates in a low-margin business environment. This competitive landscape limits the company's ability to significantly expand its profit margins

An additional point of concern is the decline in the Cash flow from Operation (CFO) . While the CFO had previously shown positivity in the financials over the last two years, there has been a decline in FY23, with the CFO decreasing from Rs 11 crore to Rs 8.6 crore.
The company's family-run nature raises concerns about potential corporate governance issues. Also, the size of the issue is only Rs 71 cr which won't attract the attention of the investors.

Plaza Wires is currently seeking a Price-to-Earnings (PE) ratio of 31x and a market capitalization-to-sales ratio of 1.3x, which is relatively expensive compared to its industry peers. However, the question arises as to why the company should command such high valuations when its financial performance is not superior to that of its competitors. Hence, we advise you to avoid this IPO.

all.styick_header_txt: Valiant Labs is going public with a Fresh Issue. The issue opens on 27th September 2023.​​​​
all.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/fpd-MRlkrac?si=OHHA99BCIJe1CsLq" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

1.header: Good revenue growth but no product diversification
desc: ​The company has indeed demonstrated strong revenue growth, with a notable 36% increase over the past two years. However, this growth has not translated into a corresponding improvement in net profit, which has remained stagnant over the last three years.​

The primary concern here lies in the company's lack of product diversification. Its exclusive focus on the production of Paracetamol, an active pharmaceutical ingredient for curing cough, cold, and headache exposes it to substantial risks. The Indian pharmaceutical industry has numerous competitors producing this API. The company’s margins have declined from 16% in FY21 to 9% in FY23. While the company maintains a reasonable net profit margin, significant financial growth may remain elusive unless it diversifies its product portfolio to address other medical conditions.
Moreover, the absence of product diversification could pose a considerable risk, especially if the cost of the chemicals required to manufacture Paracetamol were to increase significantly.

The company is seeking a Price-to-Earnings (PE) ratio of 21x and a market capitalization-to-sales ratio of 1.8x. These valuations, when compared to similar publicly listed peers, appear reasonable and may offer some potential for capital appreciation. Despite the challenges of having a single product and declining margins, the company still manages to maintain an impressive Return on Equity (ROE) of 34%. In conclusion, our stance on this IPO remains neutral

all.styick_header_txt: JSW Infrastructure is going public with a Fresh Issue. The issue opens on 25th September 2023.​​​

desc: The company has reported robust financials with revenue growing by 42% in the last two years with the company not only growing its net profit but also experiencing improved margins. The company reported a Net profit Margin of 22% in FY23 as compared to 17% in FY21. The company also boasts good cash flow from operations as the company has reported a positive cash flow for three consecutive years. This gives the company the ability to expand its capacity organically and also pay back some of the debt.

In comparison to its listed competitor that is Adani Ports, the company has lower debt, and considering that the company will use the proceeds to pay back some of the debt, we believe this would help the company further expand its margins going forward. The company benefits from specific tax incentives resulting from government policies. Furthermore, it is well-positioned to capitalize on the 'Atmanirbhar' scheme, a government initiative aimed at fostering exports, which promises significant advantages for the company.

​he only concern at hand is that 52% of the company's revenue comes from related parties. Ideally, a company should generate a larger portion of its revenue from independent third-party customers. This is important because a higher reliance on third-party customers minimizes the potential for manipulation or undue influence in financial dealings.

The company is seeking a Price-to-Earnings (PE) ratio of 33x and a Market Capitalization-to-Sales (market cap to sales) ratio of 7.4x. These valuation metrics are in line with those of its competitor. Given the company's strong financial performance, we believe there is potential for investors to profit from this investment. Therefore, we recommend considering subscription to this IPO

all.styick_header_txt: Updater Services is going public with a Fresh Issue and Offer for Sale. The issue opens on 25th September 2023.​​​​

1.header: Good revenue growth but declining bottom line
desc: Despite experiencing a substantial 32% growth in revenue over the past two years, the company faced a decline in its net profit in FY23 compared to FY22. This decline in profitability is mirrored in the diminishing margins of the company, with both EBITDA and net profit margins exhibiting a downward trajectory. It's worth noting that this industry operates on narrow profit margins, with most competitors reporting profits in the range of 2% to 3% as of March 2023.

Furthermore, the company grapples with a severe employee retention issue, evident in an alarming attrition rate of 78%. This high turnover rate not only reduces overall productivity but also escalates recruitment costs, which can further erode profitability as employee expenses accounted for 65% of the total revenue in FY23.

On a positive note, the company plans to significantly reduce its debt by allocating a portion of the issue proceeds to repay a substantial portion of their existing debt, which stands at Rs 176 crore as of March 2023. However, it's important to note that this debt reduction alone may not lead to a significant expansion of their profit margins, particularly since the finance cost currently represents only a modest 0.6% of total revenue.

The company is asking for a PE of 57x and a market cap to sales of 1x which in comparison to listed peers seems very expensive. If the company is not being able to report better financials than its competitors, then why should they demand higher valuations? This leaves no room for capital appreciation and hence, we advise you to avoid this IPO

all.styick_header_txt: Manoj Vaibhav Gems and Jewellers is going public with a Fresh Issue and Offer for Sale. The issue opens on 22nd September 2023.​​​

desc: Over the past two years, the company has demonstrated commendable growth, with both its revenue and net profit consistently expanding at double-digit rates. Operating primarily in Tier-2 and Tier-3 cities, these emerging players are gradually encroaching upon market share traditionally held by established competitors.

On a positive note, the company has made significant strides in improving its cash flow from operations over the last two years. This is particularly noteworthy, considering it had posted negative cash flows in FY21 but has since rebounded into positive territory for two consecutive years.

However, a cause for concern is the notably slim profit margins prevalent in this industry, with most players struggling to maintain margins at around 4%. This predicament also applies to Manoj Vaibhav, which reported a net profit margin of 3.5% in FY23. Excluding Titan, an exception with a substantial 10% margin in its jewelry business, none of the other industry players have managed to achieve such levels of profitability.

The company is currently seeking a price-to-earnings (PE) ratio of 11x and boasts a market cap-to-sales ratio of 0.5x, which appears quite attractive when compared to its competitors, who command higher valuations. This valuation proposition suggests potential for capital appreciation. Consequently, our stance on this IPO remains neutral.

1.header: Significant growth in revenue but a loss-making company
desc: Despite the company's remarkable 6-fold increase in revenue over the past three years, it has regrettably failed to achieve profitability during any of these fiscal periods. This performance stands in stark contrast to its publicly listed counterparts, which not only report profits but also demonstrate robust profit margins. Additionally, the company's cash flow from operations has faced adversity, as it reported a negative cash flow of Rs 261 crore in FY23.

Furthermore, the company bears a substantial burden of debt on its financial records. As of March 2023, its total borrowings amounted to Rs 1710 crore. Alarmingly, the company's net debt position has deteriorated over the past two years, escalating from Rs 557 crore in FY21 to a staggering Rs 1094 crore in FY23. This significant debt load has cast a shadow on its income statement, with finance costs accounting for an exorbitant 50% of its fiscal revenue. It is improbable that the company's financial situation will witness rapid improvement given the daunting magnitude of its debt.
The company has been making losses for the last 4 years as compared to its peers who are in profit and hence, we would advise avoiding this IPO.

1.header: Significant growth in revenue and customers
desc: Yatra stands as a prominent online ticket-booking platform in the market. Over the past two years, the company has experienced notable revenue growth, but the company has only just managed to report a profit in FY23 after bearing losses in the last two years.​

Despite earning a respectable 4-star rating on the Google Play Store, Yatra lags behind some of its competitors like MakeMyTrip, Ixigo, and Cleartrip, which enjoy higher ratings. This is indicative of the fierce competition within the industry, where customers perpetually seek discounts and lucrative deals. Consequently, expanding profit margins could prove to be a challenging endeavor. Furthermore, the company's cash flow from operations has been negative, reporting negative CFO in both FY23 and FY22.

In contrast to its sole listed counterpart in India, Yatra significantly lags behind Easy My Trip, which boasts impressive ROE and ROCE figures exceeding 40%. Remarkably, Easy Trip maintains a modest price-to-earnings (PE) ratio of 48x, further underscoring the notable performance gap between the two companies.

Yatra is seeking a rather ambitious price-to-earnings (PE) ratio of 205x and a market capitalization-to-sales ratio of 5.6x. Additionally, its financial metrics, including Return on Capital Employed (ROCE) at 26%, and Return on Net Worth (RONW) at just 4%, display significant disparities, which may raise concerns among potential investors. Hence, we would recommend avoiding this IPO.

all.styick_header_txt: Samhi Hotels is going public with a Fresh Issue and Offer for Sale. The issue opens on 14th September 2023.​​​​​​​

1.header: High Occupancy Rates but still a loss-making company
desc: The entire hotel industry faced significant challenges during the COVID-19 pandemic, and its impact persisted until the end of 2021. However, the hotel industry has since witnessed a remarkable recovery, evident in the increasing occupancy rates. Samhi Hotels boasts similar occupancy rates to its publicly-listed peers, albeit its primary revenue stream derives from Midsize Hotels, resulting in a lower revenue per room.

One noteworthy downside for this company is its consistent reporting of losses. Even as other listed players in the industry managed to turn a profit in FY23, this company experienced a loss during the same year. This trend of sustained losses raises concerns and contrasts with the performance of its competitors.

The company currently maintains a Market Cap-to-Sales ratio of 3.6x, which stands in contrast to its peers who command significantly higher valuations. This presents an enticing opportunity for investors, offering considerable potential for capital appreciation.

about: Samhi Hotel is involved in the acquisition of hotels. They have acquired Hyatt Regency, Sheraton Courtyard, Hyatt Place, Fairfield, etc.
The company has a total of 4,801 keys across 31 operating hotels in multiple cities such as Bengaluru, Hyderabad, NCR, Pune, Chennai and Ahmedabad.

The company has three distinct hotel segments which are:​
1. Upper Upscale (Hyatt Regency)​
2. Upscale (Fairfield)​
3. Upper Mid Scale (Holiday inn) ​
4. Mid Scale​

1.header: Significant growth in revenue and customers
desc: In the past two years, the company has achieved remarkable growth, witnessing a more than twofold increase in revenue. However, it's worth noting that the company's reported net profit declined as compared to the previous year. This is primarily attributed to a substantial rise in the provision of gifts and rewards as part of the company's services. This uptick in rewards reflects a growing user base, as more people are discovering the value in the company's offerings.

​The company plans to allocate a significant portion of its proceeds towards acquiring new customers. This strategy aims to sustain healthy revenue growth. Looking ahead, if the rate of rewards distribution stabilizes, the company could potentially experience improved profit margins.
​It's important to mention that the company has established partnerships with numerous prominent institutions, including Tata Capital, INOX, AON, IndusInd, Tata Steel, Mazda, and many others.​

The company has no listed peers to compare to and is asking for a PE of 66x and a market cap-to-sales of 4x. This might seem expensive, but the company has a market share of 16% in prepaid cards which make up the majority of their revenue and has only one competitor in India. In that case, the company could ask for such high valuations.

details: Objectives of the Issue​ & Fresh Issue & Offer for Sale – Rs. 563 cr

about: Zaggle is a solutions provider that has multiple tie-ups with companies such as banks where they have issued more than 50 million prepaid cards. These cards reward investors for spending and help them manage their expenses.

They cater to the banking sector, healthcare, manufacturing, FMCG, infrastructure and automobile industry. The company has relations with Tata Steel, Persistent Systems, Vitech, Inox, Pitney Bowes, Wockhardt, MAZDA, PCBL.

Their core product portfolio includes::​
1. Propel – a software for employee rewards​
2. Save – a mobile application that keeps track of company expenses​​
3. CEMS – service that rewards users such as loyalty bonuses​ ​
4.Zaggle Payroll Card – It can be used to pay wage workers instead of transferring money into their accounts. They can then use these credits to spend.​​
The company’s sales saw significant growth in the last two years at 52%.
The net profit of the company dropped to 4% as compared to 11% last year. This was primarily due to a significant jump in rewards given to customers.
The company received 71% of its revenue from its existing customer base.

The customer base increased from 1,092 in FY21 to 2,411 in FY23 and only 11.4% of the total revenue came from the top 10 customers. This mitigates any concentration risk in case any customer decides not to continue.

1.header: Good topline growth but below average profitability
desc: Despite experiencing revenue growth of 43% over the past two years, the company has reported fluctuating net profit figures. Net profit for FY23 declined compared to the previous year, while other competitors not only showed growth in net profit but also achieved higher profit margins. These companies also share a very similar revenue mix, indicating that this company is underperforming in comparison.

The company's financial metrics are considerably weaker when compared to its peers, as evidenced by lower ROE and ROCE. Given the already crowded nature of this industry and the company's ongoing struggles to achieve favorable margins, we are skeptical about its potential to provide attractive returns for investors in the future.

However, there is a positive aspect to consider: the company's CFO performance has shown significant improvement over the last two years. It was in the negative in FY21 but has since grown to Rs 453 crore in FY23.

The company is requesting a P/E ratio of 39x and a market capitalization-to-sales ratio of 2x based on the March 2023 figures. This valuation is on the lower side, we believe it is justified, and there could be potential for capital appreciation. Therefore, we would maintain a neutral stance in our recommendation.

all.styick_header_txt: EMS is going public with a Fresh Issue and Offer for Sale. The issue opens on 8th September 2023.​​​​​

desc: ​The company has grown its topline and bottom line in the last two years and the company enjoys a very healthy Net Profit Margin of 21%. The ROE of the company stands at 22% as well indicating healthy profitability.

​The company derives all its revenue from government authorities and with the government pushing infrastructure projects, the company will benefit significantly. This would further improve the financials of the company going forward.

We can expect the company to see further healthy growth in their revenue as they have a robust order book of Rs 1874 crore. Moreover, the company has maintained a Net cash position over the last two years with their Net Cash being at Rs 37 crore. This gives them the ability to expand their business organically.

The company is seeking a very attractive valuation with a Price-to-Earnings of 11x and a Market Cap-to-Sales of 2.2x. This is very attractive considering the Margins of the company. all.styick_header_txt: Jupiter Hospital is going public with a Fresh Issue and Offer for Sale. The issue opens on 6th September 2023.​​​​

1.header: Healthy Financial Growth with Industry-High Metrics
desc: Jupiter Life Line has experienced tremendous growth in in both its top and bottom lines. Since FY21, the company's revenue has grown 36% faster than all its listed peers. The firm has a 23% EBITDA margin, which is among the highest in the industry.
The company operates three hospitals, two in Maharashtra and one in Madhya Pradesh. The company has received 4.5/5 internet ratings, showing that their services are on par with the major companies.

The company's occupancy rate for FY23 is 63%, which is among the highest in the business. Hospitals also have a number called Average Revenue per Occupied Bed, which is Rs 51,000, making it one of the best in the industry.
The company is seeking a PE of 53x and a Market Cap-to-Sales of 5.3x, which is reasonable when compared to its listed counterparts, and we recommend that you subscribe to this IPO.

all.styick_header_txt: Ratnaveer Precision Engineering is going public with a Fresh Issue and Offer for Sale. The issue opens on 4th September 2023.​​​

desc: The company has seen its top line and bottom line grow in the last two years mainly due to price increases, but the company has very low margins, with a net profit margin of just 5% in FY23. This is a low-margin market with a low barrier to entry, which may result in reduced company margins as more entrants enter.
For the last two years, the company has recorded a negative cash flow from operations.
The company is facing 21 tax procedures totaling Rs 20 crore, which might put further strain on its finances.
The company also relies majorly on its top two main clients, who account for 30% of overall sales. If any of these clients leave, the company's income might drop significantly in the future.

When compared to its listed peers, the company is asking for a PE of 19x and a Market Cap-to-Sales ratio of 1x. However, given the company's low margins and low barriers to entry in this industry, we recommend avoiding this IPO.

all.styick_header_txt: Rishabh Instruments is going public with a Fresh Issue and Offer for Sale. The issue opens on 30th August 2023.​​

1.header: Good Topline Growth and a Good Customer Base
desc: While the company has grown its topline by 20% in the last two years, they have failed to grow its profit at the same pace with the company’s net profit showing no growth in FY23. Despite the company showing a positive cash flow from operations in all three years, the numbers have been inconsistent. In FY21, the CFO was Rs 53 cr which declined to Rs 14 cr in FY22 and then improved to Rs 28 cr in FY23.

The company has a diverse customer base and caters to several big players, with only 31% of its revenue coming from the top ten customers, including ABB and Siemens. The company has very good margins, with an EBITDA margin of 15% and a Net Profit Margin of 8.5%, but we feel the company can improve these metrics.

With a PE of 33x and a Market Cap-to-Sales of 2.9x, the company is demanding a rich valuation. Unfortunately, there are no listed peers for a meaningful comparison, but we are neutral on this call based on the firm's ability to achieve good net profit margins.

The company is fairly priced, with a PE of 13x and a Market Cap-to-Sales ratio of 1.1x, which is comparable to what its peers are valued at. We feel that this company will gain from the government's reforms, hence we recommend subscribing to this IPO.

all.styick_header_txt: Aeroflex Industries is going public with a Fresh Issue and Offer for Sale. The issue opens on 22nd August 2023.​

desc: Despite having a revenue growth of 23% over the last three years and a Net Profit Margin of 11% in FY23, the company's Margin has decreased when compared to FY22. Even their cash flow from operations saw a surge in FY22 before declining significantly in FY23. Such inconsistency in performance does not give a good impression for future growth.
The company obtains 48% of its raw supplies from China, putting them at serious risk if this supplier raises costs or cannot supply to them. This dependence can place a strain on their finances.

The company is asking for a PE of 46x and a Market Cap-to-Sales of 5.2x in March 2023, which we believe is very expensive. Despite a Net Profit Margin of 11%, the company is not in a position to command such high valuations. As a result, we recommend that you avoid this IPO.

all.styick_header_txt: SBFC Finance is going public with a Fresh Issue and Offer for Sale. The issue opens on 3rd August 2023.

1.header: Despite Good Financials But Below Industry Average
desc: The company's loan book has risen by 49% in the last two years, and the company's product mix has shifted to a higher allocation of loans to MSME. MSME loans are regarded as riskier than gold loans as gold loans contain collateral, but entrepreneurs and individual borrowers rely on their businesses to generate continuous cash flows in order to repay. With this combination, their net profit margin has improved, but they still have a long way to catch up with their competitors.
The company's Net Interest Margin (NIM) is 9.2%, and it has been declining over the last two years. In contrast, its competitors' metrics have improved during this period.
At 2.92%, the company has one of the lowest ROAs in the industry.

The company is demanding a PB of 3x at the upper price band, which we consider expensive given their industry-low ROA. This does not leave scope for capital appreciation. Hence, we suggest avoiding this IPO.

details: Fresh Issue & Offer for Sale – Rs. 1025cr

about: SBFC Finance Ltd is a non-deposit-taking non-banking finance company that provides secured MSME loans and loans against gold.
Most of their borrowers are entrepreneurs, small business owners, self-employed people, salaried people, and working individuals.
They have one of the greatest assets under management growth rates among MSME-focused NBFCs in India.
They have a diverse pan-India presence and a large network. The company has a presence in 120 locations, with a focus on Tier II and Tier III cities.
The company’s revenue has grown at a CAGR of 19% in the last two years.
In FY23, despite posting a net profit margin of 20%, the company’s ROE is 9.93% , and the RONW of the company is 7.82%. The company has a healthy ROA at 2.92%.
The Net profit Margin is at 20%, compared to 12% in the previous year.
The company’s Gross NPA and Net NPA stand at 2.4% and 1.4%, which is higher than most of its peers.

all.styick_header_txt: Yatharth Hospital is going public with a Fresh Issue and Offer for Sale. The issue opens on 26th July 2023.

desc: In the last two years, Yatharth Hospital has had good margins and impressive revenue growth. Despite continuously decreasing EBITDA margins over the last two years, they have higher margins than most of their peers.

In the last two years, the company has also onboarded more doctors, and despite Covid-19 medicines accounting for 32% of revenues in FY21 and no longer contributing to revenue in FY23, the company has done a good job expanding its revenue by growing in every other specialty that the company offers.

The company is a consistent performer, as seen by its ROCE increasing from 18% in FY21 to 26% in FY23 during the last two years. Furthermore, the company has achieved positive cash flows over the last three fiscal years.

The company is demanding a PE of 39x and a Market Cap-to-Sales of 4.9x based on March 2023 sales, which is high but appears reasonable given that the other companies in this industry all command high PEs. We recommend subscribing to this IPO because we anticipate this company can sustain this growth going forward.

The company has generated consistent positive cash flows in the last 3 fiscal years
In FY23, The company’s ROE is 36% , the ROCE of the company is 26%, and the RONW of the company is 36%, indicating strong financials.
The company only falls short in terms of occupancy rates, which are low when compared to its contemporaries, although its peers are well-established.

all.styick_header_txt: Netweb Technologies is going public with a Fresh Issue and an Offer for Sale. The issue opens on 17th July 2023.

desc: It will trade at a P/E of 60x based on the upper price range, and its Market cap-to-sales is 6.3x based on March 2023 revenues. This is a highly rich valuation that does not allow for enough capital appreciation from the present level.

In addition, the company's employee cost as a percentage of sales is 7%, and depreciation cost as a percentage of sales is 1%, leading us to believe that the company is not employing any high-tech fixed assets or providing services requiring highly skilled labor; if this is the case, we are unsure why this company commands such rich valuations.

However, given the renewed interest in the IT industry, there is a chance that this company will provide investors with listing gains. It may be crucial to understand how this company will continue to expand in the future.

Furthermore, this company must de-risk its business from the government because it may stay volatile in the future, affecting its growth. As a result, we are neutral in this case given the listing gains and sector tailwinds, but we are concerned about the rich valuations.

details: Fresh Issue – Rs. 206cr
Offer for Sale – Rs. 425cr

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. Funding capital expenditure requirements for civil construction of the Surface Mount Technology (SMT) line building and interior development and equipment purchase for the new SMT production line.
2. Funding long-term working capital requirement
3. Repayment or pre-payment, in full or in part, of certain of our outstanding borrowings​
4. General Corporate Purposes

about: The company provides its customers with high-end computing solutions.

Its offerings include::
1. High-performance computing systems​
2. Private cloud and hyper-converged infrastructure
3. AI systems and enterprise workstations
4. High-performance storage solutions​
5. Data center servers
Over 300 Supercomputing systems, 50 private cloud installations, 4000 accelerator/GPU based AI systems, and corporate workstations have been installed by the company.

headervalue:
Software and service for our HSC
offerings​​​

about: Over the last two years, the company's sales increased by 76%.
Following a year of negative cash flow from operations in FY21, the company has generated positive cash flow from operations for two subsequent years.
But despite showing an EBIDTA of Rs 70 crore, the cash flow from operations was only 27 crores indicating that the business is struggling to convert income in cash.
The company’s order book has shown healthy growth in the last 14 months, the current order book as of May 2023 is Rs 90.2 crore, compared to Rs 48.5 crore in March 2022.
In the last two years, the company has been able to expand its net profit margin from 5% in FY21 to 10% in FY23.

all.styick_header_txt: Utkarsh Small Bank is going public with a Fresh Issue. The issue opens on 12th July 2023.

desc: The company’s financials have been robust as it has grown its revenue by 28% over two years and has maintained healthy profit margins. Over the last two years, the company’s advances and deposits have grown significantly, and have done well to operate at a Net Interest Margin of 9.57%.

The company has been efficient with its assets, as seen by its ROA of 2.37%, which is the second-best among its peers. Over the previous two years, the company has diversified its product portfolio by decreasing its commitment to microfinance and boosting it to retail and wholesale loans.

The company is doing well in terms of cost savings, and its deposit costs have decreased despite a higher interest rate environment in which depositors have begun to prefer term deposits that pay higher interest rates. The company's net profit was low in FY22 due to Covid but then climbed significantly in FY23. We expect the company to sustain this going forward.
Based on the upper price band, it will trade at a P/B of 1.11x, the lowest among its peers despite having one of the highest ROAs.
We believe the company can provide good capital appreciation.

details: Fresh Issue – Rs. 500cr
Increasing Tier-1 Capital base to meet future capital requirement​
Meeting the expenses related with the issue

about: Utkarsh Small Finance Bank is a private bank that primarily lends to individuals and businesses.

Their product mix includes:
1. Microfinancing
2. Vehicle Loans
3. Mortgage Loans
4. MSME
5. Large & Mid-corporate Loans
​
In the last two years, the company's deposits have increased by 35% and its advances have increased by 26%.
Over the last two years, the company's sales increased by 26%, the highest among its peers.​​
After having negative cash flow from operations in FY21, the company has generated positive cash flow from operations for the two subsequent years.
The company’s Loan book and Advances grew significantly in the last two years.
In the last two years, the company has been able to expand its profitability, evident by the expansion of its Net Interest Margin.
Despite having one of the best ROAs among its rivals, the company has the lowest PB ratio.

all.styick_header_txt: Senco Gold is going public with a Fresh Issue and Offer for Sale. The issue opens on 4th July 2023.

1.header: Low Margins and Negative Cash flows
desc: The gold jewellery business has great potential as unorganized players will cede market share to organized players. Despite this Senco enjoys a very low margin. When compared to its listed peers, the company had the lowest CAGR growth in revenue. Furthermore, the company has experienced negative cash flows for the past two years in a row.

Senco Gold does not own the brand name, and the retired partners may use it for their own businesses. This, we believe, may not allow the company to command a higher price-to-earnings ratio than its peers.

Based on the upper price band, the company will have a market capitalization of Rs 2462 crore. For the year ended March 2023, the company reported sales of Rs 4077 crore, resulting in a market cap-to-sales ratio of 0.6x. The company reported a net profit of Rs 158 crore, resulting in a PE ratio of 16x. We believe that the company's reasonable valuation provides scope for capital appreciation. However, with the exception of Titan, none of the jewellery firms have consistently provided capital appreciation for investors. Hence, we recommend a neutral rating for the company.

details: Fresh Issue – Rs. 405cr
Funding Working Capital Requirements​
General Corporate Purposes

about: Senco Gold is in the business of selling jewellery.​

The company's primary products include gold and diamond jewellery, as well as silver, platinum, precious and semi-precious stones, and other metals. The company also sells costume jewellery, gold and silver coins, and silver kitchenware.​
They offer a catalogue of 120,000 gold jewellery designs and 46,000 diamond jewellery designs manufactured in-house.
Everlite, Vivaha, Aham, and Ileana are among their brands.
The company's sales growth over the last two years was 24%, which was lower than its peers.

Despite having achieved a positive cash flow of Rs 1800 crore in FY21, the company has struggled to maintain this performance and has since experienced a negative cash flow from operations in successive financial years.
The company’s total borrowings in FY23, which is Rs 1177 crore, has more than doubled from Rs 532 crore in FY21.​​

all.styick_header_txt: Cyient DLM is going public with a Fresh Issue. The issue opens on 27th June 2023.
all.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/JkOG8d_lpa8" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

1.header: Customer Concentration and a Decline In the Number of Customers
desc: Cyient DLM's main worry is its reliance on a small number of customers with whom it has long-standing ties. Its top five customers generate around 68% of its revenue, while the top ten customers contribute to 91% of the revenue. The loss of a key customer could have a considerable influence on the company's financial health in this case. Furthermore, the number of active consumers fell from 50 in FY2022 to 35 in FY2023, indicating substantial decline within a single financial year, which is an unfavorable trend.

2.header: Higher Working Capital Requirements and Poor Financial Growth​
desc: Another issue faced by Cyient DLM is its elevated working capital requirement, which adversely affects its cash flow from operations and profit margins. Despite a 15% increase in revenue to Rs 832 crore in FY2023, the company experienced a 20% decline in net profit to Rs 31.7 crore. Compared to its peers, Cyient DLM has the lowest net profit margin (NPM).

Interestingly, although Cyient DLM lacks a unique business model with higher margins typically associated with companies commanding premium valuations, it still seeks a price-to-earnings (P/E) ratio of 66x based on the upper band. This ambitious valuation leaves limited room for capital appreciation.

details: Fresh Issue – Rs. 592cr
Funding incremental working capital requirements of the company.
Funding capital expenditure of the company.
Repayment/prepayment of some of its borrowings debts, in part or in whole.
Achieving inorganic growth through acquisitions.
General corporate purposes.

about: Cyient DLM is a subsidiary of Cyient Limited.
It provides electronic manufacturing services and solutions to the aerospace, defense, medical technology, and industrial sectors.​

Their Solutions include :
1. Printed Circuit Boards​
2. Cable Harnesses​
3. Box Builds​
Most of the the company’s revenue comes from manufacturing and assembling PCBs and manufacturing box builds. They collaborate with their clients in accordance with their requirements.
​In FY23, the company reported a revenue of Rs. 832 crore and a net profit of Rs. 32 crore.
In FY22, the company reported a revenue of Rs. 721 crore and a net profit of Rs. 40 crore.
In FY23, the company reported a RONW of 16%, down from 51.61% in FY22 and 31.38% in FY21.
The ROCE of the company was 13.48% in FY23, down from 17.56% in FY22.

all.styick_header_txt: IdeaForge Technology is going public with a Fresh Issue and an Offer for Sale. The issue opens on 26th June 2023.
all.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/mf6OsktQ_0s" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: The drone industry is poised for significant growth, with manifold expansion in use cases expected in the coming years. The demand for drones remains high, but there is also an anticipated increase in supply.

Idea Forge is one of 12 companies eligible for incentives in drone manufacturing under the government's PLI scheme. However, the increasing competition in this segment may limit future margin expansion.
Idea Forge's financial performance has been inconsistent. Despite higher sales of Rs 186 crore in FY2023, compared to Rs 159 crore in FY2022, net profit declined to Rs 32 crore from Rs 44 crore.
The company's borrowings increased significantly to Rs 86 crore in FY2023, and its return on net worth (RONW) stands at a modest 10%.
In addition, the order book also decreased from Rs 311 crore in FY2022 to Rs 192 crore.

During a visit to the company's plant, it was observed that basic assembly operations were being carried out, which do not require highly skilled labor. If this is the case, why should the company command higher valuations?

Based on the upper band, the company's market capitalization is expected to reach Rs 2560 crore, which we believe is an overvaluation, considering a market cap-to-sales ratio of 14x and a P/E ratio of 80x.
While short-term gains through listing may be possible due to the industry's attractiveness, doubts remain regarding long-term wealth creation.
Although the company's management has rejected these charges, such unfavorable sentiment might have an influence on the premium that its stock commands in the market.

details: Fresh Issue – Rs. 240cr & Offer for Sale Rs. 327cr
Funds received from the Offer for Sale will not be used by the firm.
Repayment/prepayment of certain indebtedness availed by the company
Funding working capital requirements
Investment in product development
General corporate purposes.

about: ​With a market share of 50% in the Indian Unmanned Aircraft Systems (drones) market, IdeaForge Technology caters primarily to the civil and defense sectors.
They invent, design, and deliver customer-centric offerings in terms of products as well as software solutions.
They primarily cater to customers who want surveillance, mapping, and surveying applications.
The defense segment accounts for 69% of its turnover in FY23.​
The company has a price range of drones from Rs 5 lakhs to Rs 75 lakhs
In FY23, the company reported a revenue of Rs. 186 crore and a net profit of Rs. 32 crore.
In FY22, the company reported a revenue of Rs. 159 crore and a net profit of Rs 44 crore
In FY23, the company reported a RONW of 9.85%, down from 26.95% in FY22 and up from ​-24.48% in FY21.
The order book declined to Rs 192 crore in FY23 from Rs 311 crore in FY22.

all.styick_header_txt: HMA Agro is going public with a Fresh issue and an Offer for Sale. The issue opens on 20th June 2023.
all.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/-OObHCguWzM" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

1.header: Indian Buffalo Meat Commands Lower Price
desc: HMA Agro competes in the international market with companies from the United States, Australia, and emerging nations like Argentina and Brazil. However, due to quality concerns, Indian buffalo meat does not attract the same price as rival countries. This inhibits both the industry's and HMA Agro's value and volume growth.

HMA Agro has provided a Rs 545 crore guarantee for group companies. This could be one of the factors working against the company. Investors may be uneasy about such a high-value guarantee granted to group companies, which could influence HMA Agro's financials.

The industry has a low margin --  operating margin of about 6%, which fluctuates. Besides, the company has low volume growth and erratic realization that may not attract the interest of investors. Based on FY2022 net profit, the company is seeking a PE of 25x, leaving little room for capital appreciation. There are no publicly traded companies in the same industry, hence there is no benchmark to compare. In FY22, the company recorded a negative cash flow from operations. This is yet another issue that could impact its valuation.

details: Fresh Issue – Rs.150cr & Offer for Sale Rs.330cr
Funds received from the Offer for Sale will not be used by the firm
Working Capital Requirements of the Company​
General Corporate Purposes​

about: HMA Agro Industries Limited, founded in 2008, is involved in the export of beef.

HMA Group has been in the meat industry for more than four decades. They are one of India's leading exporters of frozen buffalo meat products, accounting for more than 10% of the country's total frozen buffalo meat exports.
In order to broaden its range, the company recently introduced frozen fish items and basmati rice.
Their primary beef brands are Black Gold, HMA, and Kamil.
In 9 months till December 2022, the company reported a revenue of Rs. 2370 crore and a net profit of Rs. 113 crore.
In FY22, the company reported a revenue of Rs. 3083 crore, compared to Rs. 1707 crore in FY21.
The company reported a net profit of Rs 118 crore in FY2022, compared to Rs 72 crore, a growth of 64 percent.
In FY22, the company reported a RONW of 30.93%, up from 27.68% in FY21 and 24.54% in FY20.

all.styick_header_txt: IKIO Lighting is going public with a Fresh issue and an Offer for Sale. The issue opens on 6th June 2023.
all.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/xIJ7_97i5c4" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

1.header: Single Customer Accounts For More Than 50 Percent Of The Sales
desc: The LED industry is highly competitive, which may affect profit margins in the future. One area of concern is that a significant portion of their revenue, more than 50%, comes from a single customer, formerly known as Philips India and now called Signify. Relying heavily on a single customer puts the business at risk and makes it vulnerable.

The post-issue market capitalization of the company is projected to be Rs 2100 crore. With annual sales of Rs 220 crore as of March 2022, the company's market capitalization to sales ratio would be approximately 10x, which is quite high. Even if we consider the sales for the first nine months of FY23 and annualize them, the market capitalization to sales ratio would still be around 6.5x. Furthermore, the PE ratio, based on the FY22 numbers, is calculated to be 75x. These valuation metrics make us uneasy and lead us to believe that the company may not generate long-term wealth for its investors.

details: Fresh Issue – Rs.350cr & Offer for Sale Rs.257cr
Funds received from the Offer for Sale will not be used by the firm
Repayment/prepayment, in full or part, of certain borrowings availed by the Company and its Subsidiaries on a consolidated basis
Investment in its wholly-owned subsidiary, IKIO Solutions Private Limited, for setting up a new facility at Noida, Uttar Pradesh
General corporate purposes.

Number of Equity Shares
for OFS

about: IKIO Lighting is an LED lighting solutions manufacturer. They are an original design manufacturer because they design, develop, manufacture, and supply products to clients who resell them under their own brand names.
Their products include: LED Lighting ​,Refrigeration Lights,ABS Piping​
IKIO also collaborates with customers by creating products based on their designs.
The top ten customers contributed 86% of total revenue, while the top twenty customers contributed 91%.
In 9 months till December 2022, the company reported a revenue of Rs. 243 crore and a net profit of Rs. 35 crore.
In FY22, the company reported a revenue of Rs. 221 crore as compared to Rs. 160 crore in FY21.
​The company reported a net profit of Rs 28 crore in FY2022 compared to Rs 21 crore, a growth of 33 percent.

all.styick_header_txt: Nexus Select Trust is going public with a Fresh Issue and an Offer for Sale. The issue opens on 9th May 2023.
all.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/tnXLvfzv0vI" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

1.header: REITs as an Asset Class Have Failed to Grab the Interest of Investors
desc: Three REITs are listed on exchanges, and all three have fallen short of expectations. One of the basic presumptions is that they pay good dividend, which is correct, but one should never invest in assets like REITs solely for the dividend because capital erosion results in poor total returns. Nexus, we feel, might face a similar fate.

While three of the listed REITs are in the office space category, Nexus is in retail malls. Nexus reported losses in FY2022, while the other three claimed profits. The company posted a net profit of Rs 257 crore in the first nine months. For our comfort, we would have preferred more consistent financial performance from Nexus. It requires a Market Cap-to-Sales ratio of 11.5x, which is quite high.

details: Fresh Issue of Rs 1400 crore and Offer for Sale of Rs 1800 crore totaling Rs. 3200cr
The funds collected from the Offer for Sale will not be used by the company.
Partial or full repayment or prepayment and redemption of certain financial indebtedness of Asset SPVs and the Investment Entity​
Acquisition of stake and redemption of debt securities in certain Asset SPVs; and
General purposes

about: Nexus Select Trust is a Real Estate Investment Trust with malls in 14 Indian locations.

As of December 31, 2022, its Portfolio included 17 best-in-class Grade A urban consumption centers with a total leasable area of 9.2 msf, two complementary hotel assets (354 keys), and three office assets (1.3 msf).
They own the country's largest portfolio of consumption centers.
In 9 months till December 2022, the company reported a revenue of Rs. 1463 crore and a net profit of Rs. 257 crore.
In FY22, the company reported a revenue of Rs. 1318 crore, compared to Rs. 907 crore of FY21.
The company reported net loss of Rs 110 crore in FY2022, compared to loss of Rs 199 crore.

all.styick_header_txt: Mankind Pharma is going public with an Offer for Sale. The issue opens on 25th April 2023.

1.header: Low Room for Capital Appreciation and Little Exposure to US Markets
desc: Mankind Pharma has good sales and profitability, but it demands a high price, leaving little room for capital appreciation. 97% of their revenue comes from India, whereas most of their competitors' revenue comes from the United States.

The market cap to sales ratio is 5.5x, but Sun Pharma has a comparable market cap to sales ratio, leaving little room for capital appreciation. Their ROE has decreased to 14% in 9MFY23 from 21% in 9MFY22, and they have several linked party transactions, due to which we have a Neutral stance on this company.

details: Offer for Sale Rs. 4326cr
The funds collected from the Offer for Sale will not be used by the company.
Achieve the benefits of listing the equities on the stock exchange

about: Mankind Pharma develops, manufactures, and markets a wide range of pharmaceutical formulations in acute and chronic therapeutic areas, as well as several consumer healthcare items.
They are focused on the domestic market, with India accounting for 98% of their income.
​The pharmaceuticals business accounts for 90% of its revenue, while the consumer business accounts for 10%.
They have created 36 brands in the pharmaceutical business, each of which has reached over 50 crore in domestic sales in the last 12 months till December 2022.
In 9 months till December 2022, the company reported a revenue of Rs. 6697 crore and a net profit of Rs. 1016 crore.
​In FY22, the company reported a revenue of Rs. 7782 crore, compared to Rs. 6214 crore of FY21.
The company reported net profit of Rs 1453 crore in FY2022, compared to Rs 1293 crore, a growth of 12.4 per cent.
In FY22, the company reported a RONW of 23.3%, down from 26.8% in FY21 and 29.6% in FY20.

all.styick_header_txt: Avalon Technologies is going public with a Fresh issue and an Offer for Sale. The issue opens on 3rd April 2023.
all.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/uH0_slBQd0A" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: Avalon Technologies operates in a highly competitive industry with rapid technological developments. As a result, we believe that the company's future financials may be impacted. Investors may be put off by companies that have no financial growth. Even though the company's sales increased over the same period last year in the first eight months of FY 2023, its net profit declined.

The company's competitors include Dixon, Amber, and Kaynes Tech. In the past, the industry was valued highly due to its distinctive business strategy and limited number of listed players. Yet that is no longer the case. Based on March 2022 figures, the company is requesting a market cap to sales ratio of 3.38x and a price-to-earnings multiple of 42x (based on FY22 net profit). This does not leave scope for capital appreciation. In light of this, we believe that the company may not be a medium- to long-term wealth creator.

details:
Objectives of the Issue Fresh Issue – Rs.320cr & Offer for Sale Rs.545cr
The funds collected from the Offer for Sale will not be used by the company
1. Prepayment or repayment of all or a portion of certain outstanding borrowing of the company and its subsidiary -  Rs 145cr.
2. Funding working capital requirements of the firm – Rs 90cr.​​
3. General corporate purposes.

about: Avalon Technologies is one of the leading fully integrated electronic manufacturing services companies in India, with end-to-end operations supplying box build solutions with an emphasis on high-value precision-built products.
Printed circuit board design
Box build of electronic systems to global OEM’s.
Other capabilities include cable assembly and wire harnesses, sheet metal fabrication, machining, magnetics and injection molded plastics
Customers include Kyosan India Private Limited, Zonar Systems Inc., Collins Aerospace, e-Infochips Private Limited, The US Malabar Company and Systech Corporation.
In 8 months till November 2022, the company reported a revenue of Rs. 597 crore and a net profit of Rs. 34 crore.

all.styick_header_txt: UDAYSHIVKUMAR INFRA LIMITED is going public with a Fresh issue . The issue opens on 20th March 2023.
all.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/38jIMTUzRk0" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

1.header: One State Alone Accounts For All Revenues
desc: The majority of the company's revenue comes from the state of Karnataka, and within that, primarily from local governments. The change in leadership or in state policy could have a significant impact on the company's income. Yet, the company is relatively small, with March 2022 sales of Rs 186 crore. However, the promoter provided the company a loan of up to Rs 58 crores. This loan was repaid by the end of the year, but it does suggest that the company may have working capital concerns. The promoter has also provided a loan to the company in the past.

2.header: ​A Microcap Company Will Not Attract the Interest Of Institutional Investors​
desc: Based on the higher price band, Udayshivakumar Infra will have a market capitalization of Rs 186 crore. This market capitalization is insufficient to excite institutional investors. Thus, institutional investors would not be interested.​

The current market sentiment is extremely negative. At this period, only companies with a distinctive business plan or reputable promoters can help create wealth. Unfortunately, Udayshivakumar Infra lacks a unique business model, and the investing community is unfamiliar with the company's promoters. This increases the likelihood that the company will not do well after its listing.​

details: The Objectives of the Offer are to:
1. Funding the company's increased working capital requirements, amounting to Rs. 45 Crores.
2. General corporate purposes.​​​

about: Udayshivkumar Infra is in the road construction business, which includes National Highways, State Highways, District Roads, Smart Roads (IOT-based roads with sensors, cameras, radar, and 5G equipped technology), and so on.

The company's primary projects include Smart Roads under PM’s Smart City Mission projects, Smart Roads under Municipal Corporations, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagar Palike (BBMP), and Local Area Roads in various Taluka Areas in Karnataka.
The company bids on Highways, Bridges, Irrigation & Canals, and Industrial Area Construction throughout Karnataka, including Government Departments.
Since Fiscal 2015, the company has executed 30 projects totaling Rs. 685 crores.
As of December 31, 2022, the company was working on 30 current projects with a total order book value of Rs. 854 Crores.
In the future, the company plans to form joint ventures with other infrastructure companies in the industry to bid on and execute larger projects.
In H1 FY23, the company reported a revenue of Rs. 107 crore and a net profit of Rs. 10 crore. ​
​In FY22, the company reported a revenue of Rs. 186 crore, compared to Rs. 210 crore in FY21.
The company reported net profit of Rs 12 crore in FY22, compared to Rs 9 crore in FY21,  a growth of 33 per cent.
In FY22, the company reported a RoNW of 17.78%, up from 16.59% in FY21.​

all.styick_header_txt: GLOBAL SURFACES is going public with a Fresh issue and an Offer for Sale. The issue opens on 13th March 2023.
