1.header: Revenue Dependence on a Few Customers:
desc: The company's sales are concentrated in a few customers, with the top three customers accounting for 65% of total revenue in FY 2022.
Because the company is reliant on a small number of customers, it is vulnerable to income loss if any of these customers decides to discontinue in the future.

The company reported sales of Rs 190 crore and a net profit of Rs 36 crore, for the year ended March 2022. If the first six months of FY2023 are annualized, sales will be Rs 196 crore and net profit will be Rs 28 crore. The company is aiming for Rs 593 crore in valuation at the upper price band.
The company's market cap-to-sales ratio is 3.1x. This is excessive in comparison to the other listed players.
​The sector does not pique the interest of investors. As a result, there is a strong likelihood that the company will be unable to create wealth for its investors.

details: The Objectives of the Offer are to:

1. Investment of Rs. 90 crores in the wholly-owned subsidiary Global Surfaces FZE to help finance the capital expenditures related with the setting up of an engineered quartz production plant in Jebel Ali Free Zone, Dubai, UAE.
2. General corporate purposes.​​

about: Global Surfaces is a company that processes natural stones and manufactures engineered quartz.
The company has two manufacturing plants, both of which are in Jaipur, Rajasthan.
The company's diverse products are used in flooring, wall cladding, countertops, cut-to-size goods, and other applications.
For fiscal years 2020, 2021, and 2022, the company earned 99% of its revenue from exports and 98% of its income from exports during the period ended September 2022.
The company exports its products to key regions such as the United States, Canada, Australia, and the Middle East.
Natural stone segment capacity usage is 29% in fiscal 2021-22, whereas quartz segment capacity utilization is 69%.
In H1 FY23, the company reported a revenue of Rs. 98 crore and a net profit of Rs. 14 crore. ​
In FY22, the company reported a revenue of Rs. 190 crore compared to Rs. 175 crore in FY21.
The company reported net profit of Rs 36 crore in FY2022 compared to Rs 34 crore, a growth of 6 per cent.
In FY22, the company reported a RoNW of 32.51%, down from 34.47% in FY21 and 26.59% in FY20.

all.styick_header_txt: DIVGI TORQTRANSFER is going public with a Fresh issue and an Offer for Sale. The issue opens on 1st March 2023.
all.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/4Odshc3io_M" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

1.header: Heavily Dependent on a Single Customer
desc: The company sells its goods to original equipment manufacturers (OEMs). The top five clients accounted for 91 percent of revenue in FY2022, and this grew to 93 percent in the first six months of FY2023.
In FY2022, one customer accounted for 54% of sales; in the first half of FY2023, that figure increased to 74%.
Due to the company's reliance on a single customer, it is vulnerable to income loss if that customer experiences problems or discontinues purchasing the product.

One of the top five customers was from Russia.  The agreement with the Russian company ended, and as a result, the company reported no revenue from the Russian company in the first six months of the current financial year. This could have an impact on the company's future growth.

The company reported sales of Rs 242 crore and a net profit of Rs 46 crore for the year ended March 2022. If we annualize the first six months of FY2023, sales will be Rs 274 crore and net profit will be Rs 52 crore. The company is aiming for Rs 1804 crore in valuation at the upper price band. This results in a P/E ratio of 35x and a market cap-to-sales ratio of 6.6x. We feel it is unreasonable for a company of this size to command such high valuations, especially given its reliance on a single customer.
We believe the company is asking for an excessively high premium that is unjustifiable. Please avoid subscribing to the IPO.

details: The Objectives of the Offer are to:
1. Funding capital expenditures of Rs. 150 crore for the purchase of equipment/machinery for manufacturing facilities.
2. General corporate purposes.​

headervalue: Oman India Joint Investment Fund II

about: Divgi Torque Systems is among the very few suppliers in India capable of developing and supplying system-level transfer cases, torque couplers, and DCT systems (Dual Clutch Transmission, a hybrid of automatic and manual transmission).
The company also has the capability to develop and provide transmission systems for electric vehicles.

The company makes and distributes a wide range of products in the following broad categories:
  • i. Torque transfer systems ​
  • ii. Manual transmission and DCT synchronizer systems;​
    • iii. Components for the above-mentioned product categories;
​Customers include Mahindra & Mahindra, Tata Motors, Toyota Kirloskar, BorgWarner, and one Russian business.
The company did not make any sales in FY2023, as the Russian company agreement had expired.
In H1 FY23, the company reported a revenue of Rs. 134 crore and a net profit of Rs. 26 crore.
In FY22, the company reported a revenue of Rs. 234 crore as compared to Rs. 187 crore of FY21.
The company reported net profit of Rs 46 crore in FY2022 compared to Rs 38 crore, a growth of 22 per cent.
In FY22, the company reported a RONW of 13.57%, up from 12.86% in FY21 and 13.38% in FY20.​

all.styick_header_txt: SAH POLYMERS is going public with a Fresh issue. The issue opens on 30th December 2022.
all.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/oT-LLgoFxoQ" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: Sah Polymers is a low-margin packaging business where competition is fierce. Because there are no entry barriers, the company will always have to contend with low RONW.

The company's revenue for FY 2022 is Rs 81 crore, with a net profit of Rs 4 crore. However, it only made Rs 1 crore in profit in 2021. It is a small company that has yet to demonstrate financial consistency.
Its RONW was poor, at 2% and 6% for FY2020 and FY2021, respectively. It moved up to 16% in FY2022, but it is unclear how long it will be sustainable.

The sector does not enjoy great fancy from investors and yet Sah Polymers wants an extremely rich valuation. Its post-issue market cap (based on the upper price band) would be Rs 167 crore, while its total revenue for FY2022 was a mere Rs 81 crore. This gives a market cap to sales ratio of more than 2x. Other competitors, such as Jumbo Bag, quote a market cap to sales ratio of 0.14x.
Based on the net profit of FY2022, it is asking a P/E of 41.7x, while the peer group is struggling to command even 20 P/E. We will not be surprised if the company performs poorly post the listing.

details: The Objectives of the Offer are to:
1. Setting up a new manufacturing facility to manufacture a new variant of Flexible Intermediate Bulk Containers (FIBC).
2. Repayment of certain secured and unsecured borrowings.
3. Funding the company's working capital requirements.
4. General corporate purposes.
objective.headertext: Shareholding Pattern of Sat Investment Private Limited (Promoter)

about: Sah Polymers is an ISO-certified company that provides business-to-business manufacturers with customized bulk packaging solutions.
It serves a wide range of industries, including agro pesticides, basic drugs, cement, chemicals, fertilisers, and many more.
The company also manufactures and sells Polypropylene (PP) / High Density Polyethylene (HDPE) FIBC bags, woven sacks, and HDPE/PP woven fabrics.
The company is divided into two business divisions: (1) domestic sales and (2) exports.

In India, the company has a presence in 5 states and 1 union territory, while internationally, the company exports its products to Algeria, Togo, Ghana, Poland, Portugal, France, Italy, USA, Australia, UAE, UK, and Ireland.
The company has one manufacturing facility with an installed production capacity of 3960 m.t. p.a located at Udaipur, Rajasthan.
In Q1 FY23, the company reported a revenue of Rs. 28 crore and a net profit of Rs. 1 crore.
In FY22, the company reported a revenue of Rs. 81 crore from Rs. 55 crore in FY21, and net profit increased to Rs 4 crore, up from Rs 1 crore in the same period.
In FY22, the company reported a RONW of 16.42%, up from 6.33% in FY21.

all.styick_header_txt: RADIANT CASH MANAGEMENT SERVICES is going public with Fresh Issue and an Offer for Sale. The issue opens on 23rd December 2022.
all.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/8cw6I_Re220" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: Radiant is in the business of cash pickup and delivery or cash processing. Banks and ecommerce companies are among its clients.
With UPI payments becoming more popular, we believe the industry will see slower growth in the future. RBI digital currency would dampen business prospects even more.

Based on the upper price band, the company would have a market cap of Rs. 1062 crore, which we believe is excessively high valuation when compared to other listed players with similar business models.
Based on FY2022 earnings, the company is aiming for a P/E of 28x and a market cap to income ratio of 3.7x. The valuation is high on both parameters, with no room for capital appreciation.

details: The Objectives of the Offer are to:
1. Fund working capital requirements.
2. Fund capital expenditure requirements to purchase specially fabricated armored vans.
3. Be used for general corporate purposes.

about: Radiant Cash Management is an integrated cash logistics player with a strong presence in India's Retail Cash Management ("RCM") segment of the cash management services industry.
With approximately 55,513 touch points serving more than 5,388 locations, the company provides services across 13,044 pin codes in India, covering all districts.
The company meets a variety of cash management outsourcing needs for banks, financial institutions, organised retail, and e-commerce businesses in India.
The company conducts business in five major segments: 1) Cash pick-up and delivery 2) Network currency management 3) Cash processing 4) Cash vans/cash in transit; and 5) Other value-added services.
Clients include some of India's largest private and public sector banks, including Axis Bank, Citibank, Deutsche Bank Limited, HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank, Kotak Mahindra Bank, and State Bank of India.
In Q1 FY23, the company reported a revenue of Rs. 84 crore and a net profit of Rs. 15 crore.
In FY22, the company reported a revenue of Rs. 287 crore from Rs. 224 crore in FY21, but net profit increased marginally to Rs 38 crore up from Rs 32 crore in the same period.
In FY22, the company reported a RONW of 27.34%, up from 25.52% in FY21 though it was higher in FY 20 30.53%.

all.styick_header_txt: ELIN ELECTRONICS is going public with Fresh issue and an Offer for Sale. The issue opens on 20th December 2022.
all.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/x5e0ibDQTQM" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: Elin Electronics has a poor RONW of 12.93% for FY22. Typically, a company with a poor RONW does not command higher price to earnings from investors.

In addition, the company's margins were under pressure for FY22. While the company's sales increased to Rs 1095 crore in FY22 from Rs 865 crore of FY21, the net profit increased marginally to Rs 39 crore from Rs 35 crore in the same period.

Major brands use the company's electronics manufacturing services for fans, small kitchen appliances, and fractional horse-power motors. The company is a B2B player. B2C players typically command higher valuations than B2B players.

Based on the FY2022 net profit figure, the company is asking for a P/E of 31x, which we believe is quite high. Such valuations are unsustainable with such a low RONW. As a result, we advise you to avoid.

details: The Objectives of the Offer are to:
1. Repayment/prepayment, in full or in part, of certain company borrowings.
2. Capital expenditure for upgrading and expanding existing facilities.
3. General corporate purposes.

header:
Number of Equity Shares
for OFS

about: Elin Electronics is a leading Electronics Manufacturing Services (EMS) provider of end-to-end product solutions.
In India, the company manufactures lighting, fans, and small/kitchen appliances for major brands.
The company's business models include both Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) and Original Design Manufacturer (ODM).
In addition to EMS, the company manufactures medical diagnostic cartridges for use in diagnostic devices and plastic moulded and sheet metal parts and components.
The company provides innovative solutions to customers, which include global sourcing, fabrication of components and parts, captive manufacturing, quality testing, packaging and logistics supports.
The company has three manufacturing facilities located in Ghaziabad (Uttar Pradesh), Baddi (Himachal Pradesh) and Verna (Goa).

headervalue:
Molded and sheet Metal parts and
components

about: In Q2 FY23, the company reported a revenue of Rs. 605 crore and a net profit of Rs. 21 crore.
In FY22, the company reported a revenue of Rs. 1095 crore from Rs. 865 crore in FY21, but net profit increased marginally to Rs 39 crore up from Rs 35 crore in the same period.
In FY22, the company reported a RONW of 12.93%, down from 13.29% in FY21.
Even the net profit margin decreased in FY22 from FY21.

issue_details.Promoters: General Atlantic Singapore Fund Pte. Ltd.

all.styick_header_txt: KFIN TECHNOLOGIES is going public with an Offer for Sale. The issue opens on 19th December 2022.
all.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/eZadbH-KXWU" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: The Karvy Group faced regulatory issues with various government agencies.
C Parthasarathy, the founder of Karvy, owns 14.12% of the company.
Any adverse comments about the Group could affect KFin's brand equity, and these shares could enter the market, affecting the share price.

2.header: Last year, Kotak Mahindra Bank Acquired Stake at Rs. 185 Per Share
desc: In November 2021, Kotak Mahindra Bank acquired a 9.86% stake in the company for a price of Rs. 185 per share.
However, 12 months down the line, an offer for sale has been made at Rs. 347-366 per share.
KFinTech has a 32% market share in overall AAUM, while CAMS, another listed company, is the market leader.
CAMS commands a P/E of 39x (TTM), whereas KFin is asking for a P/E of 35x (annualising first six months of the FY2023).
Due to its market leadership and larger market share, CAMS should always command a higher P/E than KFin.
This eliminates the possibility of capital appreciation.

details: The Objectives of the Offer are to:
1. To conduct the Offer For Sale of equity shares totaling Rs. 1500 Cr by the promoter selling shareholder.
2. To achieve the benefits of listing equity shares on stock exchanges.

header:
Number of Equity Shares
for OFS
headervalue: General Atlantic Singapore Fund PTE. LTD.

about: KFin Technology is a leading platform for technology-driven financial services.
It provides comprehensive services and solutions to India's capital market ecosystem, which includes asset managers and corporate issuers across asset classes.
The company also provides several investor solutions, including transaction origination and processing of mutual funds and private retirement schemes in Malaysia, the Philippines and Hong Kong.
The company serves 24 of India's 41 AMCs, accounting for 59% of the market share based on AMC clients.
In Q2 FY23, the company reported a revenue of Rs. 354 crore and a net profit of Rs. 85 crore.

In FY22, the company reported a revenue of Rs. 646 crore and a net profit of Rs. 149 crore. The net profit increased substantially compared to the previous year, which reported losses of Rs 65 crore in FY21 and profits of only Rs 5 crore in FY20.
Through Q2 of FY23, the Return on Capital Employed (ROCE) and Return on Equity (ROE) were 20.71% and 24.72%, respectively.

all.styick_header_txt: Landmark Cars is going public with a Fresh Issue and an Offer for Sale. Issue opens on 13th December 2022.
all.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/jcBh3P5_w_w" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: Two states, Gujarat and Maharashtra, account for the majority of the company's revenue. Gujarat accounts for 49% of the total revenue, while Maharashtra accounts for 25%. This indicates that two states account for 74% of the company's revenue.
Landmark Cars sells cars and provides after-sales service for some of the country's most prominent foreign vehicles. Mercedes-Benz generates the most revenue, followed by Jeep.
We believe that car dealerships should not command the rich value that the company is seeking.

Its market cap is Rs. 2000 crore based on the upper price band, and assuming the company maintains the same net profit of Rs. 66 crore reported in FY2022 (up from Rs. 11 crore in FY2021), it is asking for a P/E of 30x, which we believe is a rich valuation.
This leaves no room for capital appreciation.

details: The Objectives of the Offer are to:
1. Full or partial prepayment of borrowings obtained by the subsidiary.
2. General corporate purposes.

headervalue: TPG Growth II SF PTE LTD.

about: Landmark Cars is India's leading premium automotive retail company.
In India, the company has dealerships for Honda, Jeep, Volkswagen, and Renault, as well as an Ashok Leyland commercial vehicle dealership; for Mercedes-Benz, it has a car sales agency.

The company has a presence throughout the automotive retail value chain, including new vehicle sales, after-sales service and repairs, pre-owned passenger vehicle sales, and sales and third-party product facilitation.
The company's network has grown to 112 outlets in 8 Indian states and union territories but most of the revenue comes from Gujarat and Maharashtra.
In Q1 FY23, the company reported a revenue of Rs. 802 crore and a net profit of Rs. 18 crore.

In FY22, the company reported a revenue of Rs. 2989 crore and a net profit of Rs. 66 crore. The net profit jumped substantially over the previous year as it reported only Rs 11 crore in FY2021 and reported losses of Rs 28 crore in FY2020.
Mercedes-Benz sales generate the most revenue, followed by Jeep sales.
The company has borrowings of Rs 464 crore as of June 2022.
RONW in March 2022 was 26.12 percent, up from 6.23 percent in March 2021.

all.styick_header_txt: SULA VINEYARDS is going public with an Offer for Sale. The issue opens on 12th December 2022.
all.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/-z7uDLWkibc" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: Sula is more reliant on one state for procuring grapes as well as turnover. Maharashtra generates nearly half of all revenue. Any change in government policy could have a significant impact on the company's revenue.

While Covid-19 had an impact on the company's business, the company's financials are inconsistent. It reported a loss in FY2020 and a meagre profit of Rs 3 crore in FY2021. Its profit for FY2022 increased to Rs 52 crore. We would rather see consistency in financial numbers. Furthermore, the company requires a larger sum of money for working capital.

When compared to similar players listed on the bourses, the company is asking for rich valuations. The company would have a market cap of Rs 3006 crore (based on the upper price band), resulting in a price to sales ratio of 6.6x and a price to earnings ratio of 58x.

mojocall.info: This type of valuation leaves no room for capital appreciation.

details: The Objectives of the Offer are to:
1. To carry out the Offer for Sale of up to 2.69 crore equity shares by selling shareholders' stake.
2. Achieve the benefit of listing the equity shares on stock exchanges.

about: As of March 31,2022, Sula Vineyards is India's largest wine producer and seller.

The company's operations are divided into two categories: (i.) wine production, import of wines and spirits, and distribution of wines and spirits; and (ii.) the sale of services derived from ownership of wine tourism venues such as vineyard resorts and tasting rooms.
Popular brands distributed by the company include the flagship brand "Sula," as well as "RASA," "Dindori," "The Source," "Satori," "Madera," and "Dia."
The company manufactures 56 different wine labels at four owned and two leased production facilities in Maharashtra and Karnataka.
The company owns and operates two vineyard resorts in Nashik, "The Source at Sula" and "Beyond by Sula," under the Wine Tourism business.
In H1 FY23, the company reported a revenue of Rs. 226 crore and a net profit of Rs. 31 crore.
In FY22, the company reported a revenue of Rs. 457 crore and a net profit of Rs. 52 crore.
In FY21, the company reported a revenue of Rs. 421 crore and a net profit of Rs. 3 crore.
In FY20, the company reported a revenue of Rs. 522 crore and a net loss of Rs. 16 crore.

all.styick_header_txt: ABANS HOLDINGS is going public with a Fresh Issue and Offer for Sale. The issue opens on 12th December 2022.
all.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/H8AAboRdbSg" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: Abans Holding has three subsidiaries, each of which has 14 subsidiaries or step-down subsidiaries. This is a very intricate structure. When a company's corporate structure is complex, investors typically feel less at ease.

The subsidiaries' financial performance has been inconsistent, which is cause for concern. For example, Abans Broking's revenue in FY2021 was Rs 708 crore, but it fell to Rs 27 crore in FY2022. Abans Middle East's revenue increased to Rs 537 crore in FY 2022 from Rs 78 crore in FY2021. In FY2022, the Middle East subsidiary accounted for 83% of the company's revenue.

3.header: May Not Have Institutional Investors' Fancy
desc: We believe institutional investors may not have much interest in the company. This could result in lower multiples.

details: The Objectives of the Offer are to:
1. Continue to invest in the NBFC Subsidiary (Abans Finance Pvt. Ltd) to meet the company's future needs and finance the expansion of its capital base.
2. Generate a corporate purpose.

about: Abans Holdings is the financial Arm of Abans group.
The company operates a diversified global financial services business, headquartered in India.
It provides NBFC services, global institutional trading in equities, commodities and foreign exchange, private client broking and AMC services.

The company has a strong global presence. Apart from India, the company is a member of the London Metal Exchange (LME), the Dubai Gold & Commodity Exchange (DGCX), the Dalian Commodity Exchange (DCE) and the Shanghai International Energy Exchange (INE).
The company began as a commodities trading firm before diversifying into a multi-asset and multi-national financial services firm.
In FY23, till August 31, 2022, the company reported a revenue of Rs. 288 crore and a net profit of Rs. 30 crore.
In FY22, the company reported a revenue of Rs. 646 crore and a net profit of Rs. 62 crore.
In FY21, the company reported a revenue of Rs. 1331 crore and a net profit of Rs. 46 crore.
In FY20, the company reported a revenue of Rs. 2772 crore and a net profit of Rs. 39 crore.

all.styick_header_txt: UNIPARTS INDIA is going public with an Offer for Sale. The issue opens on 30th November 2022.
all.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/gptD2ZrKVbs" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: Uniparts India has shown strong financial growth with sales and net profit improving smartly.
For FY 2022, the company enjoys a healthy net profit margin of 13.6%.
The company's borrowings are relatively low at Rs 127 crore.
Almost 75% of revenue is generated by the agricultural sector, which is relatively recession-free.
Almost 72% of the company's revenue is generated outside of India, where it has developed strong client relationships.
Based on FY2022 earnings, the company has an attractive valuation with a P/E of less than 16x.
We believe that the company's innovative business model warrants higher valuations, hence, we recommend subscribing to the issue.

mojocall.info: This analysis takes into account the company's future rather than listing gains. It is also not based on our big data analysis.

details: The Objectives of the Offer are to:
1. Offer existing shareholders a partial exit and listing on the exchange.

about: Uniparts India Limited is a leading global provider of engineered systems and solutions to off-road vehicles
It is a leading supplier of off-highway systems and components to the agriculture, construction, forestry, and mining industries.
The company has a presence in more than 25 countries.

The company's core products are three-point linkage systems ("3 PL") attached to agricultural tractors and precision machined parts ("PMP") used in precision machined components such as pins, bushes, and bosses.
In FY 22, the company had a 16.7% market share of the global 3 PL market and a 5.9% market share of the global PMP market.
In Q1 FY23, the company reported a revenue of Rs. 347 crore and a net profit of Rs. 51 crore.
In FY22, the company reported a revenue of Rs. 1227 crore and a net profit of Rs. 167 crore.
The company enjoys heathy net profit margin of 16% as of March 2022. Despite an increase in input costs, the margin is increasing.

all.styick_header_txt: DHARMAJ CROP GUARD is going public with a Fresh Issue and an Offer for Sale. The issue opens on 28th November 2022.
all.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/GFoPpaWBw-k" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: The company mainly supplies agrochemicals to institutional investors (69% of revenue), with branded sales accounting for only 31%.
Because the company operates in a highly competitive basic agrochemical industry, margins are likely to fluctuate.

The company is seeking a fair valuation. Based on FY2022 earnings, the market cap to sales ratio is 1.6x, and the P/E ratio is around 21x. In the secondary market, this is what companies with similar business models command.
We are neutral on the company due to the valuation it is asking and the industry in which it operates.

mojocall.info: This analysis takes into account the company's future rather than listing gains. It is also not based on our big data analysis.

details: The Objectives of the Offer are to:
1. Invest Rs 105 crore in capital expenditure
2. Fund incremental working capital requirements to the tune of Rs 45 crore
3. Repayment and/or pre-payment, in full and/or part, of certain borrowings to the tune of Rs 10 crore
4. General corporate purposes.

about: The company manufactures a wide range of agrochemical formulations for B2B and B2C customers, including insecticides, fungicides, herbicides, plant growth regulators, micro fertilizers, and antibiotics.
They also market and distribute agrochemical products to Indian farmers through their distribution network under brands in-licensed by the company, owned by them and through generic brands.
They export to over 25 countries in Latin America, East African Countries, the Middle East and Far East Asia.
In FY22, the company reported a revenue of more than Rs. 396 crore and a net profit of Rs. 29 crore.
In the first four months of the current financial year, the company reported sales of Rs 221 crore and net profit of Rs 18 crore.
Since this is a seasonal business, the first four months' figures should not be annualized.
Total borrowings are Rs 65 crores as of September 2022.
While the company exports to over 25 nations, over 90% of its revenue arrives from the domestic market.

all.styick_header_txt: KEYSTONE REALTORS is going public with a Fresh Issue and an Offer for Sale. The issue opens on 14th November 2022.
all.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/I-A4cUDV-84" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: Keystone Realtors operates under the "Rustomjee" brand, which has a good reputation in the real estate industry.​​
The company is well-known for its high-quality construction and design.​​
The real estate industry is transitioning from an unorganised to an organised sector as a result of RERA and other government initiatives.​​
For the established players like Keystone, this presents opportunities.​​
The company has greater borrowings than its competitors.​​
As of June 2022, the outstanding debt is Rs 1,469 crore​​.​
With rising interest rates, the company's bottom line and real estate demand may suffer.​
In 2022, the real estate sector index has decreased by 6%.​​​​
Due to higher borrowing costs that affect real estate demand and the perception that the sector has reached its peak, investors' appetite for it is waning.​​​
The company will have a market cap of Rs 6,200 crore (based on the upper price band). ​​​
Taking into account the sector fancy on the decline and the rising interest rate, we rate this IPO as Neutral.​​​​

mojocall.info: This analysis takes into account the company's future rather than listing gains. It is also not based on our big data analysis.

details: The Objectives of the Offer are to:
Fulfill full or partial repayment/prepayment of certain borrowings obtained by the Company and/or certain of its Subsidiaries.
Fund the acquisition of future real estate projects and general corporate purposes.

header:
Proceeds from ​
Sale of Equity Shares for OFS ​

about: Keystone Realtors operates primarily in the MMR region under the brand name "Rustomjee."

As of June 30, 2022, the company had 32 Completed Projects, 12 Ongoing Projects, and 21 Forthcoming Projects in the Mumbai Metropolitan Region ("MMR"), that includes a comprehensive range of project under the affordable, mid and mass, aspirational, premium, and super premium categories.
The company has delivered over 20 million square feet and has a 34 million square foot pipeline.
Residential projects generate 95% of the revenue.
In FY22, the company reported a revenue of more than Rs. 1269 crore and a net profit of Rs. 136 crore.
When compared to its peers, the company has a higher debt-to-equity ratio.
Total borrowings are Rs 1469 crore as of June 2022.

all.styick_header_txt: INOX GREEN ENERGY is going public with a Fresh Issue and an Offer for Sale. Issue opens on 11th November 2022.
all.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/aOAZcxw8Wz4" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: Inox Green reported losses for the fiscal year ended March 2022 as well as the first quarter ended June 2022. ​
As of June 2022, the company had total borrowings of Rs 910 crore, compared to annual sales of Rs 172 crore.​ ​
Despite the fact that the company will use some of the proceeds from the IPO to repay Rs 260 crore of debt, we believe that debt will be substantial given the company's size.
The company intends to sell its 50 MW power plant, which could fetch Rs 300 crore, but no timetable has been set
The company's market cap will be Rs 1897 crore (based on the upper band), which we believe is a rich valuation given its losses and higher borrowings in the books.​​
A market cap to sales ratio of 11x suggests that the company is demanding a high valuation.​

mojocall.info: This analysis takes into account the company's future rather than listing gains. It is also not based on our big data analysis.

details: Offer Objectives:
Repayment and/or pre-payment of company borrowings, in full or part.
General corporate purposes.

header:
Proceeds from ​
Sale of Equity Shares for OFS ​

about: Inox Green is a subsidiary of Inox Wind (a listed entity with market cap of Rs 3750 Crore). Inox Wind, in turn is a subsidiary of another listed company Inox Wind Energy Ltd (market cap of Rs 1254 Crore).
The company provides wind power operation and maintenance ("O&M"). This is mainly to Wind Turbine Generators (WTG) manufactured by Inox Wind.
As of June 30, 2022, our O&M services portfolio consisted of an aggregate 2,792 MW of wind farm capacity and 1,396 WTGs.
In FY22, the company reported a revenue of over Rs. 172 crores and a net loss of Rs. 5 crores.
In the last two fiscal years, as well as the June 22 quarter, the company has reported a net loss. The losses in FY21 stood at Rs. 28 crores.
As of June 22, the company's borrowings totaled Rs. 910 crores.

all.styick_header_txt: Kaynes Technology is going public with a Fresh Issue and an Offer for Sale. Issue debuts on November 10th, 2022.
all.video_iframe: <iframe class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/PhvwDmt0QPg" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: Because of the China Plus One policy and the accessibility of cheap labour, the Electronic System Design and Manufacturing (ESDM) sector has enormous potential for growth in countries like India.​
Stock market investors typically favour this sector and assign a higher PE due to its potential for growth.​ . ​
The company's financial results for FY2022 showed smarter growth, but we're not sure if that's because of the low base effect from the prior year or because real progress has been made.​​
While the return on equity is currently at a healthy 24.50%, it was a mere 8.08% for FY2021 , which is poor.​
Despite favourable industry outlooks and improved financials, the company's valuation request is what distinguishes it as neutral.​
It will have a market cap of almost Rs 3000 crore, giving market cap to sales in excess of 4x. ​
It is more than 71x in terms of PE.​
This does not leave scope for capital appreciation. ​

mojocall.info: This analysis takes into account the company's future rather than listing gains. It is also not based on our big data analysis.

details: The company intends to use the Net Proceeds to fund the following items:
Repaying certain borrowings.​
For Capex.
Investment in subsidiaries.

about: Kaynes Technology is a leading integrated electronics manufacturing company that provides end-to-end and IoT solutions.

​ They have provided conceptual design, process engineering, integrated manufacturing, and life-cycle support to major players in the automotive, industrial, aerospace and defense, outer-space, nuclear, medical, railways, Internet of Things ("IoT"), Information Technology ("IT"), and other industries.
The company operates eight strategically-located manufacturing facilities in India, including Karnataka, Haryana, Himachal Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, and Uttarakhand.
Their facilities are close to their customers, allowing them to service their needs efficiently and cost-effectively.
In FY22, the company reported a revenue of over Rs. 706 crores, up 68%, and a net profit of Rs. 42 crores, up over 300%.
​The company improved its ROE from 8.08% of FY2021 to 24.50% of FY 2022
Automotive and industrial products account for 64% of the company's revenue, while railways and medicine each contribute 10%.

all.styick_header_txt: Five Star Business Finance is releasing an Offer for Sale. The issue will be released on November 9, 2022.
all.video_iframe: <iframe class="iframevideonew"  src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/CXWS4-l9ODg" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: Five Star Business Finance has a good business with a strong financial matrix, such as a return on assets of 7.5% and a NIM of 14.9% for March 2022.
In addition, the company has a lower NPA ratio of less than (0.68 for June 2022) . ​
The company provides financing to microentrepreneurs and self-employed individuals with an annual income of less than Rs 25000.​
The company provides loans against the borrowers' property.
Here, the loan-to-value ratio is 37%. As a result, if borrowers fail to make payments, the corporation can recoup the funds by selling the secured assets.
ROA is the decisive factor in obtaining valuations in banks and NBFCs. ​
The higher the ROA, the higher the price to book value.
Based on the upper pricing band, the cost to book is 3.6x. ​
Credit Access Grameen, another microfinance company, has a price to book value of 3.6x, yet its ROA is less than 3%. ​
Five Star Business has expanded rapidly and can justify this valuation. ​

mojocall.info: This analysis takes into account the company's future rather than listing gains. It is also not based on our big data analysis.

details: The objectives of the Offer are to:
To carry out the Offer for Sale.
Realize the advantages of listing the equity shares on stock exchanges.

header:
Proceeds from
​ sale of Equity Shares for OFS ​​
headervalue: Matrix Partners India Investment Holdings III​
Matrix Partners India Investment Holdings II extension​

about: Five Star Business Finance Limited provides secured business loans to microentrepreneurs and self-employed persons, both of whom are generally overlooked by traditional lending institutions. The company's loans are all secured by the borrowers' properties.
​ They have a strong presence in south India and are headquartered in Chennai, Tamil Nadu.
Five Star Business Finance's loan portfolio rose at a 50% CAGR between fiscal 2018 and 2022, while small business loans grew at a 22% CAGR.
Five Star Business has the highest Net Interest Margin (NIMs) among its peers in fiscal 2022.
In fiscal 2022, the company also has the lowest credit cost as a percentage of total assets and the third lowest cost-to-income ratio 32.0% among compared peers.

The company submitted financials for three years beginning in March 2020, which is not a desirable year to make a base due to the Covid impact. To understand the company’s growth, they should’ve provided five-year financials.
In FY22, Five Star Finance reported revenue of over Rs 1250 Crs (an increase of about 20%), while net profit was Rs 454 Crs (an increase of more than 26%).
The company enjoys a healthy ROA of 7.5 per cent for the Year 2022. It also enjoys healthy ROE of almost 16 per cent and NIM of 14.9 per cent.
Despite offering loans that may not have a credit history, the company has kept its NPA level in control. As of June 2022, NNPA was at 0.68 per cent.

all.styick_header_txt: Archean Industries is going public with a Fresh Issue and an Offer for Sale. Issue opens on 9th November 2022.
all.video_iframe: <iframe class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/KTy9EmDGK9o" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: In comparison to FY22 sales of Rs 1130 crore and net profit of Rs 189 crore, the company is requesting a valuation of Rs 5000 crore (based on the upper price band).
We think that given that this is a commodity business, such a high valuation is unjustified. ​
Revenue is entirely dependent on the three products. This is a cyclical industry, and lower prices may result in lower revenue.​

3.header: 3. Top 10 Customers Account for Majority Revenue
desc: Over 60% of revenue is generated by the top ten customers. As a result, if even one of their clients decides not to source their requirements from them, it could have a serious impact on the company.

4.header: 4. Increase in Product Prices Boosts Revenue
desc: The increase in revenue in FY22 can be attributed to a sharp increase in global bromine pricing due to low Chinese bromine production. If global prices begin to fall, revenue figures may suffer significantly. ​
While they are one of the major domestic producers of potash sulphate, revenue from this segment accounts for only 1% of total revenue. ​
Promoters have interest in entities to companies that manufacture industrial salt (the company gets 45% of the revenue from industrial salt). Potential conflicts of interest could arise.​
The company's attrition rate is high, which is not a good sign. It was 28.7% for the fiscal year ending March 20, 2022.​

mojocall.info: This analysis takes into account the company's future rather than listing gains. It is also not based on our big data analysis.

details: The Offer comprises a Fresh Issue as well as an Offer for Sale by the Selling Shareholders for partial or full redemption of NCDs issued by the Company.

about: The company is into marine chemicals major, focusing on products like bromine, Industrial salt and sulphate of potash. Their manufacturing unit is in Hajipur, Gujarat.
About 70% of the revenue came from exports in FY22.
Pharmaceuticals & Agrochemicals, Energy storage, fertilizers are some of the sectors this company serves to.
They are a major exporter of bromine and Industrial salts which account for 99% of the revenue while only 1% of the revenue came from sulphate of potash in FY22.

The company provided financials for three years beginning in March 2020, which is not a good year to start because of the Covid impact. They should have provided five-year financials to better understand the company's growth.
In FY22, it clocked a revenue of over 1100 crores and a net profit of 189 crores.
It reported sales of Rs 400 crore for the quarter ended June 2022, up from Rs 201 crore in the corresponding quarter last year.
Its net profit increased to Rs 84 crore from Rs 19 crore during the same period last year. The rise in net profit was primarily due to an increase in chemical prices.

desc: The company will have market cap of Rs 7500 crore (based on the upper price band) compared to FY2022 sales of Rs 1611 crore and a net profit of Rs 76 crore.
The market cap-to-sales ratio is 4.65x and the P/E ratio is 99x, indicating no capital appreciation.

1.info: (The market cap-to-sales ratio typically evaluates this type of business)

desc: The company wants to grow revenue in focus states but Bhujia is popular only in North India.
Rajasthan, Assam, and Bihar could dominate company revenue for 5 years. This may hinder business growth.
The fiscal year 2022 ROE was 9.50%, which is low.
Selling shareholders demand high premiums, limiting public capital appreciation.
Brand building will require ongoing investment.
Players cannot pass on rising raw material prices to end customers that reflected in Bikaji's FY2022 net profit.
Western snacks are now preferred over ethnic ones, which may limit company growth.
The company makes 70% of its revenue in cities, where health consciousness is growing. This may affect product sales.
Some of the group companies operate in the similar industry as Bikaji.
In the future, this could become a corporate governance issue.
5.info: Few Haldiram companies have been classified as group companies. We could not obtain confirmation from the company as to whether the Bikaji promoters have stake in any of the companies.

mojocall.info: This analysis considers the company's future, not listing gains. It is not based on our big data analysis either.

details: This is a public offering in which investors such as Lighthouse, Avendus, and IIFL are selling nearly two-thirds of their stake in Bikaji.
Promoters will also sell a small percentage of their stake.
The company will not receive a single rupee from this issue.

about: Shiv Ratan Agarwal, the grandson of Gangabishan Agarwal (founder of the Haldiram brand), established Bikaji. Bikaji is a company that sells ethnic snacks (similar to Haldiram brands), and its product line includes Bhujia, Namkeen, packaged sweets, papad, and western snacks.

Bhujia accounts for 35% of the company's revenue, Namkeen accounts for another 35%, and packaged sweets account for 13% of the revenue. The company is well-established in three states: Rajasthan, Assam, and Bihar. These three states generate 71.5% of the company's annual revenue.

The company provided financials for 3 years from March 2020, which is not a good year to make base due to the Covid impact. To understand business growth, the company should have provided five-year financials.
Sales rose to Rs 1611 crore from Rs 1311 crore in the fiscal year ending March 2022, and net profit rose to Rs 76 crore (last year Rs 90.3 crore).
The holiday season boosts revenue for this seasonal business, so quarterly numbers cannot be annualised.

issue_details.Lead Manager: Kotak Mahindra Capital, BofA Securities, Axis Capital, SBI Capital, CitiGroup, Goldman Sachs, ICICI Securities and BOB Capital.

closed.styick_header_txt: Ola Electric Mobility Limited is going public with a fresh issue and an offer for sale. The issue opens on 02nd August 2024.​​​​​​​
closed.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/IZ7VUP5ZWd8" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

1.header: Heavy supplier dependence for critical material​
desc: The company relies heavily on several suppliers for essential components, including lithium-ion cells, magnets, and electronic ICs. The top 10 suppliers account for 60% of the total supplies. Additionally, the company has been increasing its reliance on China for these critical components, with China's share rising from 7.9% in FY2022 to 36.9% in FY2024. The company plans on increasing its reliance on China for the critical minerals required in cell manufacturing which Ola plans to undertake on its own.

For Ola's S1 Pro Gen 1 model, the cost of lithium-ion cells has increased from 26.3% of the total costs in FY2022 to 32.3% in FY2024. The company lacks long-term contracts with suppliers, making it vulnerable to fluctuations in the availability and pricing of quality cells.​

The company's strong sales have been largely driven by the FAME subsidies provided by the government for electric vehicle purchases. These subsidies have made Ola's electric two-wheelers price-competitive with current ICE vehicles. In the future, such subsidies may no longer be available, potentially making the company's path to profitability more challenging.

Based on FY2024 financials, the company has made a loss of Rs 1,585 crore and has been unprofitable for the past 3 years. The company is asking for a Price-to-sales of 6.7x which is higher than the legacy companies such as Bajaj Auto and TVS which trade at P/S of 5.8x and 3.1x of their sales after being profitable. Given the uncertainty of turning profitable, we recommend avoiding this issue.

details: Objectives of the Issue Offer for sale – Rs 645.46 cr & Fresh Issue – Rs 5,500 cr

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. Capital expenditure to be incurred by a subsidiary of the company – Rs 1,227.64 crore​
2. Repayment or pre-payment, in full or part, of the indebtedness incurred by a subsidiary of the company – Rs 800 crore​
3. Investment into research and product development – Rs 1,600 crore​
4. Expenditure to be incurred for organic growth initiatives – Rs 350 crore​
5. General corporate purposes – Rs 1522.36 crore​​

about: ​Ola Electric Mobility is an electric vehicle company that primarily manufactures electric vehicles and certain core components for electric vehicles such as battery packs, motors, and vehicle frames. As of 31st March 2024, the company held a market share of 35% in Indian E2W market.

Since August 2021, the company has launched seven new products and announced four. The Ola S1 Pro, the first EV model, was delivered in December 2021, followed by the Ola S1, Ola S1 Air, Ola S1 X and Ola S1 X+ in the following years.
On August 15, 2023, the company announced new EV models and a range of motorcycles including Diamondhead, Adventure, Roadster, and Cruiser.
The company operates through its own D2C network comprising of 870 experience centres and 431 service centres across the country.
The company’s revenue grew by 1241% between FY2022 and FY2024 and stood at Rs 5,009.8 crore for FY2024.
In FY2024, the company’s Return on Net Worth stood at 33.57%, an improvement of 537bps from 28.20% recorded in FY2023.
For FY2024, the gross margins stood at 12.58%, a significant increase from 2.3% and -28.78% registered in FY2023 and FY2022 respectively.
Consequently, Operating margins for the company improved to -19.84%, from -43.02% and -157.27% recorded in FY2023 and FY2022 respectively.
The company has failed to generate positive cash flow from operations for the last three years. The company reported a CFO of negative Rs 633 crore in FY2024.
​The company has a debt of Rs 2,710 crore as of 31st March 2024.

issue_details.Lead Manager: Kotak Mahindra Capital, Morgan Stanley, BofA Securities, JM Financial and Avendus Capital

open.styick_header_txt: Brainbees Solutions (FirstCry) Limited is going public with a fresh issue and an offer for sale. The issue opens on 06th August 2024.​​
open.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/26MLGzk1N9A" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

1.header: India’s largest multi-channel retailer for Mothers’, Babies’ and Kids’ products​
desc: Founded in 2010, the company has grown into the largest multi-channel retail platform for products aimed at mothers, babies, and kids. It initially launched as an online platform and soon expanded into physical stores under the brands "FirstCry" and "BabyHug." As of March 31, 2024, the company operated 435 company-owned company-operated (COCO) stores and 628 franchisee-owned franchisee-operated (FOFO) stores nationwide.

A key subsidiary of the company, Globalbees Brands, in which the company holds a 50.23% stake, specializes in funding and acquiring direct-to-consumer (D2C) businesses across various categories, including home utilities, fashion/lifestyle, appliances, and beauty/personal care. These investments in early-stage D2C companies have the potential to yield significant returns and unlock substantial value for shareholders.​

3.header: Reducing yet high dependence on Xpressbees for logistics
desc: The company heavily relies on Xpressbees for its logistics needs. In FY2024, 57.3% of the total logistics costs were attributed to Xpressbees, down from 82.8% in FY2022. Additionally, Supam Maheshwari, the Managing Director and CEO of Brainbees, serves as a director on the board of Xpressbees, which could present a potential conflict of interest.

Based on FY2024 financials, the company is loss-making asking for a market cap-to-sales ratio of 3.7x. Such a valuation is justified for a fast-growing company with potential for unlocking value through its funding and investment arm. We, therefore, suggest subscribing to the issue.

details: Objectives of the Issue Offer for sale – Rs 2,527.73 cr & Fresh Issue – Rs 1,666 cr

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. To fund the expenditure for: (i) setting up new modern stores under the ‘BabyHug’ brand; and (ii) setting up a warehouse, in India – Rs 108.10 crore
2. To fund the expenditure for lease payments for the existing identified modern stores owned and operated by the company, in India – Rs 93.10 crore​
3. To fund the investment in one of the company’s subsidiary, Digital Age for (i) setting up new modern stores under the FirstCry brand and other home brands of the company; and (ii) lease payments for the existing identified modern stores owned and controlled by Digital Age, in India – Rs 299.60 crore
4. Investment in one of the subsidiary, FirstCry Trading for overseas expansion by: (i) setting up new modern stores; and (ii) setting up warehouse(s), in KSA – Rs 155.60 crore
5. Investment in one of the subsidiary, Globalbees Brands towards acquisition of additional stake in our step-down Subsidiaries – Rs 169 crore​
6. To fund the Sales and marketing initiatives by the company – Rs 200 crore
7. Technology and data science cost including cloud and server hosting related costs – Rs 57.60 crore.
8. Funding inorganic growth through acquisitions and general corporate purposes – Rs 583 crore​
​

headervalue:
Schroders Capital Private​
Equity Asia Mauritius II ​

about: Brainbees Solutions operates India’s largest multi-channel retailing platform (in terms of GMV) for products catering to mothers, babies and kids through their proprietary “FirstCry” platform.

The company launched its “FirstCry” platform in India in 2010 with the goal to create a one-stop shop for all parenting needs. The company has since established presence in UAE and Saudi Arabia in 2019 and 2022, respectively.

The company offers products from third-party Indian brands, global brands and home-grown brands. Through deep data analysis, company has managed to develop and grow one of its own brands “BabyHug”, into the largest multi-category Mothers’, Babies’, and Kids’ products brand in India in terms of GMV in FY2024.
The company also operates through retail stores in India under the COCO and FOFO model. As of FY2024, the company operated 435 COCO stores and 628 stores through the FOFO model.
The company’s revenue grew by 170% between FY2022 and FY2024 and stood at Rs 6,481 crore for FY2024.
In FY2024, the company’s Return on Net Worth stood at (8.65%), an improvement of 411bps from (12.76%) recorded in FY2023.
For FY2024, the operating margins for the company improved to 4.23%, from 1.33% recorded in FY2023 and 4.01% recorded in FY2022.
The company has failed to generate profits for the last 3 years. The company posted a loss of Rs 321 crore for FY2024, compared to a loss of Rs 486 crore in FY2023.
​The company has failed to generate positive cash flow from operations for the last three years. The company reported a CFO of negative Rs 42 crore in FY2024.
​The company has a debt of Rs 1,422 crore (including lease liabilities) as of 31st March 2024.

open.styick_header_txt: Unicommerce eSolutions Limited is going public with an offer for sale. The issue opens on 06th August 2024.​​
open.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Rf1509Oeq1A" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

1.header: Dropping client retention over the past 3 years​
desc: Over the past three financial years, the company has seen an increase in the number of enterprise clients, growing from 470 in FY2022 to 795 in FY2024. However, this growth is primarily due to the addition of new clients, as the retention rate of existing clients has declined. The retention ratio for enterprise clients has decreased from 83.7% in FY2022 to 75.2% in FY2024. The company has also observed a decline in the retention rate for its small and medium business clients, dropping from 61.8% in FY2022 to 50.5% in FY2024.

2.header: Lower Revenue Retention from existing customers
desc: The company operates with a subscription model and the clients do not have any obligations to renew their subscriptions and continue with the company. Net Revenue Retention (NRR), a parameter which measures repeat business from customers which were present in the previous period, stood at 107.57% for FY2024 falling from 136.30% and 120% in FY2023 and FY2022, respectively.​

The company has categorized its clientele into enterprise clients and small businesses. Over the past two years, revenue from enterprise clients has grown at a CAGR of 22.94%. The contribution of enterprise clients to total revenue has increased from 83% in FY2022 to 88% in FY2024. Additionally, the company offers a distinct subscription plan for enterprise clients, ensuring a steady cash flow through an advance fee and providing premium services that result in higher margins from this segment.

Based on FY2024 financials, the company is targeting a PE ratio of 85x and a market cap-to-sales ratio of 10.7x. The company does not have a comparable listed peer. Such high valuations don’t justify a company with such small scale. Also, the company operates at lower margins compared to its peers in the IT – Software sector. We, therefore, recommend avoiding this issue.​

details: Objectives of the Issue Offer for sale – Rs 276.57 cr

about: Unicommerce eSolutions is a SaaS platform that enables end-to-end management of e-commerce operations for brands, sellers and logistic providers. The company offers a suite of services to small and medium businesses such as warehouse and inventory management, multi-channel order management, logistics tracking, courier allocation and payment reconciliation.
​The company is the country’s largest e-commerce enablement SaaS platform in transaction processing phase, in terms of revenues for FY2023.

The products of the company are sector and size agnostic and find uses in various types of e-commerce and retail enterprises, both online and offline. They also provide sub modules which are value added to their SaaS offerings such as procurement management, invoice and logistics management.
These products are such that they can be easily patched with the user’s website/application providing ease to the customer.
​The company’s revenue grew by 75% between FY2022 and FY2024 and stood at Rs 103.6 crore for FY2024.
In FY2024, the company’s Return on Net Worth stood at 18.98%, an improvement of 650bps from 12.48% recorded in FY2023.
For FY2024, the operating margins for the company improved to 13.92%, from 7.25% recorded in FY2023 and 8.54% recorded in FY2022.​
Profit margins for FY2024 stood at 12.63%, recording an improvement of 544bps from 7.19% recorded in FY2023.
The company has generated positive cash flow from operations for the last three years. The company reported a CFO of Rs 6 crore in FY2024.
The company has a debt of Rs 7.5 crore (including lease liabilities) as of 31st March 2024.

listed.styick_header_txt: Ceigall India Limited is going public with a fresh issue and an offer for sale. The issue opens on 01st August 2024.​​​​​​​
listed.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/A8C1gNcspW0" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: The company is highly dependent on the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) for project opportunities, as it mainly engages in road construction activities. Additionally, its association with government agencies results in delayed cash inflows, which strains the company's working capital and leads to financial stress.

The company aims to diversify into other business models, including Build-Operate-Transfer (BOT) and Operation & Maintenance (O&M). These models are margin accretive and offer diversification. However, they come with challenges such as arranging financing, dependency on vehicle traffic, and managing daily operational costs.​

The company has demonstrated excellence in executing several projects earning them pre-qualifications in several upcoming projects. The company has completed 9 projects for the NHAI and have 12 projects ongoing. NHAI contributed to 80% of the total order book as of 30th June 2024.

Based on FY2024 financials, the company is targeting a PE ratio of 23x and a market cap-to-sales ratio of 2.3x. This is comparable to one of its recently listed peers, SRM Contractors, which currently trades at a PE of 22x. The industry average PE is 18x. The lower PE in the industry is due to the inherent financial stress caused by delays from government agencies. Therefore, we recommend avoiding this issue.

details: Objectives of the Issue Offer for sale – Rs 568.41 cr & Fresh Issue – Rs 684.25 cr

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. Purchase of equipment – Rs 99.79 crore​​​
2. Repayment/ prepayment, in full or in part, of certain borrowings availed by the company and its subsidiaries – Rs 413.40 crore
3. General corporate purposes – Rs 171.06 crore
​

about: Ceigall India an infrastructure company specializing in construction of roads, flyovers, bridges, tunnels, highways, expressways and runways. As on date, the company has completed over 34 projects and has been operational in 10 states.

The company majorly works with state and national government bodies to win projects and execute them within the given timeline. The company operates under three business models namely EPC, Hybrid Annuity Model and Operation & maintenance model.
As of June 2024, the company had 18 ongoing projects with an order book of Rs 9,471 crore, which included elevated roads, flyovers, metro projects, expressways and multi-lane highways.
As of now, the company is eligible to bid for NHAI projects of up to Rs 5,500 crore, demonstrating strong execution history of the company.
The company’s revenue grew by 167% between FY2022 and FY2024 and stood at Rs 3,029 crore for FY2024.
In FY2024, the company’s Return on Net Worth stood at 33.57%, an improvement of 537bps from 28.20% recorded in FY2023.
For FY2024, the operating margins for the company improved to 17.09%, from 14.29% recorded in FY2023 and 16.40% recorded in FY2022.
​Profit margins for FY2024 stood at 10.05%, recording an improvement of 196bps from FY2023.
​The company has failed to generate positive cash flow from operations for the last three years. The company reported a CFO of negative Rs 211 crore in FY2024.
The company has a debt of Rs 1,066 crore as of 31st March 2024.
