listed.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/fuEmN_NNNUo" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: The company has a strong customer base for its CDMO business with 38 of its largest 50 clients placing repeat orders for the past 5 years. 26 of its largest 50 clients have been associated with the company for past 10 years demonstrating strong commitment towards the company.

2.header: Potential one-time gain from reversal of put-option provision
desc: As of March 31, 2024, the company has set aside a provision of ₹1,365.38 crore for a put option liability owed to one of its key institutional shareholders, Ruby Investments. According to the agreement, the company must provide Ruby Investments an exit via an IPO or a secondary sale of shares by April 2025. If the company fails to do so, it will be required to purchase those shares. Should the IPO successfully facilitate the investor's exit, the provision will be reversed, resulting in a significant one-time gain for the company.​

For FY2024, the company sourced 29.5% of its raw materials from its 10 largest suppliers, which has increased from 22% in FY2022. The company’s increasing over-reliance on limited suppliers and a lack of long-term contracts might lead to inflated costs in the future.

Based on FY2024 financials, the company is seeking a PE ratio of 28x (excluding put-option provision) and a market cap-to-sales ratio of 2.4x. This ask is significantly low compared to the industry average of 49x. Given the potential boost to the company’s net worth, we recommend subscribing to the issue.

details: Objectives of the Issue Offer for sale – Rs 1,176.73 cr​ & Fresh Issue – Rs 680 cr

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. Repayment/prepayment of all or certain borrowings of the company – Rs 159.9 crore​
2. Repayment/prepayment of all or certain borrowings of their subsidiaries namely, Maxcure Nutravedics Limited and Pure and Cure Healthcare Private Limited – Rs 227.1 crore
3. Funding incremental working capital requirements of the company – Rs 55 crore​​
4. Pursuing inorganic growth initiatives through acquisitions and general corporate purposes – Rs 238 crore​
​

about: Akums Drugs and Pharmaceutical is the largest India-focused Contract Drug Manufacturing Organization (CDMO) serving pharmaceutical giants such as Sun Pharma, Cipla, Mankind, Alkem Labs, Alembic Pharma, etc. among many others. Akums held a market share of 30.2% in the Indian  domestic CDMO market, increasing from 26.7% in FY2021.
Besides the CDMO business, the company is also engaged in the manufacturing and sale of branded and generic formulations and production of APIs.
The company operates through 12 manufacturing facilities (9 units in Uttarakhand, two units in Punjab and one unit in Himachal Pradesh) with a capacity of 49.23 billion units annually.
The company also operates four R&D centres, out of which 3 cater to the CDMO business and one caters to the API business.
The company’s revenue grew by 14% between FY2022 and FY2024 and stood at Rs 4,178 crore for FY2024.
In FY2024, the company’s Return on Net Worth stood at 16.94%, an improvement of 617bps from 10.77% recorded in FY2023.
For FY2024, the operating margins for the company improved to 12.22%, from 9.19% recorded in FY2023 and 11.51% recorded in FY2022.

The company's financials have been impacted by the provisions it has been making for a put-option liability arising from the investment by Ruby Investments. Post-IPO, the company should be realizing a one-time gain of Rs 1,365 crore arising from the reversal of this provision.

The company has generated positive cash flow from operations for the last three years. The company reported a CFO of Rs 498 crore in FY2024, which was 97% of EBITDA, suggesting strong cash conversion.
The company has a debt of Rs 565 crore as of 31st March 2024.

issue_details.Promoters: GOUTHAMCHAND CHOWDHARY, SAMBHAV CHOWDHARY AND SHREYANS CHOWDHARY

listed.styick_header_txt: Sanstar Limited is going public with a fresh issue and an offer for sale. The issue opens on 19th July 2024.​​​​​​
listed.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/sh2Q84W1hI0" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: The company has recently experienced a significant number of customer rejections due to quality defects. In FY2024, the company encountered 43 order rejections, representing 57% of the total revenues for that fiscal year. This marks an improvement from FY2023, where there were 59 order rejections, accounting for 69% of the total revenues. These high rejection rates indicate substantial lost opportunities for the company.

2.header: Higher material cost compared to peers
desc: For FY2024, material costs for the company stood exceedingly high at 77%, compared to peers such as Sukhjit Start & Chemicals with material costs of 69% and Gujarat Ambuja with material costs of 73%. Also, the company depends on local farmers and mandis to procure maize. Top 10 suppliers contribute to 35% of the total raw material sourced by the company, coming down from 53% in FY2022.​

The company has expanded its international presence significantly, increasing from 5 countries in FY2022 to 49 countries in FY2024. Consequently, the revenue share from exports has risen from 4% in FY2022 to 36% in FY2024. Additionally, export revenues in FY2024 have surged to 21 times the amount recorded in FY2022.

Based on annualized financials, the company is seeking a PE ratio of 26x and a market cap-to-sales ratio of 1.6x. This ask is reasonably high compared to what the industry commands. One of its closest peer Sukhjit Starch & Chemicals which operates at a slightly higher scale and operates at similar margins trades at a PE of 15x. We, therefore, suggest avoiding the issue.

details: Objectives of the Issue Offer for sale – Rs 113.05 cr & Fresh Issue – Rs 397.10 cr

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. Funding the capital expenditure requirement for expansion of the Dhule facility – Rs 181.6 crore​​
2.Repayment and/or pre-payment, in part or full, of certain borrowings availed by the company – Rs 100 crore​​
3. General corporate purposes – Rs 115.5 crore
​

about: Sanstar Limited is engaged in the manufacturing of plant-based specialty products such as dried and liquid glucose, maltodextrin, maize starch, etc. which are used to enhance the taste and texture of packaged foods. They also find use in the animal nutrition industry and some industrial processes.

The company operates from two manufacturing facilities each located in Dhule, Maharashtra and Kutch, Gujarat. It has an installed capacity of 363,000 TPA which makes it the fifth largest manufacturer of maize based specialty products in India.
Each of these facilities are duly certified with US FDA, FSSAI, HALAL, Kosher and International Standards for Quality Management.
​The company is a recognized exporter of plant-based products with 35% of the FY2024 revenues derived from exports to 49 countries spanning across Asia, Africa, Middle East, America and Europe.
The company’s revenue grew by 116% between FY2022 and FY2024 and stood at Rs 1067.3 crore for FY2024.
In FY2024, the company’s Return on Net Worth stood at 30.92%, an improvement of 292bps from 28% recorded in FY2023.
For FY2024, the operating margins for the company improved to 9.20%, from 6.01% recorded in FY2023 and 7.87% recorded in FY2022.
The Net profit margin of the company stood at 6.17% for FY2024, up from 3.46% in FY2023 and 3.15% in FY2022.

The company has generated positive cash flow from operations in two of the last three years. The company reported a CFO of Rs 28.6 crore in FY2024, which was 26% of EBITDA, suggesting higher working capital requirement.
​The company has a debt of Rs 127.6 crore as of 31st March 2024.

issue_details.Promoters: SATISH MEHTA, SUNIL MEHTA, NAMITA THAPAR AND​ SAMIT MEHTA ​
issue_details.Lead Manager: Kotak Mahindra Capital, Axis Capital, Jefferies and JP Morgan​

listed.styick_header_txt: Emcure Pharmaceuticals Limited is going public with a fresh issue and an offer for sale. The issue opens on 3rd July 2024.​​​​​​​​​
listed.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/GmxOrmFTGqM" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: Given that the company draws a significant amount of revenues from the highly regulated markets of Europe and North America, the company is required to be compliant with the strict regulations of the US FDA, UK MHRA, Health Canada, ANVISA Brazil, etc. among others. The company has in the past (2019) received a warning from the US FDA for 3 of its manufacturing facilities and the products under the warning are still under import alert.

Over the past two years, the company has experienced an increase in advertising and promotional expenses. Additionally, it has expanded its salesforce by over 1,000 personnel in the last 2 years. This expansion has led to a 12% decline in productivity, with revenue per salesperson dropping to Rs 5.7 lakh in FY2024 from Rs 6.5 lakh in FY2022. These increased costs have negatively impacted the company's operating and profit margins.

3.header: Market leaders in Gynecology and Antivirals​
desc: The company is a market leader in both the gynecology and HIV antiviral drug sectors. In the gynecology therapeutic area, it has a 13.5% market share, which is 1.7 times greater than its nearest competitor. In the domestic HIV antivirals market, the company holds a 51.5% market share. The gynecology segment contributes 24.1% to the company's domestic revenues, while antivirals account for 6.85% of domestic revenues.

Based on FY2024 financials, the company is seeking a PE of 36x and a market cap-to-sales ratio of 2.9x. This ask is reasonably less compared to the average of 40x commanded by the pharmaceutical industry. However, the significant gap in profitability between the company and the industry makes us pessimistic about its prospects. Therefore, we recommend avoiding this issue.​

details: Objectives of the Issue – Offer for Sale – Rs 1,152.03 cr & ​Fresh Issue – Rs 800 cr

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. Repayment and/or prepayment of all or a portion of certain outstanding borrowings availed by the Company – Rs 600 crore​​
3. General corporate purposes – Rs 200 crore​​
​​

about: Emcure Pharmaceuticals is an Indian pharmaceutical company based out of Pune, engaged in developing and manufacturing of pharmaceuticals including oral (solids and liquids), injectibles and biotherapeutics. The company majorly caters to gynecology and antiviral (HIV) therapeutic areas in India and is the largest pharma company to do so.

The company has an international presence in over 70+ countries and exports majorly to the European nations and North America. The company is present in the therapeutic areas of Gynecology, Antiviral, Cardiovascular, Respiratory, Gastrointestinal, etc. among others.
The company operates 13 manufacturing facilities across the states of Maharashtra, Gujarat, Sikkim and Karnataka and the union territory of Jammu and Kashmir, in India.
The company’s revenue grew by 14% between FY2022 and FY2024 and stood at Rs 6,658 crore.
In FY2024, the company’s Return on Net Worth stood at 16.87%, a decline from 21.27% and 33.32% recorded in FY2023 and FY2022, respectively.
For FY2024, the operating margins for the company stood at 19.01%, coming down from 20.24% and 23.54% recorded in FY2023 and FY2022, respectively.
The Net profit margin of the company stood at 7.86% for FY2024, coming down from 9.31% and 11.81% recorded in FY2023 and FY2022, respectively.
The company has consistently generated positive cash flow from operations in the last three fiscal years. The company reported a CFO of Rs 1,097 crore in FY2024, which is 86% of EBITDA.
​The company has a debt of Rs 2,335 crore (incl. lease liabilities) as of 31st March 2024.

issue_details.Promoters: ARUN GUPTA, ANITA GUPTA, PRANAV BANSAL AND ARUN KUMAR GUPTA HUF

listed.styick_header_txt: Bansal Wire Industries Limited is going public with a fresh issue. The issue opens on 3rd July 2024.​​​​​
listed.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/p1PfuH9GJ3c" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: The company operates with a business model where it procures raw materials from suppliers by entering into contracts, but the price is finalized as per market conditions. On the other hand, the company carries out its production upon receiving an order at a pre-agreed prices and any fluctuation in the raw material prices may lead to inconsistent losses or profits.

2.header: Heavy Capex to put a strain on future profitability
desc: The company plans to establish the country's largest single-location steel wire manufacturing facility in Dadri, UP, with a projected cost of Rs 449 crore. Out of this amount, the company has already invested Rs 358 crore in FY2024. This significant capital expenditure will strain profitability in the medium term due to increased depreciation costs.​

The company exports its products to several countries including Brazil, France, Germany, Italy, etc. among others and has a well diversified customer base of 5000+ customers. Except for a group company and one dealer company, no other customer contributes for more than 5% of the company’s total revenue.

Based on the FY2024 financials, the company is asking for a PE of 51x and a market cap-to-sales of 1.62x. Compared to its peers, which are operating at higher margins, are trading at an average PE of about 40x. We, therefore, suggest not subscribing to the issue.

details: Objectives of the Issue Fresh Issue – Rs 745 cr

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. Repayment or prepayment of all or a portion of certain outstanding borrowings availed by the company – Rs 453 crore​​
2. Investment in subsidiaries for the purpose of repayment or prepayment of all or a portion of certain of its outstanding borrowings – Rs 94 crore​
3. Funding the Working Capital requirements of the company – Rs 60 crore​
4. General corporate purposes - Rs 138 crore
​

about: Bansal Wire Industries is engaged in the manufacturing of steel wires broadly categorized into high carbon steel wires, mild (low) carbon steel wires and stainless-steel wires. The company along with its material subsidiary, Bansal Steel & Power, provides over 3000+ SKUs.

High carbon steel wires are made with 0.3% to 1% of carbon and are known for its exceptional strength and durability, whereas the low carbon steel wires are made with 0.05% to 0.25% of carbon and are known for its ductibility and malleability. These products find use in springs, cutting tools, power & transmission, agriculture, construction consumer durables, hardware, automotive, etc. among others.

The company operates out of its 4 manufacturing facilities located in the National Capital Region (Delhi NCR) with 3 facilities located in Ghaziabad (UP) and 1 facility located in Bahadurgarh (Haryana). The company has an installed capacity of 259,000 MTPA.

The company caters to 22 states and UTs in the country with a major presence in the regions of Delhi, Haryana, Maharashtra and UP with revenues of 64.8% being derived from these states for the year ended March 2024.
The company’s revenue grew by 12% between FY2022 and FY2024 and stood at Rs 2,466 crore.
In FY2024, the company’s Return on Net Worth stood at 21.19%, a decline from 23.71% and 29.92% recorded in FY2023 and FY2022, respectively.
For FY2024, the operating margins for the company stood at 6.04%, up from 4.73% and 5.13% recorded in FY2023 and FY2022, respectively.
The Net profit margin of the company stood at 3.19% for FY2024, coming down from 2.47% and 2.60% recorded in FY2023 and FY2022, respectively.
The company has not been able to consistently generated positive cash flow from operations in the last three fiscal years. The company reported a negative CFO of Rs 537 crore in FY2024.
The company has a debt of Rs 681 crore (incl. lease liabilities) as of 31st March 2024.

issue_details.Promoters: VIJAY ANAND JHANWAR, KUSUM LATA MAHESHWARI, GOPAL SPONGE AND POWER PRIVATE LIMITED, V.A.​TRANSPORT PRIVATE LIMITED , KIRTI ISPAT PRIVATE LIMITED

listed.styick_header_txt: Vraj Iron and Steel Limited is going public with a fresh issue. The issue opens on 26th June 2024.​​​
listed.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/WwsXowhvy28" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: The company is witnessing a growing contribution from its top-5 and top-10 customers to its revenues. For the nine months ending December 2023, the top-5 customers accounted for 41.5% of revenues (up from 38.1% in FY2021), while the top-10 customers accounted for 63.8% of revenues (up from 58.3% in FY2021). The largest customer alone contributed 13.84% of revenues in FY2023.

The company sells its products to industrial clients through traders and agents without engaging in long-term contracts. Goods are supplied on an order basis, which may result in challenges in accurately predicting future revenues and financial requirements.​

3.header: High Volatility in the Steel industry
desc: The steel industry is inherently a volatile one with factors such as changes in domestic and international demand and supply, changes in international production and capacity, geopolitical situations, freight and transportation costs, etc. among others, greatly impacting business. The prices of TMT Bars, Sponge Iron and MS Billets have gone down for the nine months ended December 2023.

4.header: Better operational efficiency compared to peers
desc: The company operated at an EBITDA margin of 15.4% for FY2023, compared to 11.8% reported by its closest listed peer Shyam Metallics. The company also recorded ROE of 38.3% for FY2023 compared to 13.06% recorded by Shyam Metallics.

Based on annualized financials, the company is seeking a PE ratio of 11.5x and a market cap-to-sales ratio of 1.7x. This ask is reasonable when compared to its closest peer, Shyam Metallics, which currently trades at a PE ratio of 17.8x and a market cap-to-sales ratio of 1.38x. However, due to the significantly smaller scale of operations, we recommend avoiding the issue.

details: Objectives of the Issue Fresh Issue – Rs 171 cr

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. Repayment/prepayment of borrowings from HDFC Bank – Rs 70 crore​​
2. Funding capital expenditure for the expansion project at the Bilaspur plant – Rs 59.5 crore​
3. General corporate purposes – Rs 41.5 crore
​

about: Vraj Iron and Steel is a company engaged in the manufacturing of Sponge Iron, Mild Steel Billets (MS Billets) and TMT Bars under the brand “Vraj”.

The company operates through two manufacturing plants located in Raipur and Bilaspur in the state of Chhatisgarh spread across 53 acres. As of 31st December 2023, the total capacity of the manufacturing facilities stood at 231.6 kilo tonnes per annum (KTPA). The company has installed a 5MW power plant for captive use at its facility in Raipur.

The company is going through an expansion phase in which they are adding capacities for Sponge Iron (115 KTPA) and MS Billets (153 KTPA) at its facility in Bilaspur which are expected to become operational in Q4FY2025 and Q1FY2026, respectively. The company is also planning a 15 MW power plant for captive use in the Bilaspur facility.
The company’s revenue grew by 77% between FY2021 and FY2023 and stood at Rs 515.7 crore. Revenues for the first nine months of FY2024 stood at 301.3 crore.​
In FY2023, the company’s Return on Net Worth stood at 38.32%, an improvement from 32.94% and 19.01% recorded in FY2022 and FY2021, respectively.
For 9MFY2024, the operating margins for the company improved from 15.8% in FY2023 to 21.6%. But this is significantly higher compared to 12% and 10% recorded in FY2022 and FY2021, respectively.
​The Net profit margin of the company stood at 14.8% for 9MFY2024, up from 10.5% recorded in FY2023.
​The company has consistently generated positive cash flow from operations in the last three fiscal years. The company reported a CFO of Rs 62.9 crore in FY2023, which is 77% of EBITDA.
The company has a debt of Rs 51 crore (incl. lease liabilities) as of 31st December 2023.

issue_details.Promoters: KISHORE RAJARAM CHHABRIA, BINA KISHORE CHHABRIA, RESHAM CHHABRIA JEETENDRA HEMDEV, BINA​CHHABRIA ENTERPRISES PRIVATE LIMITED
issue_details.Lead Manager: ICICI Securities, Nuvama Wealth and ITI Capital

listed.styick_header_txt: Allied Blenders and Distillers Limited is going public with a fresh issue and offer for sale. The issue opens on 25th June 2024.​​​​
listed.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/OHdCCIBO7dc" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: The company has more of its brands in the popular (mass) segment and less in the premium segment compared to its peers such as United Spirits and Radico Khaitan. For the first nine months of FY2024, the company registered gross margins of close to 36%, which is 700 bps lower compared to Radico Khaitan and 1100 bps lower compared to United Spirits recorded in FY2024.

2.header: Over-dependence on the Officer’s Choice brand
desc: The company operates two whiskey brands named “Officer’s Choice” and “Sterling Reserve”. Whiskey contributes up to 96% of the total revenues and “Officer’s Choice” in particular, constitutes to 73% of the total revenues in 9MFY2024. This dependence has been reducing since FY2021 when it contributed 84% of the total revenues.​

3.header: 3rd Largest IMFL player in the country
desc: The company operates majorly in the mass premium segment and is the 3rd largest player in the Indian IMFL market (by volume) with a market share of 8%, just behind United Spirits and Pernod Ricard with market share of 23% and 17%, respectively.

Based on annualized financials, the company is asking for a PE of 1395x and a market cap-to-sales of 2.3x. The company has not been able to generate good profits for the past 4 years. Operating majorly in the mass premium segment, the company isn’t able to generate profits and ends up breaking even in terms of profits. Its competitors are premiumizing its offerings and hence are able to generate good profits for themselves. Hence, we suggest avoiding to this issue.

details: Objectives of the Issue Fresh Issue – Rs 1000 cr & Offer for Sale – Rs. 500 cr

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. Prepayment and scheduled re-payment of certain portion of outstanding borrowings availed by the company – Rs 720 crore​
2. General corporate purposes
​

about: Allied Blenders and Distillers is the country’s third largest Indian-made Foreign Liquor manufacturer behind United Spirits and Pernod Ricard. The company manufactures whiskey under brands such as “Officer’s Choice”, “Sterling Reserve” and “ICONiQ”.

The company is engaged in the manufacturing of five categories of IMFL namely whiskey, brandy, rum, vodka and gin. The company’s products have a presence in 30 states across 79,329 retail outlets with exports to 14 international markets such as in Middle East, North America, Africa, Asia and Europe.

The company operates a distillery located in Rangapur, Telangana spread over an area of 25,000 square meter with a distillation capacity of 60 million liters per year. The company operates through 32 bottling facilities, nine of which are owned by the company, others being contracted from third-party bottlers out of which five are on an exclusive basis and the rest 18 are on a non-exclusive basis.
The company’s revenue grew by 11.4% between FY2021 and FY2023 and stood at Rs 7,106 crore. Revenues for the first nine months of FY2024 stood at 5,911 crore.​
In FY2023, the company’s Return on Net Worth stood at 0.39%, whereas ROCE stood at 25.87%.​
​For 9MFY2024, the operating margins for the company improved from 6.23% in FY2023 to 7.27%. But this is lower compared to 9.07% and 7.73% recorded in FY2021 and FY2022, respectively.
The Net profit margin of the company stood at 0.17% for 9MFY2024, up from 0.05% recorded in FY2023 and FY2022.
​The company has consistently generated positive cash flow from operations in the last three fiscal years. The company reported a CFO of Rs 230 crore in FY2023, which is 117% of EBITDA.
The company has a debt of Rs 809 crore (incl. lease liabilities) as of 31st December 2023.

issue_details.Lead Manager: Axis Capital, ICICI Securities, JM Financial and SBI Capital

listed.styick_header_txt: Stanley Lifestyles Limited is going public with a fresh issue and offer for sale. The issue opens on 21st June 2024.​​
listed.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/KS6OmCAcaYI" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: Over the years, the company has developed a vertically integrated model, giving them extensive control over the entire manufacturing process—from sourcing raw materials to designing and producing the products—and retailing them through both COCO (company owned and company operated) and FOFO (franchise owned and franchise operated) stores.

As of December 2023, the company operated 38 COCO stores located in major metro-cities of Bengaluru, Chennai, New Delhi, Mumbai and Hyderabad; and operated 24 FOFO stores in 21 cities across the country. The company added 9 stores in the nine months ended December 2023, following an addition of 6, 16 and 14 stores in FY2021, FY2022 and FY2023, respectively. Average revenue per store in FY2023 stood at Rs 5.75 crore.​

The company upholds high standards by utilizing premium quality materials. They source leather from certified tanneries in Europe and timber from certified vendors in Southeast Asia. For the nine months ending December 2023, imports accounted for 68% of the total Cost of Goods Sold (COGS). The company has taken initiative to reduce its dependence on imports and source key raw materials domestically.

Based on FY2023 financials, the company is asking for a PE of 60x and a market cap-to-sales of 5x. The company does not have any listed peers in this space. Anticipating a shift in the furniture market towards the organized sector, the industry is poised for a rapid growth. We, therefore, suggest subscribing to the issue.

details: Objectives of the Issue Fresh Issue – Rs 200 cr & Offer for Sale – Rs. 337.02 cr

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. Opening new stores under the formats of “Stanley Level Next”, “Stanley Boutique” and “Sofas & More by Stanley”.​​
2. Opening anchor stores.​
3. Renovation of existing stores under the formats of “Stanley Level Next”, “Stanley Boutique” and “Sofas & More by Stanley”.​
4. Funding the capital expenditure requirements for purchase of new machinery and equipment.​
5. General corporate purposes.
​

headervalue: Oman India Joint Investment Fund II​

about: Stanley Lifestyles Limited is a luxury furniture brand operating in India with a spectrum of collection ranging across sofas, coffee tables, TV cabinets, Kitchen cabinets, dining table, beds, mattresses and wardrobes. The company operates under the brand “Stanley”.

​The company operates in a total of 3 segments - 1) Super premium – the price point is between Rs 15 lacs to Rs 30 lacs, and the company operates under the brand “Sofas & more by Stanley”; 2) Luxury – the price point is between Rs 30 lacs to Rs 50 lacs, and the company operates under the brand “Stanley Boutique”; and 3) Ultra Luxury – the price points is above Rs 50 lacs, and the company operates under the brand “Stanley Level Next”.

The company operates through a network of COCO (company owned and company operated) and FOFO (franchise owned and franchise operated) stores. The company has an integrated model which gives them greater control over the process from procuring raw materials to manufacturing and retailing their own goods.
The company’s revenue grew by 114% between FY2021 and FY2023 and stood at Rs 419 crore. Revenues for the first nine months of FY2024 stood at 313.3 crore.
In FY2023, the company’s Return on Net Worth stood at 16.3%, up from 11.8% recorded in FY2022.
For 9MFY2024, the operating margins for the company declined from 19.74% in FY2023 to 18.44%. But this is significantly higher than the operating margins of 15.2% recorded in FY2021.
​The Net profit margin of the company stood at 5.97% for 9MFY2024, down from 8.35% recorded in FY2023.

The company has consistently generated positive cash flow from operations in the last three fiscal years. The company reported a CFO of Rs 67.9 crore in FY2023, which is 82% of EBITDA and 194% of net profits.
The company has a debt of Rs 213 crore (incl. lease liabilities) as of 31st December 2023.

issue_details.Promoters: KRISHAN LALIT BANSAL, ASHIMA BANSAL AND DDE PIPING COMPONENTS PRIVATE LIMITED

listed.styick_header_txt: DEE Development Engineers Limited is going public with a fresh issue and offer for sale. The issue opens on 19th June 2024.​​​
listed.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/A3JqwTyEzgo" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: For the year ended FY2023, the company recorded ROE of 3.14% and a ROCE of 3.91%, which is significantly lower compared to its competitor having ROE and ROCE of 8.96% and 9.66%, respectively. The company has also been piling up debt over the years with Net Debt to Equity ratio climbing up consistently from 0.49x in FY2021 to 0.85x in 9MFY2024.

2.header: Low utilization in the Palwal I facility
desc: The Palwal I facility produces induction-bended pipes majorly catering to the power sector including nuclear power. Due to a lack of power projects, the facility has witnessed a low capacity utilization of around 5.5% for the past 4 years.​

For 9MFY2024, the company recorded EBITDA margins of 12.45% compared to 8.28% recorded by its peer IGSEC Heavy Engineering in the same period. Due to low utilization at the Palwal I facility, depreciation of the assets continue without much revenue generation. Despite higher margins, PAT margins stood at 2.63% for the company compared to 4.2% for its competitors.

4.header: Reducing yet high concentration from top customers
desc: The top customer contribution to their revenues came down from 19% in FY2021 to 12.46% in 9MFY2024. Consequently, for 9MFY2024, the top-10 customer concentration stood at 66% (down from 77% in FY2021) and top-20 customer concentration stood at 86% (down from 93% in FY2021).

Based on annualized financials, the company is asking for a PE of 73x and a market cap-to-sales of 2.6x. It’s closest listed peer in India, ISGEC Heavy Engineering is currently trading at a PE of 35x and market cap-to-sales of 1.45x. The company is operating at a much lower scale to its competitor and has lower return ratio metrics which does not justify the premium valuation. We, therefore, suggest avoiding this issue.

details: Objectives of the Issue Fresh Issue – Rs 325 cr & Offer for Sale– Rs. 93.01 cr

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. Funding the working capital requirement of the company – Rs 75 crore
2. Repayment of debt in full or partially – Rs 175 crore​
3. General corporate purposes - Rs 75 crore
​

about: DEE Development Engineers is an engineering company involved in the process of manufacturing process piping systems for industries such as oil & gas, power and chemicals. The product portfolio of the company includes high-pressure piping systems, piping spools, modular skid piping systems, Longitudinally Submerged Arc Welded (LSAW) pipes, etc. among others.

Apart from piping solutions, the company also provides engineering services which include 3D modelling and layout design, pipe size and pressure calculations, carrying out stress tests, estimating suitable piping tonnage, etc. The company also produces wind turbine towers and industrial chimneys.

The company has 7 manufacturing facilities. 3 of which are located in Palwal (Haryana), with one each in Anjar (Gujarat), Barmer (Rajasthan), Numaligarh (Assam) and Bangkok (Thailand). Additional to this, they have set up an engineering facility in Chennai.
As of December 2023, the total production capacity stood at 94,500 MT with capacity utilization reaching 51.5% in the nine months ended March 2024.

The company recorded revenues of Rs 595 crore in FY2023, witnessing a growth of 29% over FY2022, following a consistent increase in its executable order book. Revenues for 9MFY2024 stood at Rs 546 crore.
​In FY2023, the company’s ROCE stood at 3.91%, remained flat compared to 3.99% reported in FY2022.
The company improved its operating margins from 1.81% and 2.28% in FY2021 and FY2022, respectively, to 3.49% in 9MFY2024.
The Net profit margin of the company stood at 2.63% for 9MFY2024, an expansion of 45bps from FY2023.
The company has consistently generated positive cash flow from operations in the last three fiscal years. The company reported a CFO of Rs 69.7 crore in 9MFY2024, which is 103% of EBITDA.
The company has a debt of Rs 430 crore as of 31st December 2023.

issue_details.Promoters: ​Nirmal Jain, Manju Jain, Dipesh Jain & Nirmal Jain HUF

listed.styick_header_txt: Akme Fintrade Limited is going public with a fresh issue. The issue opens on 19th June 2024.​​​​
listed.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/VIHKGii-KAw" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: The lender operates in the states of Rajasthan, Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh, and Gujarat with just 12 branches across these states. The financing space is already competitive with many regional players having strong foothold in the SME lending space. As a result, the company has not been able to grow its AUM over the years. The AUM as of 31st December 2023 stood at Rs 379 crore, a drop of 10% from its AUM in FY2021.

The lender has not been increasing its number of branches over the years. The lender has majority of its presence in Rajasthan with 50% of its branches in the state, 69% of the loans outstanding and 76% of the Interest Income originating from Rajasthan​

As of 31st December 2023, 79% of the loans outstanding were business loans which are extended to the self-employed category of people. With higher income uncertainty of this group, it makes the segment riskier for lending.
The lender operates in Vehicle financing and small business loans which are majorly securitized loans. The lender therefore has a strong capital adequacy ratio of 42.02% as of 31st December 2023.

The lender is asking for a valuation of 2.36x its book value of December 2023, which is lower compared to some of its listed peers. The scale of operations of the lender is far lower compared to some of its established peers and that does not give us confidence in the lender’s operations. We, therefore, suggest avoiding this issue.

details: Objectives of the Issue Fresh Issue – Rs 132 cr

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. Augmenting the capital base of the lender – Rs 132 crore​
​

about: Akme Fintrade, an RBI-registered NBFC operating under the brand name "Aasaan Loans," focuses on providing lending solutions tailored to rural and semi-urban areas. The lender primarily offers business and vehicle loans to small business owners.
The lender operates in four Indian states—Rajasthan, Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh, and Gujarat—with 12 branches and 25 points of contact, having served 200,000 customers to date.

The lender operates through a “hub & spoke” model wherein the major operations are carried out from their registered office in Udaipur, Rajasthan. The loans are sourced from its branches and points of contacts which are located in the 4 states and credit assessment and loan disbursal is done from the registered office.

The company recorded interest income of Rs 50.77 crore in 9MFY2024. The lender recorded an interest income of Rs 63.10 crore in FY2023, which came down from Rs 64.86 crore in FY2022 and Rs 84.16 crore in FY2021.
​For FY2023, the lender’s ROE stood at 7.72% whereas ROA stood at 4.05%.​
As of 31st December 2023, the lender’s Gross NPA stood at 3.94% whereas Net NPA stood at 1.94%. Provision Coverage Ratio (PCR) stood at 50.85%, improving from 24.66% in FY2023.
Average yield on the loan book stood at 17.89% for FY2023 whereas the cost on borrowings stood at 13.56%. NIM for the year ended March 2023 stood at 10.05%.
As of 31st December 2023, the Capital Adequacy Ratio stood at 42.02%.

issue_details.Lead Manager: Axis Capital, DAM Capital and JM Financial

listed.styick_header_txt: Le Travenues Technlogy Limited (ixigo) is going public with a fresh issue and offer for sale. The issue opens on 10th June 2024.​​​
listed.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/0pwboF-Q6Ao" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: The company has been increasing its take rate across all three modes of transport: flights, trains, and buses. The take rate for flights rose from 7.50% in FY2021 to 8.25% in the first nine months of FY2024. For trains, the take rate increased from 5.47% in FY2021 to 6.57% in the same period. Meanwhile, the take rate for buses improved significantly from 6.95% in FY2021 to 10.99% in the first nine months of FY2024.

2.header: Refund programs helping garner market share
desc: The company offers an assured refund program that allows customers to cancel airline, train, and bus tickets for a full refund at a nominal cost. These refund programs have helped the company garner market share in all 3 segments. For the first half of FY2024, the company has improved its market share to 52.4% in the OTA rail market (from 46.15% in FY2023), 12.5% in online bus ticket booking market (from 11.5% in FY2023) and 5.2% in the airline OTA market (from 3.3% in FY2023).​

For 9MFY2024, the company allocated 24% of its revenues to advertising its three brands, an increase from 19% of the revenues in FY2023. The company has intensified its advertising and marketing efforts post-COVID to attract and retain customers. Consequently, the customer acquisition cost rose from Rs 44.3 per customer in FY2021 to Rs 198.5 per customer in the first nine months of FY2024.

Based on TTM financials, the company is asking for a PE of 51x and a market cap-to-sales of 5.7x. It’s closest listed peer in India, Easy Trip Planners is trading at a PE of 48.7x and market cap-to-sales of 12.5x. Upon attaining a good scale, the company has the potential to operate at better margins. Therefore, being available at a valuation reasonable to its peer, we recommend subscribing to the issue.

details: Objectives of the Issue
Fresh Issue – Rs 120 cr​ & Offer for Sale – Rs. 620.10 cr​

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. Funding Working Capital requirements of the company – Rs 45 crore​
2. Investments towards technology and data science – Rs 25.8 crore​
3. Funding future inorganic acquisitions and General corporate purposes – Rs 49.2 crore
​​

about: Le Travenues (ixigo) operates an OTA platform for Indian travellers to plan, book and manage their trips across rail, air, buses and hotels. This OTA platform allows travellers to book and manage their entire trips, as well get additional services such as predictions on confirmed train tickets, status updates on the selected mode of transportation, alternate route suggestions, etc. among others.
The company stood as the second largest OTA in India in terms of revenues. The company operates four brands namely ixigo flights, ixigo trains, AbhiBus and ConfirmTkt.

For the half year of FY2024, the company had a market share of 52.4% (highest) in the OTA rail bookings, 12.5% (second-highest) market share in the online bus ticket bookings and a market share of 5.2% in online airline bookings.​
​The company increased its registered users from 64.66 million in FY2021 to 213.21 million in December 2023, at a CAGR of 54%.
The company’s revenue for FY2023 stood at Rs 501.3 crore, growing at a CAGR of 92% from FY2021 to FY2023. Revenues for 9MFY2024 stood Rs 491 crore, a growth of 35% over 9MFY2023.
In FY2023, the company’s Return on Net Worth stood at 5.74%, up from (negative) 7.15% recorded in FY2022.
​The company’s operating margins for 9MFY2024 stood at 6.99%, dropping 200bps over FY2023.
The Net profit margin of the company stood at 13.38% for 9MFY2024, an expansion of 872bps from FY2023.

The company generated a positive cash flow from operation in FY2023 and 9MFY2024, after reporting negative CFO for FY2021 and FY2022. The company recorded CFO of Rs 36.4 crore, 155% of the net profits.
The company has a debt of Rs 50.2 crore as of 31st December 2023.

issue_details.Promoters: Joginder Singh Jaswal, Ketan Ramani and Pritesh Ramani

listed.styick_header_txt: Kronox Lab Sciences Limited is going public with an offer for sale. The issue opens on 3rd June 2024.​​
listed.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/0wsJmXskZuM" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: The company has avoided entering into long-term contracts with any of its clients and depend upon purchase orders from time to time. This may lead to poor capacity planning, over capacity addition and lack of clear revenue projections in the future. The company is now considering to enter long-term contracts and has ongoing engagements with certain customers.

The industry involves a long process for customer acquisition and product approval and the gestation period is high. A typical product approval cycle involves 1-2 months of sample testing, 6-9 months of lab scale testing, 12-18 months of regulatory filings and approvals and 2-3 months of production and delivery. This leads to higher working capital requirements. ​

Top 10 customers contributed to 45.2% of the revenues in 9MFY2024. This is a significant reduction from 56.32% recorded in FY2021. Top 20 customer contribution has also come down from 71% in FY2022 to 58.5% in 9MFY2024. Out of the total 592 customers served in the last 4 years, the company witnessed 141 (23.8% of 592) repeat customers.

On an annualized basis, the company is seeking a valuation of 24.5x its profits. The company is significantly smaller in size to its listed peers such as Tatva Chintan Pharma, TANFAC Industries, Neogen Chemicals, Sigachi Industries and DMCC Specialty.
The peers are trading at an average P/E of 67. Kronox Labs has the highest operating and profit margins among the listed companies. But taking into consideration the size of the company and the inherent nature of the chemical business is making us issue an Avoid rating on the company.

details: Objectives of the Issue Offer for Sale– Rs. 130.15 cr
No objectives as the issue is purely an Offer For Sale.​

about: Kronox Lab Sciences is engaged in the manufacturing of high-purity specialty chemicals used extensively in the manufacturing of APIs as well as excipients (inactive ingredient) in the pharmaceutical industry, reagents for scientific research, ingredients used in nutraceutical, agrochemical formulations and personal care products, etc.
The company has a product portfolio of more than 185 products supplied to customers in India as well as exported to over 20 countries globally.​
Its share of revenues from exports have increased from 20.6% in FY2021 to 25.1% in 9MFY2024. They have grown at a CAGR of 37% between FY2021 and FY2023.
The company has served 592 customers in the past 4 years, out of which 141 customers amounting to 23.8%, have placed repeat orders with the company.

The company has 3 manufacturing units located at Vadodara in Gujarat, which are close to seaports of Mundra, Kandla and Hazira. As of 31st December 2023, the installed capacity stood at 7,242 TPA. They have also acquired a land parcel in Dahej for future capacity expansion.

The company’s revenue for FY2023 stood at Rs 96 crore, growing at a CAGR of 24% between FY2021 and FY2023. Revenues for the nine months ended December 2023 stood at Rs 68 crore, down 9% over 9MFY2023.

The company operated at an EBITDA margin of 30% in 9MFY2024, which is an improvement of 722bps over FY2023. ​This was due to lower costs of raw materials in the period leading to an improvement of 516bps in the gross margins.

Consequently, the Net profit margin of the company stood at 22.6% for 9MFY2024, an expansion of 556bps from FY2023. PAT margins have been improving consistently from 15.39% in FY2021 to 17.04% in FY2023.
​The company registered a Return on Net Worth of 37.19% for the year ended March 2023.
​The company has consistently generated positive cash flow from operations in the last three fiscal years. The company reported a CFO of Rs 19.6 crore in FY2023, which is 89% of EBITDA.
As of 31st December 2023, the company is debt-free.

issue_details.Promoters: Amit Ramani and Peak XV Partners

listed.styick_header_txt: Awfis Space Solutions Limited is going public with a fresh issue and offer for sale. The issue opens on 22nd May 2024.​​​
listed.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/-xRv6RF2dzk?si=0SXM4ZhVkOi0BTR6" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: After successfully operating through the work-from-home model, many mid-sized companies have adopted a hybrid work model, which allows for a smaller workplace, thereby increasing the demand for flexible workstations.

India’s startup ecosystem has experienced robust growth, driven by a surge in venture capital investments. The number of startups recognized by the Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT) has been growing at a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 68% since 2018. For these entities, co-working solutions and customized modern offices are essential needs.​

Over the past two years, the company has been enhancing its profitability, despite still operating at a loss. They have improved their profit margins to (negative) 3.07% in the first nine months of FY2024, up from (negative) 8% in FY2023 and (negative) 21% in FY2022. Compared to well-established peers like WeWork, COWRKS, and SmartWorks, Awfis is performing well in terms of profitability and has a better asset turnover.

The company faces an inherent risk of low capacity utilization relative to its existing capacity. Offering space on flexible leases means that an unexpected departure of a large client, coupled with an inability to quickly secure a new tenant, could result in significant financial losses from the unoccupied space.

On an annualized basis, the company is seeking a valuation of 3.25x its sales. The company has no listed peers and has not been profitable yet. A recent transaction in WeWork India has valued it at Rs 3000 crore, which is 2.3x its FY2023 sales. This puts Awfis’s issue at a premium, but improving profitability of the company makes us maintain a Neutral view on the issue.

details: Objectives of the Issue Fresh Issue – Rs 128 cr & Offer for Sale– Rs. 470.93 cr

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. Funding capital expenditure towards establishment of new centers – Rs 42 crore
2. Funding the working capital requirements – Rs 54 crore​
3. General corporate purposes and inorganic growth – Rs 32 crore

about: Awfis Space Solutions, established in 2015, is India's largest flexible workspace provider by number of centers. As of December 2023, the company operated 169 centers across 16 cities, totaling 5.33 million square feet. They have also signed agreements for 13 additional centers, encompassing 0.55 million square feet.
The company provides office space for freelancers, startups, SMEs, and large corporations, available for rental periods ranging from one hour to several years.

In addition to offering co-working solutions, the company has expanded into providing custom-built workspace solutions, facility management services, food and beverages, event management, and IT support.

The company operates under two business models: 1) Straight Lease (SL) method, in which it leases space from the landlord or developer, paying a security deposit and monthly rent; 2) Managed Aggregation (MA), where the developer assists by sharing the cost of fit-out projects, receiving a portion of the revenue in return.

The company’s revenue for FY2023 stood at Rs 545.3 crore, growing at a CAGR of 75% between FY2021 and FY2023. Revenues for the nine months ended December 2023 stood at Rs 616.5 crore, already above the revenues for FY2023.

The company operated at an EBITDA margin of 31% in FY2023, which came down from 42% in FY2021. Due to higher depreciation on account of increasing properties, the company has not been able to generate profits for the past 3 years and for the nine months ended December 2023.
The Net profit margin of the company stood at (negative) 3% for 9MFY2024, an expansion of 570bps from FY2023. PAT margins have been improving consistently from (negative) 20% in FY2021.
The company has consistently generated positive cash flow from operations in the last three fiscal years. The company reported a CFO of Rs 195.2 crore in FY2023, which is 111% of EBITDA.
​The company has a debt of Rs 709.3 crore (including lease liabilities) as of 31st December 2023.

issue_details.Promoters: Kamesh Goyal, Go Digit Infoworks, Oben Ventures and FAL Corp.
issue_details.Lead Manager: ICICI Securities, Morgan Stanley, Axis Capital, IIFL Securities and Nuvama Wealth.

listed.styick_header_txt: Go Digit General Insurance is going public with a fresh issue and offer for sale. The issue opens on 15th May 2024.​

desc: The company has utilized technologies like AI/ML and big data analytics to develop and underwrite insurance contracts, resulting in increased accuracy. As of December 2023, the insurer had a claim settlement ratio of 96.2%, significantly higher than established peers such as ICICI Lombard (84.9%), United India Insurance (87%), Acko General Insurance (89.8%), and Star Health (89%). This high claim settlement ratio has led to loyal customers and repeat business.

Incorporated in 2017, the company has rapidly expanded, achieving a 3% market share in the non-life insurance sector and a 6% share in the motor insurance segment. Over the past two years, it has grown its Gross Written Premium at a CAGR of 49%.​

Despite efforts to reduce its reliance on motor insurance, the company still generated around 61% of its Gross Written Premium (GWP) from motor insurance in the nine months ending December 2023. This is not a significant decrease from the 62% and 63% contributions in FY2022 and FY2023, respectively.​

The company is seeking a valuation of 3.4 times its GWP, which is lower than the 3.8 times Price/GWP ratio of its established peer ICICI Lombard. At the current price, it is asking for a Price-to-Book (P/B) ratio of 10.1, which is higher than that of ICICI Lombard’s 6.7. However, considering the company's rapid GWP growth, this valuation seems reasonable. Therefore, we maintain a neutral stance on the issue.​

details: Objectives of the Issue –​ Fresh Issue – Rs 1,125 cr & Offer for Sale– Rs. 1,489.65 cr

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. Maintenance of solvency ratio – Rs 1,125 crore
​​

about: Go Digit General Insurance is a digital full stack insurance player offering non-life insurance products ranging from motor insurance, health insurance, travel insurance, marine insurance, etc. among others. The share of motor insurance in the total GWP stood at 61% in 9MFY2024, whereas the share of health insurance stood 15% in 9MFY2024.
The insurer has a strong focus on enabling technology in the non-life insurance value chain to enable faster and seamless issuance and claim settlement processes.

Go Digit was one of the front runners in enabling technology-based insurance products and has garnered a market share of 82.5% among the full stack digital insurers, followed by Acko General Insurance and Navi General Insurance.

The insurer ranked 8th among the non-life insurer players in India with a market share of around 3% in the nine months ended December 2023. It also ranked 3rd in the motor insurance segment with a market share of 6% in the same period.
The insurer grew its Gross Written Premium (GWP) to Rs 6,680 crore, at a CAGR of 49% from FY2021 to FY2023. For the nine months ending December 2023, GWP growth stood at 26% over 9MFY2023.
For 9MFY2024, the insurers AUM stood at Rs 14,909 crore, growing by 26% over 9MFY2023. Investment income for the period grew by 50% to Rs 776.5 crore.
The company has invested 62.6% of its assets in Government bonds and 28.5% of its assets in corporate bonds.
The insurer’s yield on investment stood at 7.4% for 9MFY2024 (annualized), an expansion of 120bps over 9MFY2023.

The insurer had a solvency margin of Rs 2,628 crore indicating a solvency ratio of 160%. The minimum required solvency by the regulator is 150%, and hence the company is raising money to improve its solvency.

issue_details.Promoters: Ankush Nijhawan, Gaurav Bhatnagar, Manish Dhingra, Arjun Nijhawan and LAP Travel

listed.styick_header_txt: TBO Tek Limited is going public with a fresh issue and offer for sale. The issue opens on 08th May 2024.​​​​
listed.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/VjWviTapbeI" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

1.header: Robust business model for Hotels and ancillary
desc: The company follows a B2B model for Hotels and ancillary where they put a mark-up above the price quoted from the suppliers and make it available to the buyer. This model gives them greater control over the pricing which can be witnessed from the take rate consistently increasing from 6.84% in FY2021 to 8.10% in 9MFY2024. This growth in take rate can also be attributed to its growth in GTV from the international markets of Europe, Middle East and North America.

The top supplier contributed to 27.4% of the total GTV, down from 30% in FY2021; top 5 and top 10 suppliers contributed to 60% and 71% of the total GTV, down from 70% and 80% respectively in FY2021, for the nine months ended December 2023. Average take rate for 9MFY2024 stood at 5.38%, up 62bps from FY2023.​

TBO Tek's take rate in FY2023 was recorded at 4.77%, notably lower than its global counterparts like Webjet and TravelCTM, which operate at higher rates of 8.39% and 7.37% respectively. With increased investments directed towards expanding its international operations, we foresee a continued rise in its take rates, ultimately bolstering the company's operating margins.

Networking effect helps in bringing more and more suppliers and buyers to the platform. With the technology already in place, cost of serving an additional customer is negligible. Consequently, as the customer base expands over time, this will ultimately result in higher margins.

Based on TTM financials, the company is asking for a PE of 55x and a market cap-to-sales of 7.6x. It’s closest listed peer in India, RateGain Travel Technologies is currently trading at a PE of 61x and market cap-to-sales of 8.8x. With high operating leverage, we believe TBO Tek could operate at higher margins in the future fetching a premium to its competitors. Hence, we suggest subscribing to the IPO issue.

details: Objectives of the Issue
Fresh Issue & Offer for Sale– Rs. 1,550.81 cr​

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. Investment in Technology and Data solutions – Rs 135 crore
2. Investment in a Material Subsidiary, Tek Travels DMCC, for onboarding platform users through marketing and promotional activities; hiring sales and contracting personnel for augmenting Supplier and Buyer base outside India – Rs 100 crore
3. Investment in sales, marketing and infrastructure to support organization’s growth plans in India - Rs 25 crore
4. Unidentified inorganic acquisitions – Rs 40 crore.
5. General corporate purposes and inorganic growth – Rs 100 crore​​

about: ​TBO Tek Limited is an online travel distribution platform, where it brings together suppliers (such as Hotels, airlines, cruises, railways, insurers, etc.) and buyers (such as travel agencies and advisors, tour advisors, online travel apps, super apps, etc.) to match the needs of each. The platform seamlessly lets the suppliers display their inventory and set prices for buyers to conveniently pick and choose.

The company operates on two business models – 1) a B2B Rate Model, where it applies a certain mark-up on the price set by the suppliers and pass it on to the buyers; 2) Commission Model, where suppliers fix the cost, they want the end traveler to buy, and pay a certain commission to the company on each transaction.

For 9MFY2024, Take rate (% of revenue earned from the gross transaction value) for the B2B model stood at 8.10% and 2.63% for the Commission model. Revenues from the B2B model contributed 72% of the total revenues whereas the Commission model contributed to 25% of the total revenues.
The company’s revenue grew by 120% in FY2023, due to lower base effect from the COVID-affected FY2022. This was followed by a growth of 31% in 9MFY2024.
In FY2023, the company’s Return on Net Worth stood at 44%, up from 14.5% recorded in FY2022.
The company improved its operating margins from (negative) 16% and 7.74% in FY2021 and FY2022, respectively, to 19.59% in 9MFY2024.
The Net profit margin of the company stood at 15.06% for 9MFY2024, an expansion of 112bps from FY2023.

The company has consistently generated positive cash flow from operations in the last three fiscal years. The company reported a CFO of Rs 237.4 crore in FY2023, which is 119% of EBITDA and 160% of net profits.
​The company has a debt of Rs 80.4 crore as of 31st December 2023.

issue_details.Lead Manager: Kotak Mahindra Capital, ICICI Securities, Citigroup, SBI Caps and Nomura

listed.styick_header_txt: Aadhar Housing Finance Limited is going public with a fresh issue and offer for sale. The issue opens on 08th May 2024.​​
listed.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/fAGthrZqn8k" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: The company has reported Return on Assets (RoA) of 4.2% as of December 2023, which notably surpasses its two nearest competitors. Aavas Financiers reported an RoA of 3.28% as of March 2024, while Home First Finance recorded an RoA of 3.7% as of December 2023. The lender also enjoys a better spread on the loans given out. On TTM basis, the lender recorded spreads of 6.4% compared to Aavas Financiers’ 5.06% and Home First Finance’s 5.3%.

As of December 2023, 83% of the outstanding loan AUM were floating interest loans and the remaining 17% were fixed interest loans. The lender has opted for 100% long-term financing to avoid any asset-liability mismatch with an average tenure of 9.7 years (as of 31st December 2023).​

The proportion of loans extended to self-employed customers, as a share of the lender's outstanding loans, has been steadily increasing, rising from 36.2% in March 2021 to 42.8% in December 2023. This trend leads to better yields but exposes the lender to the risk of delayed payments and potential defaults. This can be witnessed from a 30bps increase in Gross NPAs to 1.4% compared to March 2021.

The lender is asking for a valuation of 3.2x its book value of December 2023. This is lower compared to the closest peer Aavas Financiers, which trades at a P/B ratio of 3.3x its book value of March 2024. Given that Aadhar Housing Finance operates at a higher spread, we suggest subscribing to the issue.

details: Objectives of the Issue Fresh Issue - Rs. 1,000 cr & ​Offer for Sale– Rs. 2,000 cr

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1.To meet future capital requirement of the lender for loan disbursement – Rs 750 crore
2. General corporate purposes and inorganic growth – Rs 250 crore

about: Aadhar Housing Finance Limited is a housing finance company with a focus on the low-income housing segment (ticket size < Rs 15 lac). As of 31st December 2023, the company managed assets of Rs 19,865 crore, making it the largest player in the lower-income category of housing loan providers.

The company was earlier promoted by the Wadhawan family, promoters of DHFL. The Wadhawan family sold its entire stake in the company to Blackstone backed BCP Topco VII in June 2019 for a total consideration of Rs 2,200 crore.

As of December 31, 2023, the lender operated in 20 states and UTs through a network of 487 branches including 109 sales offices. The average ticket size of the loans disbursed in the nine months ended December 2023 was Rs 10 lacs with an average loan-to-value ratio of 58.3%.

As of 31st December 2023, the top 5 states accounted for 61% of the total AUM. The company’s capital adequacy ratio (CAR) stood strong at 39.7%. Gross NPA’s for the same period stood at 1.4% whereas Net NPA’s stood at 1.0%.
The lender has grown its loan AUM from Rs 13,327 crore in FY2021 to Rs 19,865 crore in 9MFY2024, at a CAGR of 16%.
​For 9MFY2024, Net Interest Income stood at Rs 1,170 crore, growing from Rs 760 crore in FY2021 at a CAGR of 17%, in line with the AUM growth.
Interest spread for the lender improved from 5.0% in FY2021 to 6.4% for the trailing twelve months. Following which, NIMs for the trailing twelve months has improved to 9.0% from 5.8% in FY2021.
The lender has grown is profits from Rs 340 crore in FY20221 to Rs 545 crore in FY2023 at a CAGR of 27%.

issue_details.Lead Manager: Kotak Mahindra Capital, Citigroup, JP Morgan and Nomura

listed.styick_header_txt: Indegene Limited is going public with a fresh issue and offer for sale. The issue opens on 06th May 2024.​​​
listed.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/1Rdg7wDFuBg?si=B8VptdYOFO9TPc2v" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: The company possesses domain expertise in Healthcare with 20.5% of the frontline employees being from the healthcare background. The company is present across the commercialization value chain right from clinical trials to marketing & sales to pharmacovigilance. The company also has a suite of software solutions embedded with AI/ML capabilities to provide actionable insights across the value chain.

Marketing & Sales are responsible for the highest spends (35% of the total spends) in the Life Sciences industry. This segment is the second least outsourced spend in the life sciences industry. According to an Everest Group study, the outsourcing of Marketing and Sales operations is set to grow at a CAGR of ~14.5% till 2026.​

The company has a database on 20 lac Healthcare Professionals (HCP) and has on record over 20 crore HCP interactions till date. Data captured on interactions and prescriptions helps in creating cohorts, to develop targeted marketing strategies for such cohorts in driving optimal results.

On an annualized basis, the company is asking for a PE of 31x and a market cap-to-sales of 3.96x. These valuations are at a discount compared to the other specialist IT players in the market. Also, there are no other listed players in the healthcare technology sector. Hence, we suggest subscribing to this issue.

details: Objectives of the Issue
Fresh Issue & Offer for Sale– Rs. 1,841.76 cr​

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. Repayment/prepayment of indebtedness in one of their Material Subsidiaries, ILSL Holdings, Inc. – Rs 391 crore​​​
2. Funding the capital expenditure requirements for one of their Material Subsidiaries, Indegene Inc. – Rs 103 crore​
3. General corporate purposes and inorganic growth – Rs 266 cro​​

about: Indegene Limited provides digital-led commercialization services for the life sciences industry, including biopharmaceutical, emerging biotech and medical devices companies. Indegene offers comprehensive support across the entire spectrum of the drug lifecycle, spanning from drug development and clinical trials to regulatory submissions, pharmacovigilance, and sales and marketing of their products.

The company has established relationships with each of the top 20 biopharmaceutical companies in the world (by revenue). They have contributed to more than 69% of Indegene’s revenues for the past 4 years.

As of December 31, 2023, Indegene had a total of 65 active clients. Out of these, 27 clients gave business worth USD 1 million to USD 10 million, 5 clients gave business worth USD 10 million to USD 25 million and 3 clients gave business upwards of USD 25 million during the 12 months ended December 2023.
The company’s revenue has grown at a CAGR of 54% between FY2021 and FY2023. Revenue growth for 9MFY2024 stood at 15% over 9MFY2023.
In FY2023, the company’s Return on Net Worth stood at 25.02%, an improvement of 345bps over FY2022.
The Net profit margin of the company stood at 12.62% for 9MFY2024, an expansion of 108bps from FY2023 and 284bps from FY2022.

The company has consistently generated positive cash flow from operations in the last three fiscal years. The company reported a CFO of Rs 354 crore in 9MFY2024, which is 84% of EBITDA and 146% of net profits.
The company has a debt of Rs 491 crore as of 31st December 2023.

issue_details.Promoters: Mascot Capital, JNK Global, Goutam Rampelli and Dipak Bharuka.

listed.styick_header_txt: JNK India Limited is going public with a fresh issue and offer for sale. The issue opens on 23rd April 2024.​​
listed.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/qRCB30aCT3A" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: JNK Global holds a strategic investment in the company. However, despite the heating equipment market boasting a value of around USD 42 billion (~ Rs 3.5 lac crore) worldwide, the company's reported sales for FY2023 amounted to just Rs 1006 crore, indicating a market share of less than 1%. The parent company, being comparatively minor on the global stage, doesn't appear to offer any significant economic benefits.

The company largely outsources its domestic projects to numerous SMEs across the country. This practice could potentially encourage many of these small-scale entities to independently pursue projects, thereby intensifying competition within the market. Given that the fabrication of heaters is a business with relatively narrow profit margins, the existing margins appear unlikely to sustain over the long term.​

3.header: High amount of inventory and receivables
desc: Due to substantial inventories and outstanding receivables, the company faces a significant demand for working capital. It has experienced negative operating cash flows for FY2023 and the first nine months of FY2024, with a notable increase in working capital from Rs. 34 crore in FY2021 to Rs. 182 crore in 9MFY2024.

Based on the FY2023 financials, the company is seeking a PE ratio of 50x and a market cap-to-sales ratio of 5.6x. These valuations seem expensive, given the ordinary nature of the business along with strained working capital situation. Hence, we recommend not subscribing to this issue.

details: Objectives of the Issue
Fresh Issue & Offer for Sale– Rs. 649.47 cr​

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. Funding Working Capital requirements – Rs 263 crore​​
2. General Corporate Purposes – Rs 37 crore
​​

about: JNK India is engaged in the business of manufacturing process fired heaters, reformers and cracking furnaces, which are majorly used in processing industries such as oil & gas refineries, petrochemical and fertilizer facilities.
The company has, over years diversified into flares and incinerator systems and have been developing capabilities in the renewable sector with green hydrogen.
The company’s business model involves collaboration with the customers from initial consultation, design & specifications and final installation of the product.

As of December 31, 2023, JNK India has catered to 21 customers in India and 8 overseas, which include 7 of the 12 oil refining companies in India. The company’s clientele include IOCL, Tata Projects, Rashtriya Chemicals & Fertilizers, etc. among others.
The company’s revenue has compounded at 72% from FY2021 to FY2023.
​In FY23, The company’s Return on Net Worth stood at 47.7%.
The Net profit margin of the company stood at 18.24% in 9MFY2024, up 686bps on FY2023. This is a result of no freight charges in 9MFY2024, which is event-based.
The Net profit margin of the company stood at 18.24% in 9MFY2024, up 686bps on FY2023. This is a result of no freight charges in 9MFY2024, which is event-based.
The company had generated positive operating cashflows for FY2021 and FY2022, but operating cashflows turned negative in FY2023 and 9MFY2024, due to higher levels of receivables and inventory piling.
The company had a debt of Rs 68 crore as of 31st December 2023.

issue_details.Promoters: Euro Pacific Securities, Aditya Birla Group

listed.styick_header_txt: Vodafone Idea is going public with a fresh issue. The issue opens on 18th April 2024.​​​

1.header: Low ARPU due to higher 2G base
desc: Of the 22.3 crore subscribers, 42% of the subscribers are on 2G networks. As per the management’s commentary, ARPU from 2G subscribers is 1/3rd of ARPU derived from 4G customers. The company recorded ARPU of Rs 145 for 9MFY2024 which is significantly lower compared to Rs 208 for Airtel and Rs 182 for Jio in the same period.

2.header: Lower Operating margins compared to the industry
desc: The telecom operator has recorded margins of 40% for the nine months ended December 2023. Historical margins have been around the 40% mark, which are way below the industry standards of 50%. With majority subscribers being on 2G, there could be some scope for an improvement, given the company is able to convert these subscribers into 4G and 5G, going ahead.​

The telecom operator, as of 29th February 2024, owed in total a sum of Rs 1,95,810 crore arising out of deferred spectrum auctions. Subject to the “Telecom Reform Package” announced in September 2021, a moratorium of 4 years was provided. The company has an obligation to make annual instalment payments of Rs 24,747 crore for the next 8 years, failing which the company will further have to dilute its stake to the Government (who already owns 32% of the company).​

The company is running losses for the last 8 years. As per TTM sales, the company is asking for a valuation of 1.7x of sales. This is less compared to the other listed and profitable players such as Bharti Airtel trading at 4.85x of TTM sales and Bharti Hexacom trading at 6.35x its TTM sales. We therefore recommend to not subscribe to this issue.

details: Objectives of the Issue
Fresh Issue – Rs. 18,000 cr​

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. Purchase of equipment for the expansion of our network infrastructure by: (a) setting up new 4G sites; (b) expanding the capacity of existing 4G Sites and new 4G sites; and (c) setting up new 5G sites – Rs 12,750 crore​​
2. Payment of certain deferred payments for spectrum to the DoT – Rs 2,175 crore​​
3. General Corporate Purposes – Rs 3,075 crore
​​

about: Vodafone Idea is the third largest telecom player in India with over 22.3 crore subscribers as of 31st December 2023. It has a subscriber market share of 19.3% in India, declining from 29.8% recorded in FY2020.

The company operates in 22 telecom circles and has presence in 487,000 towns, providing broadband services in over 342,200 of them, facilitated by 183,400 distinct tower locations. This expansive network covers a population of approximately 1.2 billion individuals nationwide.
The company offers voice, data and broadband services in the country. They have a strong enterprise business with value-added offerings such as IoT and cloud services.

The company offers music and gaming options on its newly launched Vi App. They also offer a diverse range of content created through collaboration with content creators and OTT players. The company has also integrated a job and education platform on its Vi App.
As of 31st December 2023, the company held an aggregate spectrum of 8,005 MHz to be used across 2G, 3G, 4G and 5G technologies.
​The company’s revenue has degrown at a CAGR of 1.4% since FY2020.
Owing to losses, the company’s Return on Net Worth has been negative for the past few years.
The Operating margin of the company stood at 39.9% in 9MFY2024, flat over FY2023 and down 174 bps in FY2022 respectively.
The company has consistently generated positive cash flow from operations in the last three fiscal years. The company reported a CFO of Rs 18,869 crore in FY2023, which is 147% of EBITDA.
The company’s interest cost is very high. For the past 2 years, the interest cost was over 120% of CFO.
The company’s outstanding debt (excl. deferred payments) as of 29th February 2024, stood at Rs 6,019 crore.

listed.styick_header_txt: Bharti Hexacom Limited is going public with an offer for sale. The issue opens on 03rd April 2024.​​
listed.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/JcZ-35tUfyI" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

1.header: Divergent Approaches to Acquiring Telecom Spectrum
desc: During the 2022 5G telecom auction, the company opted out of applying for the 700 MHz frequency band, citing financial constraints. In contrast, its competitor, Reliance Jio, seized the opportunity to acquire the 700 MHz and 800 MHz bands, recognizing their suitability for 5G networks.

2.header: Excessive dependence on a limited number of suppliers
desc: The company sources 68% of its towers from Indus Towers (an affiliate company of Bharti Airtel). Further, top 5 suppliers account to 74% of the gross block addition in 9MFY2024, increasing from 65% in FY2023.​

3.header: Possible merger with Bharti Airtel in the future
desc: Bharti Airtel, being a majority shareholder in the company with a 70% stake, we anticipate a potential merger between Bharti Airtel and Bharti Hexacom given the synergies they might draw from each other.​

As per the TTM financials, the company is asking for a PE of 59x and a market cap-to-sales of 4.1x. These valuations are on par with its peers in the telecom industry and its parent company Bharti Airtel. ​​​

Bharti Hexacom, being a subsidiary of Bharti Airtel, the second largest telecom company in India, needs to trade at a discount to its parent company given the scale Bharti Airtel operates at. Hence, we do not recommend subscribing to this IPO as of now.

details: Objectives of the Issue
No objectives as the issue is a complete offer for sale.​

about: Bharti Hexacom is a communications solution provider offering consumer mobile services, fixed-line telephone and​ broadband services under the “Airtel” brand. It serves customers in Rajasthan and the North-Eastern states of Arunachal Pradesh, Manipur, Meghalaya, Mizoram, Nagaland and Tripura.
The company has access to Airtel’s comprehensive portfolio of digital infrastructure and services such as Airtel Xstream, Airtel Black, Airtel Wynk (music streaming), etc.
​For the nine months ended December 2023, the company holds a revenue market share of 40.4% and 52.7% in Rajasthan and North-East circle, respectively.
Share of postpaid customers for the company increased from 2.7% in March 2023 to 3.1% in December 2023.​

As of December 2023, the company utilized 24,874 towers out of which 5,092 are owned and the remaining 19,782 towers are leased. 13,432 or 68% of the leased towers are sourced from Indus Towers, an affiliate company of its promoters (Bharti Airtel).
The company's revenue has grown at 43% over the last two years.
In FY23, The compan's Return on Net Worth was 13.8%.

The Net profit margin of the company is 5.4% in 9MFY2024, down 295bps recorded in FY2023, due to tax adjustments for previous years and a one-time interest charge on revenues due to change in nature of expenditure of Variable License fees from revenue to capital.

The company recorded an extraordinary gain of ₹ 1,951 crore in profits during FY2022 on account of commercial settlement with a service provider. They also recorded an extraordinary charge of ₹ 169 crore in FY2022 on account of license renewal, spectrum usage and tax reconciliation in different states.
The company has consistently generated positive cash flow from operations in the last three fiscal years. The company reported a CFO of Rs 2,930 crore in 9MFY2024, which 104% of the net profits.
​The company has a debt of Rs 9,432 crore as of 31st December 2023.
