desc: The company’s major clients include government agencies such as National Highways & Infrastructure Development Corporation Limited (NHIDCL), Ministry of Road Transport and Highways (MoRTH), Border Road Organization (BRO) and Public Work Department, Jammu & Kashmir, among others. Top 5 clients of the company contribute 80% of the company’s revenue in 9MFY2024.

The operations of the company are fully concentrated in the UTs of Jammu & Kashmir and Ladakh. The company has just started diversifying into other states with projects being awarded from the neighbor states of Uttarakhand and Himachal Pradesh.​

3.header: Lower operating margins compared to peers
desc: The company operates at an EBITDA margin of 13% (excl. OI) for 9MFY2024, compared to its closest peers having EBITDA margins upwards of 22%.​

As per the FY2023 financials, the company is asking for a PE of 26x and a market cap-to-sales of 1.6x. These valuations are above one of its better performing rival G R Infraprojects, trading at a PE of 11x and market cap-to-sales of 1.3x. Hence, we do not recommend subscribing to this IPO as of now.​​​

details: Objectives of the Issue – Fresh Issue– Rs. 130 crore

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. Funding capital expenditure requirements for the purchase of equipment/machineries.​
​2. Full or partial repayment of Borrowings.​
3. Funding Working Capital requirements of the company.​
4. Investment in Project Specific Joint Venture Projects.​
5. General corporate purposes​

about: SRM Contractors is an engineering, construction and development company based out of Jammu & Kashmir. The company has executed multiple road, tunnel and slope stabilization projects in the difficult terrain of union territories of Jammu & Kashmir and Ladakh.
​The company undertakes projects in either of the three ways- (1) on an item rate basis, (2) as an EPC contractor or (3) as a subcontractor.

Being a class A contractor with the Public Works Department (J&K), the entity is pre-qualified to bid independently on projects of contract value up to ₹300 crore and ₹500 crore for EPC contracts pertaining to construction of roads (including bridges) and for construction of tunnel, respectively.

The company incorporated in September 2008, till date, has completed 38 infrastructure construction projects having an aggregate value ₹ 1,412 crore. It includes 32 road projects, 3 tunnel projects and 1 slope stabilization project.
The company’s revenue has grown at 88% over the last two years.
In FY23, The company’s Return on Net Worth was 35%.
The Net profit margin of the company is 9% in 9MFY2024, up 274bps and 232bps on FY2023 and FY2022 respectively.

The company recorded an extraordinary gain of ₹ 5.62 crore in profits during 9MFY2024 due to a one-time surge in earnings from one of its joint ventures. However, we anticipate this would not continue in the future.
The company has consistently generated positive cash flow from operations in the last three fiscal years. The company reported a CFO of Rs 22 crore in 9MFY2024, which 77% of net profits.
The company has a debt of Rs 42 crore as of 31st December 2023.

listed.styick_header_txt: Krystal Integrated Services is going public with a fresh issue and an offer for sale. The issue opens on 14th March 2024.​​​​​​​​​​​​​​
listed.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/oceUtmI1kUg" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

1.header: Client Concentration and increasing attrition rates
desc: Krystal Integrated Services is involved in the business of providing outsourced services such as maintaining buildings, cleaning, maintaining payrolls, etc. The company has seen growth in both topline and bottom line over the last two years but the company has certain concerns.
The company is mainly a B2B player and the margins are very thin in this business.

Another concern is that the company’s biggest expense is its employee’s salary and if employees keep leaving, it is costly for the company as they must spend on recruitment. The attrition rates of this company have been increasing since FY21 to FY23 from 22% to 31%. Because of this the company’s margins have come under pressure, showing a declining trend.

The company despite reporting profit has reported negative cash flow from operations due to significantly higher receivables. The company’s inability to report positive cash flow from operations deprives them to use its cash to expand its services.

The company derives 80% of its revenue from its top 10 customers indicating high risk in case any of the customers decides to leave. Ideally a company would be better off having its revenue sources spread out between as many customers.
The company is asking for a PE of 26x and a market cap-to-sales of 1.4x. These valuations seem fair but considering the above concerns, we recommend avoiding this IPO.​

details: Objectives of the Issue – Fresh Issue & Offer for Sale – Rs. 300 cr

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. Repayment of debt​
​2. Funding working capital requirements of the company
3. Funding capital expenditure​
4. General corporate purposes​
​

about: Krystal Integrated Services is recognized as one of India’s leading integrated facilities management services companies, with a primary focus on sectors such as healthcare, education, public administration (including state government entities, municipal bodies, and other government offices), airports, railways, metro infrastructure, and the retail industry.

Their comprehensive range of integrated facility management service offerings caters to multiple sectors. They provide soft services such as housekeeping, sanitation, landscaping, and gardening, along with hard services like mechanical, electrical, and plumbing maintenance. Additionally, they specialize in solid, liquid, and biomedical waste management, pest control, façade cleaning, and other services including production support, warehouse management, and airport management services (including multi-level parking and airport traffic management).
Furthermore, Krystal Integrated Services offers staffing solutions, payroll management, private security, manned guarding services, and catering services to their wide-ranging customer base., 2023.
The company’s revenue has grown at 22% over the last two years while the net profit grew by 52% CAGR
In FY23, The company’s Return on Capital Employed was 29% which improved from 25% in FY22.
The Net profit margin of the company is 4.6% in H1FY24 and the EBITDA Margin was 6.9%
The company reported positive CFO in FY22, FY23, and FY23 showing healthy cash generation. The company reported negative cash flow from operations in H1FY24 due to increase in receivables.

listed.styick_header_txt: Popular Vehicles & Services is going public with a fresh issue and offer for sale. The issue opens on 12th March 2024.​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​
listed.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/tZqesHAPGFA?si=Ov5TO3mrEf8viJoY" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: The company first started into the dealership business by partnering with Maruti Suzuki in 1984. Today, Popular Vehicles is the seventh largest distributor for Maruti Suzuki in the country. The company has since strategically expanded their dealership network across the value-chain, from economy to premium to luxury vehicles, by partnering with Honda in 2008 and JLR in 2010. They further ventured into the 2-wheeler and 3-wheeler market by partnering with Ather and Piaggio in 2021.

The company is recording good volumes and top-line for the past few years, but this trend is not supporting the Operating margins of the company as can be witnessed by 119bps fall in the margins from FY2021 to FY2023. Its listed peer, Landmark Cars, is operating at better margins yet trading at par with Popular Vehicles & Services.​

3.header: Concentration to the Southern part of India
desc: The sales of the company are highly concentrated in the states of Kerala, Tamil Nadu and Karnataka with Kerala & Tamil Nadu contributing to 94% of the revenues for FY2023.​

As per the FY2023 financials, the company is asking for a PE of 33x and a market cap-to-sales of 0.43x. These valuations are at par to one of its listed players named Landmark Cars (P/E of 35) which operates as a dealer for  Mercedes-Benz, Honda, Jeep, Volkswagen, Renault, etc. Hence, we do not recommend subscribing to this IPO as of now.​

details: Objectives of the Issue – Fresh Issue & Offer for Sale– Rs. 601.5 cr

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. Repayment of Borrowings
​2. General corporate purposes​

about: Popular Vehicles & Services is one of India’s leading automobile dealer. The company caters  to the complete life cycle of vehicle ownership, right from the sale of new vehicles, servicing and repairing vehicles, distributing spare parts and accessories, to facilitating sale and exchange of preowned vehicles, operating driving schools and facilitating the sale of third-party financial and insurance products.

​They categorize their dealership business into three key segments, namely, (a) passenger vehicles (incl. luxury vehicles), (b) commercial vehicles and (c) electric two-wheeler and three-wheeler vehicles.

As of March 31, 2023, Popular Vehicles operates the fifth largest selling Maruti Suzuki dealership in India under the Arena network and the eighth largest selling Maruti Suzuki dealership in India under the Nexa network.
The company’s revenue has grown at 68% over the last two years.
In FY23, The company’s Return on Net Worth was 18.67%.
The Net profit margin of the company is 1.31% in FY23, up 34bps and 19bps on FY2022 and FY2021 respectively.

The company has consistently generated positive cash flow from operations in the last three fiscal years. The company reported a CFO of Rs 109 crore in FY2023, which is 46% of EBITDA and 170% of net profits.
The company has a debt of Rs 847 crore as of 31st March 2023.

listed.styick_header_txt: Gopal Snacks is going public with an offer for sale. The issue opens on 6th March 2024.​​​​​​​​​​​​​
listed.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/mT53jYsnD6E" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

1.header: Low product diversification and low presence across India
desc: Gopal Snacks is involved in the business of manufacturing and selling snacks such as Gathiya, Namkeen, snacks, wafers. The company’s topline hasn’t expanded significantly over the last three fiscals but it has seen significant improvement in margins. The net profit margin has expanded from 2% in FY21 to 8% in FY23 which is quite impressive. But the company has a few concerns.

Gopal Snacks is a Gujarat-based company and so derives 75% of its revenue from Gujarat. This means that it lacks a significant presence across India as compared to its peers who have a Pan India presence. Ideally, investors would prefer companies that derive revenues from diversified geographies. The company also heavily relies on its 3 top products which contribute to 90% of its revenue, this puts the company at significant risk if its top products don’t perform well.

Another concern is that despite the company tripling its capacity from FY22 to FY23, the company marginally grew its revenue by 3% in FY23 while its peers grew much faster during the same period. This was due to lower sales of its biggest products Ghatiya and Namkeen. The company saw improved margins but mainly due to reducing the grammage in its ₹5 and ₹10 packets and lower input costs.

The company was paying 12% GST on snack pellets but when an audit was conducted by the GST department, they claim that the company should pay 18%. The authorities have filed a complain against the company over this.

The company is asking for a PE of 44x and a market cap-to-sales of 3.4x. These valuations seem fair considering that its peers are trading at higher valuations but we believe that the company has few products and very less presence in India, and considering the case filed against them by the GST authority, we recommend avoiding this IPO.​

details: Objectives of the Issue – Offer for Sale – Rs. 650 cr

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. No objectives as it is an offer for sale​​
​​

about: Gopal Snacks Limited boasts a diverse product range, featuring Indian ethnic snacks like Ethnic Namkeen and Gathiya alongside a variety of western snack options such as wafers, nachos, extruder snacks, and snack pellets. Throughout its journey, the company has successfully solidified its leadership position across various product categories within the organized snacks market in India. Its commitment to quality and innovation has enabled Gopal Snacks Limited to earn the trust and loyalty of consumers while continually expanding its market presence.
The company is based in Gujarat and derives 75% of its revenue from this state alone. The total capacity of the company stands at 404,728 MT as of September, 2023.
The company’s revenue has grown at 11% over the last two years while the net profit grew by 131% CAGR ​
In FY23, The company’s Return on Capital Employed was 43% which improved from 19% in FY22.
The Net profit margin of the company is 8% in FY23 and the EBITDA Margin was 14%
The company reported positive CFO in FY22, FY23 and 9MFY24 showing healthy cash generation

listed.styick_header_txt: JG Chemicals is going public with a fresh issue and offer for sale. The issue opens on 5th March 2024.​​​​​​​​​​​​

1.header: Depending on just one product and Industry
desc: JG Chemicals is involved in the business of manufacturing and supplying zinc oxide that has various applications in the rubber, pharma, and agriculture industries. But, the company derives 90% of its revenue from Rubber making it depend heavily on this one industry for growth. The revenue and profit of the company have grown well over the last three fiscals, but the margins of the company were showing signs of a slight decline. Even in the first 9 months of FY24, the revenue, and net profit when annualized are poised to show negative growth in both top line and bottom line. This is mainly attributed to fall in zinc oxide prices globally, a result of a fall in zinc prices which is a key raw material.

JG Chemicals is involved in the business of manufacturing and supplying zinc oxide that has various applications in the rubber, pharma, and agriculture industries. But, the company derives 90% of its revenue from Rubber making it depend heavily on this one industry for growth. The revenue and profit of the company have grown well over the last three fiscals, but the margins of the company were showing signs of a slight decline. Even in the first 9 months of FY24, the revenue, and net profit when annualized are poised to show negative growth in both top line and bottom line. This is mainly attributed to fall in zinc oxide prices globally, a result of a fall in zinc prices which is a key raw material.
The company also has one product which is zinc oxide, and it just sells different grades of it. Any fluctuations in demand could adversely affect the revenues of the company in the future.
On a positive note, the company has been reporting positive cash flow from operations since FY22 and reported a CFO of Rs 67 crore which is ideal for a firm looking to expand.

If we annualize FY24, the company is asking for a PE of 35x and a market cap-to-sales of 1.2x. These valuations seem unattractive, and we believe there is little room for capital appreciation. Hence, we recommend avoiding this IPO.​

details: Objectives of the Issue – Fresh Issue & Offer for Sale – Rs. 251 cr

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. Repayment of debt
4. Funding working capital​ ​
2. Funding capital expenditure​​​
3. Setting up an R&D facility​
5. General corporate purposes​​
​​

about: JG Chemicals, India's leading zinc oxide manufacturer, boasts the largest production capacity and revenue in the industry, primarily utilizing the French process, a dominant technology globally. With a substantial market share of approximately 30% as of March 2022, JG Chemicals offers over 80 grades of zinc oxide, positioning itself among the top ten manufacturers worldwide.

Established in 2001, JG Chemicals has continually expanded its operations and diversified its product portfolio to serve various industrial sectors. Its zinc oxide finds application across a wide range of industries, including rubber (tyre & other rubber products), ceramics, paints & coatings, pharmaceuticals & cosmetics, electronics & batteries, agro-chemicals & fertilizers, speciality chemicals, lubricants, oil & gas, and animal feed. With a global footprint, JG Chemicals has become a prominent player in the zinc oxide market, catering to diverse industrial needs.
The company’s revenue has grown at 34% over the last two years while the net profit grew by 40% CAGR
In FY23, The company’s Return on Capital Employed was 29% which dropped to 8.2% for 9MFY24​
The Net profit margin of the company is 7% in FY23, but has dropped off to 4% in 9MFY24
The company reported positive CFO in FY22, FY23 and 9MFY24 showing healthy cash generation​

listed.styick_header_txt: RK Swamy is going public with a fresh issue and offer for sale. The issue opens on 4th March 2024.​​​​​​​​​​​

desc: RK Swamy is a marketing services provider engaged in promotional activities, digital advertising, and data analytics services aimed at helping clients make informed decisions. Over the past three fiscal years, the company has shown robust financial growth, with revenue and net profit increasing at a CAGR of 28% and 219% respectively.

But the stock has certain concerns when compared to other firms offering similar marketing services, RK Swamy's performance falls short. Particularly concerning is its EBITDA margin, which stands at 15%, notably lower than its peers who maintain margins above 20%.

Although the company's debt of Rs 51 crore is not substantial, its listed competitors enjoy significant net cash positions, placing them in a better position to pursue organic expansion and achieve higher net profit margins in the future. The company also reported negative CFO in H1FY24.

On a positive note, the company has a low attrition rate of just 9% which is an important factor for an IT company as employee expense is a significant portion of the total expense. The company also has a diversified client contribution to revenue with top 50 clients contributing just 75% of the total revenue.
As per FY23, the company is asking for a PE of 46x and a market cap-to-sales of 4.8x. These valuations don’t seem very expensive and investors can see some capital appreciation going forward. ​

details: Objectives of the Issue – Fresh Issue & Offer for Sale – Rs. 424 cr

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. Funding Working Capital Requirements of the company
2. Funding capital expenditure for setting up digital video content production studio​​
3. Funding to set up new customer experience centres
4. General corporate purposes​​
​​

about: With over five decades of rich experience, RK Swamy emerges as a frontrunner in integrated marketing services. Their unwavering commitment to excellence and innovation resonates through their holistic approach, seamlessly blending creative, media, data analytics, and market research services.​

Ranked 8th among integrated marketing communication service providers in India, the company offers a unified platform for all marketing needs. Their core business segments span Integrated Marketing Communications, Customer Data Analytics and Marketing Technology (MarTech), and Full-Service Market Research, including customer experience measurement and syndicated studies.

Boasting an impressive clientele comprising industry giants like Aditya Birla Sun Life AMC Limited, Cera Sanitaryware Limited, and Dr. Reddy’s Laboratories Limited, among others, the company is recognized for its ability to drive growth and success across diverse sectors
The company’s revenue has grown at 28% over the last two years while the net profit grew by 219% CAGR
In FY23, The company’s Return on Capital Employed was 29%
The Net profit margin of the company is 10% in FY23, but has dropped off to 6% in H1FY24
​The company reported positive CFO in FY21, FY22, FY23 but reported negative cash flow from operations in H1FY24 mainly due to decrease in accounts payable
The company has a debt of Rs 51 crore as of September 2023

listed.styick_header_txt: Mukka Proteins is going public with a fresh issue. The issue opens on 29th February 2024.​​​​​​​​​​

desc: Mukka Proteins is involved in the manufacturing and selling of fish meal, fish oil and fish soluble paste which are raw materials to manufacture animal fees, aquafeed and pet food. These raw materials also find use cases in consumer products such as soaps, medicines for Omega 3. The company’s financials over the last two years have shown a CAGR of 39% and 108% respectively which is impressive but this company has a few concern.
A concern is that the Top 10 customers account for 75% of the total revenue, this is quite risky for the business in case any client decides to cease business with them.
Another concern is that this business does not require high technology and so barriers to entry are very low which could increase the competition and hence, reduce margins going forward.

The company has struggled with cash flow generation in FY23 and H1FY24 as the company reported negative cash flow from operations of Rs 20 crore and Rs 54 crore, respectively. This was due to significant increase in receivables. Negative cash flow from operations deprives the firm of the ability to grow organically.

The company cannot be directly compared to its listed peers as they deal in the finished products using the raw material that Mukka Protein produces but in comparison to unlisted peers, the company isn’t the best in terms of margins.

As per FY23, the company is asking for a PE of 18x and a market cap-to-sales of 0.7x. These valuations seem fair but with such low margins, we don’t believe the company would provide significant capital appreciation going forward and Hence, we recommend avoiding this IPO.​

details: Objectives of the Issue – Fresh Issue – Rs. 224 cr

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. Funding Working Capital Requirements​​
2. General corporate purposes​​
​​

about: Mukka Proteins is a manufacturer of fish protein products, the company produces and supplies fish meal, fish oil, and fish soluble paste, which are essential ingredients in the manufacturing of aquafeed (for fish and shrimp), poultry feed (for broiler and layer), and pet food (dog and cat food). Additionally, fish oil finds applications in pharmaceutical products, with Omega-3 pills and related items derived from fish oil gaining importance as high-nutrient and healthy dietary supplements. The company's products are also utilized in soap manufacturing, leather tanneries, and paint industries.

The company serves both domestic and international markets, exporting its products to over 10 countries, including Bahrain, Bangladesh, Chile, Indonesia, Malaysia, Myanmar, Philippines, China, Saudi Arabia, South Korea, Oman, Taiwan, and Vietnam.​
The company’s revenue has grown at 39% over the last two years while the net profit grew by 108% CAGR
In FY23, The company’s Return on Capital Employed was 18% ​
​The Net profit margin of the company is 4% in FY23, showing improvement from FY21 when it was 2%
The company reported positive CFO in FY21 and FY22 but reported negative cash flow from operations in FY23 and the same trend followed in H1FY24
The company has a debt of Rs 317 crore as of September 2023

listed.styick_header_txt: Bharat Highways Infrastructure is going public with a fresh issue. The issue opens on 28th February 2024.​​​​​​​​​

desc: Bharat Highways InvIT is a specialized trust focused on managing and investing in a diversified portfolio of infrastructure assets across India, primarily roads. GR Infraprojects was the company that constructed the highway projects through its seven SPV’s and now it is transferring it to Bharat Highways InvIT. Now the company will receive annuity from the NHAI on a regular basis so the company has no risk cash flow going forward.

The company has also provided the estimated Cash flow operations up until FY26. The company will generate Rs 1,016 cr in FY24, Rs 906 cr in FY25, and Rs 940 cr in FY26. after deducting interest and expenses, the company will distribute this as dividend among investors.

But the concern here is that if we look at another company that went public in 2021 which has massively underperformed the benchmarks despite the market giving substantial returns during this period. The cash flows will keep decreasing as the assets gets depleted. So we believe that this is not a story worth investing in.
The company has a debt of Rs 3,684 crore. Now the company is going to use Rs 2400 crore out of the Rs 2500 crore issue just to reduce this debt after which it will still have a debt of Rs 1127 crore.

Normally, Invit are valued based on the future cash flows. Here chances of capital appreciations are less and only way one can look forward to have money is dividend which will decline as time progresses due to decline in the cash flow of the company. Hence, we recommend avoiding this IPO.​

details: Objectives of the Issue – Fresh Issue – Rs. 2500 cr

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. Repayment of Borrowings​
2. General corporate purposes​​
​​

about: Bharat Highways InvIT is a trust that handles various infrastructure assets across India. It was established to acquire, manage, and invest in a portfolio of infrastructure assets particularly roads across the country. The trust operates on a hybrid annuity model (HAM).

Bharat Highway’s portfolio consists of seven roads in various states including Andhra Pradesh, Punjab, Gujrat, Maharashtra and Uttar Pradesh. These roads are operated and maintained by Bharat Highways.

The company’s revenue has declined since FY21 but that is due to recognizing expenses during the projects as revenue and going forward the company would only recognize operating & maintenance expenses.
The company has generated positive cash flow from operations in FY23 and H1FY24 but previously generated negative cash flow from operations in FY21 and FY22
The company has a debt of Rs 3,684 crore as of September 2023

listed.styick_header_txt: Platinum Industries is going public with a fresh issue. The issue opens on 27th February 2024.​​​​​​​

1.header: Client Concentration and lack of high technology in the business
desc: Platinum Industries specializes in manufacturing Polyvinyl Chloride (PVC) stabilizers, Chlorinated PVC additives, and lubricants primarily used in PVC and CPVC pipe production. These additives enhance the quality and durability of PVC and CPVC pipes while reducing the risk of corrosion. While the company previously focused on producing lead-based stabilizers, it has transitioned to non-lead-based stabilizers due to safety concerns associated with lead.

In recent years, Platinum Industries has exhibited promising financial performance. Revenue and net profit have experienced significant growth, with a CAGR of 61% and 179%, respectively, over the past two years. Notably, the net profit margin stood at an impressive 16% in FY23, which would attract investor attention. But despite this the company has several concerns regarding customer concentration. The company relies very heavily on its top 5 customers who make up 82% of the company’s total revenue. This leaves the company the company vulnerable to significant revenue loss in case a client decides to not continue.
This business is not a high-tech business and doesn’t not require significant R&D, in such a case why should company demand for such high valuations.
The company has only one manufacturing unit located in Palghar, Maharashtra. This makes it difficult for the company to ship products across India.

As per FY23, the company is asking for a PE of 25x and a market cap-to-sales of 4x. We believe that these valuations are expensive for a business with so many risks, hence we recommend avoiding this IPO.​

details: Objectives of the Issue – Fresh Issue – Rs. 235 cr

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. Planning to set up a greenfield project in Egypt​​
2. Capital Expenditure in Maharashtra Plant​
3. Funding working capital requirements ​
4. General corporate purposes​​
​​

about: Platinum Industries is involved in the business of manufacturing and selling of Polyvinyl Chloride stabilizers, Chlorinated Polyvinyl Chloride, and Lubricants.​

PVC stabilizers are chemical additives used in the production of polyvinyl chloride (PVC) based products to enhance the performance and durability of PVC. These stabilizers enhance the thermal stability of PVC by allowing it to withstand heat without significant degradation or loss of physical properties. They prevent the discoloration, embrittlement and degradation of PVC caused by UV exposure, ensuring the longevity and aesthetics of PVC-based applications. It also improves the mechanical properties of PVC, such as its impact strength, tensile strength, and flexibility
The current capacity of the company stands at 26.950 MTPA
​The company’s revenue has grown at 61% over the last two years and net profit at 179%
In FY23, The company’s Return on Capital Employed in FY23 was 56%
​The Net profit margin of the company is 16% in FY23 which has improved in the last two years. The NPM was 5% in FY21.
The company has consistently generated positive cash flow from operations except for FY22 when the company reported a negative cash flow from operations mainly due to increase in Accounts receivable.
​The company has a debt of Rs 11 crore which is negligible

listed.styick_header_txt: Exicom Tele Systems is going public with a fresh issue and an offer for sale. The issue opens on 27th February 2024.​​​​​​​​

1.header: Client Concentration and decline in revenue
desc: Exicom Tele Systems specializes in Control Power Systems providing power distribution and EV charging. The Control Power systems business contributes to 70% of the company’s revenue while the rest is derived from EV.

The company’s financials haven’t grown that well in the last two years with revenue declining in FY23 as compared to FY22 numbers. None of its peers experienced such a decline in FY23 revenue, in fact they saw revenue growth. The company also struggles with a very low net profit margin of less than 1% which will seem very unattractive to investors.
The company’s top 5 customers make up 57% of the revenue which poses risk on the business as it could lead to significant business losses in case one of those companies decides to not continue.
Another concern is that the company has been generating volatile cash flow from operations which doesn’t ensure stability in the firm.

As per FY23, the company is asking for a PE of 270x and a market cap-to-sales of 2.3x. Despite the company made significant profit in H1FY24, we are using FY23 numbers for valuation as we do not know how sustainable this profit is. Hence, we recommend avoiding this IPO.​

details: Objectives of the Issue – Fresh Issue & Offer for Sale – Rs. 429 cr

about: Established in 1994, Exicom Tele Systems stands as a pioneering force in the realm of power management solutions, with its headquarters nestled in India. With a steadfast commitment to innovation and sustainability, the company operates across two distinct business verticals, each dedicated to driving positive change in the energy landscape.

The first vertical, the Critical Power Solutions business, epitomizes Exicom Tele Systems' expertise in designing, manufacturing, and servicing DC Power Systems and cutting-edge Li-ion based energy storage solutions. These offerings play a pivotal role in delivering comprehensive energy management solutions to telecommunications sites and enterprise environments, both within India and abroad.

In parallel, Exicom Tele Systems' Electric Vehicle Supply Equipment (EV Charger) solutions business exemplifies its foresight and innovation in enabling the transition towards sustainable transportation. As one of the earliest entrants into the EV Chargers manufacturing segment in India, the company has not only pioneered groundbreaking technologies but also captured a significant market share. As of March 31, 2023, its market dominance stood at an impressive 60% in the residential charging segment
The company’s revenue has grown at 17% over the last two years and net profit at 36%
In FY23, The company’s Return on Capital Employed in FY23 was 11% ​
​The Net profit margin of the company is 1% in FY23

The company has consistently generated positive cash flow from operations but the cash generation has been very volatile as the company reported CFO of Rs 69 crores in FY22 and then reported Rs 7 crores in FY23
The company has a debt of Rs 73 crore

listed.styick_header_txt: GPT Healthcare is going public with a fresh issue and offer for sale. The issue opens on 22nd February 2024.​​​​​​

1.header: Healthy financials and a high occupancy rate
desc: GPT Healthcare operates a chain of four hospitals in East India under the brand name 'ILS Hospitals', specializing in nephrology (kidney) and diabetology. The company's hospitals collectively offer 561 beds to cater to patient needs. Despite a marginal decline in net profit in FY23, the company has maintained an impressive net profit margin of 10-11%, reflecting efficient financial management.

In terms of financial performance, GPT Healthcare has witnessed robust revenue growth, with a Compound Annual Growth Rate (CAGR) of 21% over the last two years. Despite not having the highest Average Revenue per Operating Bed (ARPOB) in the industry, the company has sustained healthy operating and net profit margins. This demonstrates effective cost management and operational efficiency.

Moreover, GPT Healthcare has received commendable feedback from visitors, boasting a high rating of 4.5/5 for its hospitals, underscoring the quality of service provided. The company's occupancy rate stood at a commendable 60% in FY23, indicating efficient utilization of its bed capacity.

The company's positive cash flow from operations provides a strong foundation for organic expansion. With plans to add two new hospitals with a combined bed capacity of 292 by FY26, GPT Healthcare aims to further enhance its market presence and service offerings.

A notable aspect of GPT Healthcare's financial management is its prudent debt reduction strategy. The company has significantly reduced its debt from Rs 123 crore to Rs 55 crore over the years. This debt reduction not only strengthens the company's financial position but also provides room for further improvement in net profit margins.

The company is asking for a PE of 39x and a market cap to sales of 4x which is lower as compared to its listed peers who command higher valuations. These peers command higher valuations due to higher ARPOB and better profit margins. Hence, we believe the company could provide capital appreciation to investors going forward.​

details: Objectives of the Issue – Fresh Issue & Offer for Sale– Rs. 525 cr

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. Repayment of debt​​​​
2. General corporate purposes​​

about: GPT Healthcare operated 4 hospitals under the brand name of ILH hospitals. The hospitals are in Salt Lake, Dum Dum, Howrah in West Bengal and Agartala in Tripura with a total bed capacity of 561 beds. The company is planning to add 140 seats in Ranchi Hospital and 152 beds in Raipur Hospital.
The hospitals provide treatment for Nephrology (kidney), Diabetes, Gastroenterology, Gynaecology, cardiology, Neurosciences, orthopaedics and Paediatrics.​
The revenue of the company has grown at a CAGR of 21% in the last two years.
The company has reported positive cash flow from operations consistently in the last three fiscal years and also in the recent June quarter as well.
In FY23, The company’s ROCE was 26% and the net profit margin stood at 11%.
​The company also boasts a healthy EBITDA margin of 22% in FY23

listed.styick_header_txt: Juniper Hotels is going public with a fresh issue. The issue opens on 21st February 2024.​​​​​

1.header: Crippling Debt and consistently reporting losses
desc: Juniper Hotels operates several prominent hotels across India, including the Grand Hyatt Mumbai, Hyatt Regency Ahmedabad, Andaz Delhi, and Hyatt Delhi Residencies. Despite significant revenue growth in recent fiscal years, the company has consistently reported losses. Even in H1FY24, the losses exceeded those of FY23.

The primary concern lies in the company's substantial debt burden. With total borrowings amounting to Rs 2,253 crore, this represents a considerable liability compared to the company's revenue, which stood at just Rs 717 crore in FY23. The weight of interest payments from this debt has contributed significantly to the company's ongoing losses.

Additionally, Juniper Hotels faces revenue concentration risks, with a significant portion of its revenue derived from the Grand Hyatt Mumbai and Delhi properties, accounting for 91% of the total revenue.

Despite maintaining a commendable occupancy rate of 74%, which is among the best in the industry. But while other companies with similar occupancy rates are profitable, Juniper Hotels continues to struggle.

As per FY23, the company is asking for a market cap-to-sales of 11x. These valuations seem very expensive for a company that has consistently reported losses and hence, we would advise avoiding this IPO.​

details: Objectives of the Issue –​ Fresh Issue - Rs. 1800 cr

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. Repayment of Borrowings​​​
2. General corporate purposes​​

about: Juniper Hotels owns and operates multiple hotels such as the Grand Hyatt Mumbai, Azad Delhi and Hyatt Delhi residencies, Hyatt Regency Ahmedabad. The company benefits from a long-standing partnership with Hyatt Hotels Corporation, a globally recognized premier hospitality brand. This partnership spans over 40 years and is unique in India. The company is the only hotel development entity in India with which Hyatt has a strategic investment.The Saraf Group and Two Seas Holdings own 95% of the stake while the rest is owned by Juniper Investments.

The company recently acquired Chartered Hotels Private Ltd which had three hotels. This acquisition added 430 keys to the portfolio of the company taking it to a total of 1836 keys as of 30th September, 2023.
The company’s revenue has grown at 93% over the last two years while the profit of the company has remained negative​
The company has a debt of Rs 2253 crore as of 30th September, 2023. This figure has increased as compared to the Rs 1830 crore in FY21.
The EBITDA Margin of the company stands at 36.9% in H1FY24 which has fallen as compared to H1FY23 which stood at 43.7%.

listed.styick_header_txt: Vibhor Steel Tubes is going public with a Fresh issue. The issue opens on 13th February 2024.​​​​

1.header: Customer Concentration Risk and inconsistent cash flow from operations
desc: Vibhor Steel Tubes operates in the manufacturing of steel products, including ERW pipes, Galvanized pipes, and Hollow Section pipes. These products find applications in various sectors such as oil and gas transportation, water transportation, construction, etc. The company's primary customer is Jindal Pipes, for which it manufactures and sells products under the brand name 'Jindal Star'. Despite reporting growth in revenue and net profit, there are significant concerns that investors should consider.

One major issue is the company's EBITDA per tonne, a key efficiency metric in the steel industry, which is lower compared to its competitors. This indicates that the company may have lower operational efficiency and profitability margins compared to its peers.

Another significant concern is the company's consistent struggle to generate positive cash flow from operations. Even in H1FY24, the company reported negative cash flow from operations of Rs 8 crore. This ongoing negative cash flow reduces the company's ability to internally finance expansion and forces it to rely more heavily on debt to fund capital expenditures, which could increase financial risk in the long term.

The most alarming issue is the heavy reliance on a single client, Jindal Pipes, which contributes 93% of the company's total revenue as of March 2023. This concentration of revenue from one client exposes Vibhor Steel Tubes to significant risk, as any adverse decision or change in business terms by Jindal Pipes could have a severe impact on the company's financial stability and operations.

The company is asking for a PE of 13.6x and a market cap to sales of 0.3x which in comparison to its listed peer is quite fair but considering the above issues related to the company, we recommend avoiding this IPO.​

listed.styick_header_txt: Entero Healthcare Solutions is going public with a Fresh issue & Offer for Sale. The issue opens on 9th February 2024.​​​

desc: The company operates as an intermediary between hospitals, pharmacies, and manufacturers, offering an application facilitating the ordering of medicines, medical devices, and equipment. Additionally, it provides manufacturers with data analytics to analyze demand, aiding inventory management decisions. It also sells medical devices under its own brand names.

Despite reporting losses until FY23, the company achieved profitability in H1FY24. Remarkably, its topline has exhibited substantial growth over the past three fiscal years, with revenue expanding at a CAGR of 36% from FY21 to FY23.

In India, the absence of comprehensive online platforms for retailers to procure equipment has left local distributors with a dominant market share of 90-92%. Entero addresses this gap by digitalizing the procurement process for hospitals and pharmacies, streamlining equipment orders. The company's clientele has notably expanded from 1600 to 2800 hospitals within a span of two and a half years.

Looking ahead, the digitalization of medical products and devices is poised to escalate, which bodes well for the company's financial performance. As the demand for streamlined procurement processes continues to rise, Entero is positioned to capitalize on this trend, potentially further enhancing its financial outlook.

The company is asking for a market cap to sales of 1x which in comparison to its listed peer is quite fair despite making losses. But we believe going forward, the company has a great potential and will report profits and hence, recommend subscribing to this IPO.​

The company sells medical devices under its own brand names. It also provides manufacturers with data analytics to help them analyse data an understand demand trends in the market.

The number of hospitals using the company’s solutions increased to 2800 from 1600 in FY21
​The Average sales per month also increased to Rs 37,532 from Rs 32,801 in Fy21.

listed.styick_header_txt: Rashi Peripherals is going public with a Fresh issue. The issue opens on 7th February 2024.​​​​

desc: Rashi Peripherals is involved in the business of distribution of products such as computing devices, graphic cards, CPUs, and motherboards. They also provide cloud solutions to clients. The company’s topline and bottom line have shown little to no growth over the last two years, as the revenue increased marginally whereas the net profit declined by 32% as compared to FY23. Even the net profit margin is very low at 1.5%. The cash flow from operations of the company has consistently been negative in the last 3 fiscal years. This was due to an increase in receivables and higher inventory. This deprives the firm from expanding organically.

This is a very low margin business and it won’t attract the attention of many investors. The company has been on a decline over the last three years, if we look at its EBITDA Margin, it has been declining over the last three fiscals when it was 3.6% in FY21 which has now declined to 2.8% in FY23. The decline in the financials indicates that the company is struggling with efficiency, and we don’t expect it to improve significantly going forward.

Even the debt of the company is mounting over the last three years, the company had a debt of Rs 489 in FY21 crore and as of September 2023, the debt of the company stands at Rs 1400 crore which could further lower the net profit margin going forward.

As per FY23, the company is asking for a PE of 17x and a market cap to sales of 0.2x which seems quite fair. But looking at the declining trend in margins of the company, we believe this stock won’t provide any capital appreciation to investors. Hence, we recommend avoiding this IPO.​

listed.styick_header_txt: Jana Small Finance Bank is going public with a Fresh issue & Offer for Sale. The issue opens on 7th February 2024.​

1.header: High Asset quality despite risky business
desc: Jana Small Finance Bank is involved in the business lending to the underbanked and undeserved customers. The financials of the company have improved over the last two years despite some volatility in the net profit figures. The bank has seen a very healthy growth in deposits, as it had Rs 12000 crore in FY21 which has now grown to Rs 19000 crore in September 2023. That is a CAGR of 20% over the period.

Banks are evaluated based on the asset quality of the company, and Jana SFB’s asset quality is very high which is evident in the fall of its GNPA and NNPA over the years. The GNPA is at 2.44% while the NNPA is at 0.87%. This can be attributed to the shift towards secured advances which make up 58% of the advances, up from the 42% it contributed in 2021. At a time when Term Deposit share is increasing which will reduce the NIM, the banks profitability depends a lot on the asset quality.
The company also has one of the best Net Interest Margins in the Industry at 7.8% and the company also has a respectable Return on Assets of 1.6%, one of the best amongst its competitors.

As per FY23, the company is asking for a PB of 1.3x and a market cap to sales of 1.2x which seems quite attractive and we believe that the company can provide capital appreciation to investors. Hence, we recommend subscribing to this IPO​.​

listed.styick_header_txt: Capital Small Finance Bank is going public with a Fresh issue & Offer for Sale. The issue opens on 7th February 2024.​​

desc: Capital Small Finance Bank is mainly involved in the business of providing agricultural loans, loans to MSMEs and Mortgages. The financials of the company have improved owing to growth in both topline and bottom line. The bank has seen a modest growth in deposits, as it had Rs 5221 crore in FY21 which has now grown to Rs 7000 crore in September 2023. That is a CAGR of only 13% over the period.

The company has a Net interest margin of 4% which is the lowest amongst its competitors mainly because its loan book comprises of 99% secured loans. But despite this the company doesn’t boast the best GNPA or NNPA as the GNPA stands at 2.73% and NNPA stands at 1.4%. The ROA of the company stands at 1.3% which is again one of the lowest in comparison to its listed peers.

As per FY23, the company is asking for a PB of 2.6x and a market cap to sales of 3.0x which seems expensive in comparison to its peers and we believe that the company won’t provide capital appreciation to investors. Hence, we recommend avoiding this IPO​

details: Objectives of the Issue –​ Fresh Issue & Offer for Sale - Rs. 523 cr​

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. Increase Tier-1 Capital ​ ​​
2. Get benefits of listing​
​​

about: ​Capital Small Finance Bank is involved in the business of providing loans for Agricultural purposes, loans to MSME’s, and providing mortgages. They have a presence in Punjab, Haryana, Delhi, Rajasthan, Himachal Pradesh, and Chattisgarh.
The bank mainly focuses on middle-income customers who have an annual income of Rs 4 lakhs to Rs 50 Lakhs.​The company focuses on secured loans at this makes up 99% of its total loan book
​The company’s revenue has grown at 14% over the last two years while net profit has grown at 52%.
In FY23, The company’s Return on Equity was 16%
The GNPA and NNPA of the company is at 2.73% and 1.4% as of September, 2023
Deposits of the company grew to Rs 7,000 crore in September 2023, from Rs 5221 crore in FY21
​The NIM of the company stands at 4% which is the lowest amongst its peers

listed.styick_header_txt: Apeejay Surrendra Park Hotels is going public with a fresh issue and offer for sale. The issue opens on 5th February 2024.​​​

desc: Apeejay Surrendra Park Hotels operates multiple 5-star hotels across India, boasting a strong presence in the hospitality sector. Over the past three fiscal years, the company has demonstrated remarkable growth in both its top-line and bottom-line figures, with revenue expanding at a CAGR of 66%. Notably, the company achieved profitability in FY23 after experiencing losses in previous fiscal years, reflecting its strategic management and operational efficiency. The company enjoys positive cash flow from operations, amounting to Rs 175 crore in the last fiscal year and Rs 88 crore in H1FY24, indicating robust cash flow generation and effective financial management.

A key indicator of a hotel's efficiency is its occupancy rate, and Park Hotels boast an industry-leading rate of 91%. This exceptional occupancy rate is attributed to the high quality of service provided to customers. Despite maintaining a competitive average revenue per room of Rs 6000, which is lower than its counterparts owning Five Star Hotels, the company sustains its high occupancy rates, highlighting its ability to balance pricing and customer satisfaction effectively.

However, a significant concern for the company is its debt, amounting to Rs 597 crore. To address this issue, the company plans to utilize the proceeds to reduce its debt burden. With its strong occupancy rates and strategic debt reduction plans, Park Hotels aims to improve its margins and strengthen its financial position in the future.

As per FY23, the company is asking for a PE of 68x and a market cap-to-sales of 6x. These valuations might seem expensive but considering that the competitors command higher valuations, we believe that this could provide investors with capital appreciation. Hence, we recommend subscribing to this IPO.​

details: Objectives of the Issue –​ Fresh Issue & Offer for Sale– Rs. 920 cr​

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. Repayment of Borrowings​
2. General Corporate Purposes​​
​​

about: Park Hotels ranks as the eighth largest in India in terms of chain affiliated hotel rooms inventory as of September 30, 2023. The company’s rooms make up 2.8% of all the rooms run by Indian Hotels. It operates hospitality assets under its own brands, “THE PARK”, “THE PARK Collection”, “Zone by The Park”, “Zone Connect by The Park” and “Stop by Zone”.
The hotel portfolio is categorized into two distinct categories based on brand classification: upscale and upper mid-scale. They run 27 hotels as of September 2023.
The company’s revenue has grown at 66% over the last two years
In FY23, The company’s Return on Net Worth was 9%
The Net profit margin of the company is 9% in FY23 after reporting losses for two consecutive fiscal years
The company has consistently generated positive cash flow from operations in the last three fiscal years and even in H1FY24, the company reported a CFO of Rs 88 crore
The company has a debt of Rs 597 crore

issue_details.Lead Manager: Kotak Mahindra Capital, Morgan Stanley, BofA Securities, JM Financial and Avendus Capital

subscribe.styick_header_txt: Brainbees Solutions (FirstCry) Limited is going public with a fresh issue and an offer for sale. The issue opens on 06th August 2024.​​
subscribe.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/26MLGzk1N9A" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

1.header: India’s largest multi-channel retailer for Mothers’, Babies’ and Kids’ products​
desc: Founded in 2010, the company has grown into the largest multi-channel retail platform for products aimed at mothers, babies, and kids. It initially launched as an online platform and soon expanded into physical stores under the brands "FirstCry" and "BabyHug." As of March 31, 2024, the company operated 435 company-owned company-operated (COCO) stores and 628 franchisee-owned franchisee-operated (FOFO) stores nationwide.

A key subsidiary of the company, Globalbees Brands, in which the company holds a 50.23% stake, specializes in funding and acquiring direct-to-consumer (D2C) businesses across various categories, including home utilities, fashion/lifestyle, appliances, and beauty/personal care. These investments in early-stage D2C companies have the potential to yield significant returns and unlock substantial value for shareholders.​

3.header: Reducing yet high dependence on Xpressbees for logistics
desc: The company heavily relies on Xpressbees for its logistics needs. In FY2024, 57.3% of the total logistics costs were attributed to Xpressbees, down from 82.8% in FY2022. Additionally, Supam Maheshwari, the Managing Director and CEO of Brainbees, serves as a director on the board of Xpressbees, which could present a potential conflict of interest.

Based on FY2024 financials, the company is loss-making asking for a market cap-to-sales ratio of 3.7x. Such a valuation is justified for a fast-growing company with potential for unlocking value through its funding and investment arm. We, therefore, suggest subscribing to the issue.

details: Objectives of the Issue Offer for sale – Rs 2,527.73 cr & Fresh Issue – Rs 1,666 cr

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. To fund the expenditure for: (i) setting up new modern stores under the ‘BabyHug’ brand; and (ii) setting up a warehouse, in India – Rs 108.10 crore
2. To fund the expenditure for lease payments for the existing identified modern stores owned and operated by the company, in India – Rs 93.10 crore​
3. To fund the investment in one of the company’s subsidiary, Digital Age for (i) setting up new modern stores under the FirstCry brand and other home brands of the company; and (ii) lease payments for the existing identified modern stores owned and controlled by Digital Age, in India – Rs 299.60 crore
4. Investment in one of the subsidiary, FirstCry Trading for overseas expansion by: (i) setting up new modern stores; and (ii) setting up warehouse(s), in KSA – Rs 155.60 crore
5. Investment in one of the subsidiary, Globalbees Brands towards acquisition of additional stake in our step-down Subsidiaries – Rs 169 crore​
6. To fund the Sales and marketing initiatives by the company – Rs 200 crore
7. Technology and data science cost including cloud and server hosting related costs – Rs 57.60 crore.
8. Funding inorganic growth through acquisitions and general corporate purposes – Rs 583 crore​
​

headervalue:
Schroders Capital Private​
Equity Asia Mauritius II ​

about: Brainbees Solutions operates India’s largest multi-channel retailing platform (in terms of GMV) for products catering to mothers, babies and kids through their proprietary “FirstCry” platform.

The company launched its “FirstCry” platform in India in 2010 with the goal to create a one-stop shop for all parenting needs. The company has since established presence in UAE and Saudi Arabia in 2019 and 2022, respectively.

The company offers products from third-party Indian brands, global brands and home-grown brands. Through deep data analysis, company has managed to develop and grow one of its own brands “BabyHug”, into the largest multi-category Mothers’, Babies’, and Kids’ products brand in India in terms of GMV in FY2024.
The company also operates through retail stores in India under the COCO and FOFO model. As of FY2024, the company operated 435 COCO stores and 628 stores through the FOFO model.
The company’s revenue grew by 170% between FY2022 and FY2024 and stood at Rs 6,481 crore for FY2024.
In FY2024, the company’s Return on Net Worth stood at (8.65%), an improvement of 411bps from (12.76%) recorded in FY2023.
For FY2024, the operating margins for the company improved to 4.23%, from 1.33% recorded in FY2023 and 4.01% recorded in FY2022.
The company has failed to generate profits for the last 3 years. The company posted a loss of Rs 321 crore for FY2024, compared to a loss of Rs 486 crore in FY2023.
​The company has failed to generate positive cash flow from operations for the last three years. The company reported a CFO of negative Rs 42 crore in FY2024.
​The company has a debt of Rs 1,422 crore (including lease liabilities) as of 31st March 2024.

issue_details.Promoters: SANJEEV JAIN, SANDEEP JAIN AND AKUMS MASTER​ TRUST
issue_details.Lead Manager: ICICI Securities, Axis Capital, Citi Group and Ambit

subscribe.styick_header_txt: Akums Drugs and Pharmaceuticals Limited is going public with a fresh issue and an offer for sale. The issue opens on 19th July 2024.​​​​​​
subscribe.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/fuEmN_NNNUo" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: The company has a strong customer base for its CDMO business with 38 of its largest 50 clients placing repeat orders for the past 5 years. 26 of its largest 50 clients have been associated with the company for past 10 years demonstrating strong commitment towards the company.

2.header: Potential one-time gain from reversal of put-option provision
desc: As of March 31, 2024, the company has set aside a provision of ₹1,365.38 crore for a put option liability owed to one of its key institutional shareholders, Ruby Investments. According to the agreement, the company must provide Ruby Investments an exit via an IPO or a secondary sale of shares by April 2025. If the company fails to do so, it will be required to purchase those shares. Should the IPO successfully facilitate the investor's exit, the provision will be reversed, resulting in a significant one-time gain for the company.​

For FY2024, the company sourced 29.5% of its raw materials from its 10 largest suppliers, which has increased from 22% in FY2022. The company’s increasing over-reliance on limited suppliers and a lack of long-term contracts might lead to inflated costs in the future.

Based on FY2024 financials, the company is seeking a PE ratio of 28x (excluding put-option provision) and a market cap-to-sales ratio of 2.4x. This ask is significantly low compared to the industry average of 49x. Given the potential boost to the company’s net worth, we recommend subscribing to the issue.

details: Objectives of the Issue Offer for sale – Rs 1,176.73 cr​ & Fresh Issue – Rs 680 cr

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. Repayment/prepayment of all or certain borrowings of the company – Rs 159.9 crore​
2. Repayment/prepayment of all or certain borrowings of their subsidiaries namely, Maxcure Nutravedics Limited and Pure and Cure Healthcare Private Limited – Rs 227.1 crore
3. Funding incremental working capital requirements of the company – Rs 55 crore​​
4. Pursuing inorganic growth initiatives through acquisitions and general corporate purposes – Rs 238 crore​
​

about: Akums Drugs and Pharmaceutical is the largest India-focused Contract Drug Manufacturing Organization (CDMO) serving pharmaceutical giants such as Sun Pharma, Cipla, Mankind, Alkem Labs, Alembic Pharma, etc. among many others. Akums held a market share of 30.2% in the Indian  domestic CDMO market, increasing from 26.7% in FY2021.
Besides the CDMO business, the company is also engaged in the manufacturing and sale of branded and generic formulations and production of APIs.
The company operates through 12 manufacturing facilities (9 units in Uttarakhand, two units in Punjab and one unit in Himachal Pradesh) with a capacity of 49.23 billion units annually.
The company also operates four R&D centres, out of which 3 cater to the CDMO business and one caters to the API business.
The company’s revenue grew by 14% between FY2022 and FY2024 and stood at Rs 4,178 crore for FY2024.
In FY2024, the company’s Return on Net Worth stood at 16.94%, an improvement of 617bps from 10.77% recorded in FY2023.
For FY2024, the operating margins for the company improved to 12.22%, from 9.19% recorded in FY2023 and 11.51% recorded in FY2022.

The company's financials have been impacted by the provisions it has been making for a put-option liability arising from the investment by Ruby Investments. Post-IPO, the company should be realizing a one-time gain of Rs 1,365 crore arising from the reversal of this provision.

The company has generated positive cash flow from operations for the last three years. The company reported a CFO of Rs 498 crore in FY2024, which was 97% of EBITDA, suggesting strong cash conversion.
The company has a debt of Rs 565 crore as of 31st March 2024.

issue_details.Lead Manager: Axis Capital, ICICI Securities, JM Financial and SBI Capital

subscribe.styick_header_txt: Stanley Lifestyles Limited is going public with a fresh issue and offer for sale. The issue opens on 21st June 2024.​​
subscribe.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/KS6OmCAcaYI" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: Over the years, the company has developed a vertically integrated model, giving them extensive control over the entire manufacturing process—from sourcing raw materials to designing and producing the products—and retailing them through both COCO (company owned and company operated) and FOFO (franchise owned and franchise operated) stores.

As of December 2023, the company operated 38 COCO stores located in major metro-cities of Bengaluru, Chennai, New Delhi, Mumbai and Hyderabad; and operated 24 FOFO stores in 21 cities across the country. The company added 9 stores in the nine months ended December 2023, following an addition of 6, 16 and 14 stores in FY2021, FY2022 and FY2023, respectively. Average revenue per store in FY2023 stood at Rs 5.75 crore.​

The company upholds high standards by utilizing premium quality materials. They source leather from certified tanneries in Europe and timber from certified vendors in Southeast Asia. For the nine months ending December 2023, imports accounted for 68% of the total Cost of Goods Sold (COGS). The company has taken initiative to reduce its dependence on imports and source key raw materials domestically.

Based on FY2023 financials, the company is asking for a PE of 60x and a market cap-to-sales of 5x. The company does not have any listed peers in this space. Anticipating a shift in the furniture market towards the organized sector, the industry is poised for a rapid growth. We, therefore, suggest subscribing to the issue.

details: Objectives of the Issue Fresh Issue – Rs 200 cr & Offer for Sale – Rs. 337.02 cr

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. Opening new stores under the formats of “Stanley Level Next”, “Stanley Boutique” and “Sofas & More by Stanley”.​​
2. Opening anchor stores.​
3. Renovation of existing stores under the formats of “Stanley Level Next”, “Stanley Boutique” and “Sofas & More by Stanley”.​
4. Funding the capital expenditure requirements for purchase of new machinery and equipment.​
5. General corporate purposes.
​

headervalue: Oman India Joint Investment Fund II​

about: Stanley Lifestyles Limited is a luxury furniture brand operating in India with a spectrum of collection ranging across sofas, coffee tables, TV cabinets, Kitchen cabinets, dining table, beds, mattresses and wardrobes. The company operates under the brand “Stanley”.

​The company operates in a total of 3 segments - 1) Super premium – the price point is between Rs 15 lacs to Rs 30 lacs, and the company operates under the brand “Sofas & more by Stanley”; 2) Luxury – the price point is between Rs 30 lacs to Rs 50 lacs, and the company operates under the brand “Stanley Boutique”; and 3) Ultra Luxury – the price points is above Rs 50 lacs, and the company operates under the brand “Stanley Level Next”.

The company operates through a network of COCO (company owned and company operated) and FOFO (franchise owned and franchise operated) stores. The company has an integrated model which gives them greater control over the process from procuring raw materials to manufacturing and retailing their own goods.
The company’s revenue grew by 114% between FY2021 and FY2023 and stood at Rs 419 crore. Revenues for the first nine months of FY2024 stood at 313.3 crore.
In FY2023, the company’s Return on Net Worth stood at 16.3%, up from 11.8% recorded in FY2022.
For 9MFY2024, the operating margins for the company declined from 19.74% in FY2023 to 18.44%. But this is significantly higher than the operating margins of 15.2% recorded in FY2021.
​The Net profit margin of the company stood at 5.97% for 9MFY2024, down from 8.35% recorded in FY2023.

The company has consistently generated positive cash flow from operations in the last three fiscal years. The company reported a CFO of Rs 67.9 crore in FY2023, which is 82% of EBITDA and 194% of net profits.
The company has a debt of Rs 213 crore (incl. lease liabilities) as of 31st December 2023.

issue_details.Lead Manager: Axis Capital, DAM Capital and JM Financial

subscribe.styick_header_txt: Le Travenues Technlogy Limited (ixigo) is going public with a fresh issue and offer for sale. The issue opens on 10th June 2024.​​​
subscribe.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/0pwboF-Q6Ao" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: The company has been increasing its take rate across all three modes of transport: flights, trains, and buses. The take rate for flights rose from 7.50% in FY2021 to 8.25% in the first nine months of FY2024. For trains, the take rate increased from 5.47% in FY2021 to 6.57% in the same period. Meanwhile, the take rate for buses improved significantly from 6.95% in FY2021 to 10.99% in the first nine months of FY2024.

2.header: Refund programs helping garner market share
desc: The company offers an assured refund program that allows customers to cancel airline, train, and bus tickets for a full refund at a nominal cost. These refund programs have helped the company garner market share in all 3 segments. For the first half of FY2024, the company has improved its market share to 52.4% in the OTA rail market (from 46.15% in FY2023), 12.5% in online bus ticket booking market (from 11.5% in FY2023) and 5.2% in the airline OTA market (from 3.3% in FY2023).​

For 9MFY2024, the company allocated 24% of its revenues to advertising its three brands, an increase from 19% of the revenues in FY2023. The company has intensified its advertising and marketing efforts post-COVID to attract and retain customers. Consequently, the customer acquisition cost rose from Rs 44.3 per customer in FY2021 to Rs 198.5 per customer in the first nine months of FY2024.

Based on TTM financials, the company is asking for a PE of 51x and a market cap-to-sales of 5.7x. It’s closest listed peer in India, Easy Trip Planners is trading at a PE of 48.7x and market cap-to-sales of 12.5x. Upon attaining a good scale, the company has the potential to operate at better margins. Therefore, being available at a valuation reasonable to its peer, we recommend subscribing to the issue.

details: Objectives of the Issue
Fresh Issue – Rs 120 cr​ & Offer for Sale – Rs. 620.10 cr​

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. Funding Working Capital requirements of the company – Rs 45 crore​
2. Investments towards technology and data science – Rs 25.8 crore​
3. Funding future inorganic acquisitions and General corporate purposes – Rs 49.2 crore
​​

about: Le Travenues (ixigo) operates an OTA platform for Indian travellers to plan, book and manage their trips across rail, air, buses and hotels. This OTA platform allows travellers to book and manage their entire trips, as well get additional services such as predictions on confirmed train tickets, status updates on the selected mode of transportation, alternate route suggestions, etc. among others.
The company stood as the second largest OTA in India in terms of revenues. The company operates four brands namely ixigo flights, ixigo trains, AbhiBus and ConfirmTkt.

For the half year of FY2024, the company had a market share of 52.4% (highest) in the OTA rail bookings, 12.5% (second-highest) market share in the online bus ticket bookings and a market share of 5.2% in online airline bookings.​
​The company increased its registered users from 64.66 million in FY2021 to 213.21 million in December 2023, at a CAGR of 54%.
The company’s revenue for FY2023 stood at Rs 501.3 crore, growing at a CAGR of 92% from FY2021 to FY2023. Revenues for 9MFY2024 stood Rs 491 crore, a growth of 35% over 9MFY2023.
In FY2023, the company’s Return on Net Worth stood at 5.74%, up from (negative) 7.15% recorded in FY2022.
​The company’s operating margins for 9MFY2024 stood at 6.99%, dropping 200bps over FY2023.
The Net profit margin of the company stood at 13.38% for 9MFY2024, an expansion of 872bps from FY2023.

The company generated a positive cash flow from operation in FY2023 and 9MFY2024, after reporting negative CFO for FY2021 and FY2022. The company recorded CFO of Rs 36.4 crore, 155% of the net profits.
The company has a debt of Rs 50.2 crore as of 31st December 2023.

issue_details.Promoters: Ankush Nijhawan, Gaurav Bhatnagar, Manish Dhingra, Arjun Nijhawan and LAP Travel

subscribe.styick_header_txt: TBO Tek Limited is going public with a fresh issue and offer for sale. The issue opens on 08th May 2024.​​​​
subscribe.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/VjWviTapbeI" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

1.header: Robust business model for Hotels and ancillary
desc: The company follows a B2B model for Hotels and ancillary where they put a mark-up above the price quoted from the suppliers and make it available to the buyer. This model gives them greater control over the pricing which can be witnessed from the take rate consistently increasing from 6.84% in FY2021 to 8.10% in 9MFY2024. This growth in take rate can also be attributed to its growth in GTV from the international markets of Europe, Middle East and North America.

The top supplier contributed to 27.4% of the total GTV, down from 30% in FY2021; top 5 and top 10 suppliers contributed to 60% and 71% of the total GTV, down from 70% and 80% respectively in FY2021, for the nine months ended December 2023. Average take rate for 9MFY2024 stood at 5.38%, up 62bps from FY2023.​

TBO Tek's take rate in FY2023 was recorded at 4.77%, notably lower than its global counterparts like Webjet and TravelCTM, which operate at higher rates of 8.39% and 7.37% respectively. With increased investments directed towards expanding its international operations, we foresee a continued rise in its take rates, ultimately bolstering the company's operating margins.

Networking effect helps in bringing more and more suppliers and buyers to the platform. With the technology already in place, cost of serving an additional customer is negligible. Consequently, as the customer base expands over time, this will ultimately result in higher margins.

Based on TTM financials, the company is asking for a PE of 55x and a market cap-to-sales of 7.6x. It’s closest listed peer in India, RateGain Travel Technologies is currently trading at a PE of 61x and market cap-to-sales of 8.8x. With high operating leverage, we believe TBO Tek could operate at higher margins in the future fetching a premium to its competitors. Hence, we suggest subscribing to the IPO issue.

details: Objectives of the Issue
Fresh Issue & Offer for Sale– Rs. 1,550.81 cr​

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. Investment in Technology and Data solutions – Rs 135 crore
2. Investment in a Material Subsidiary, Tek Travels DMCC, for onboarding platform users through marketing and promotional activities; hiring sales and contracting personnel for augmenting Supplier and Buyer base outside India – Rs 100 crore
3. Investment in sales, marketing and infrastructure to support organization’s growth plans in India - Rs 25 crore
4. Unidentified inorganic acquisitions – Rs 40 crore.
5. General corporate purposes and inorganic growth – Rs 100 crore​​

about: ​TBO Tek Limited is an online travel distribution platform, where it brings together suppliers (such as Hotels, airlines, cruises, railways, insurers, etc.) and buyers (such as travel agencies and advisors, tour advisors, online travel apps, super apps, etc.) to match the needs of each. The platform seamlessly lets the suppliers display their inventory and set prices for buyers to conveniently pick and choose.

The company operates on two business models – 1) a B2B Rate Model, where it applies a certain mark-up on the price set by the suppliers and pass it on to the buyers; 2) Commission Model, where suppliers fix the cost, they want the end traveler to buy, and pay a certain commission to the company on each transaction.

For 9MFY2024, Take rate (% of revenue earned from the gross transaction value) for the B2B model stood at 8.10% and 2.63% for the Commission model. Revenues from the B2B model contributed 72% of the total revenues whereas the Commission model contributed to 25% of the total revenues.
The company’s revenue grew by 120% in FY2023, due to lower base effect from the COVID-affected FY2022. This was followed by a growth of 31% in 9MFY2024.
In FY2023, the company’s Return on Net Worth stood at 44%, up from 14.5% recorded in FY2022.
The company improved its operating margins from (negative) 16% and 7.74% in FY2021 and FY2022, respectively, to 19.59% in 9MFY2024.
The Net profit margin of the company stood at 15.06% for 9MFY2024, an expansion of 112bps from FY2023.

The company has consistently generated positive cash flow from operations in the last three fiscal years. The company reported a CFO of Rs 237.4 crore in FY2023, which is 119% of EBITDA and 160% of net profits.
​The company has a debt of Rs 80.4 crore as of 31st December 2023.

issue_details.Lead Manager: Kotak Mahindra Capital, ICICI Securities, Citigroup, SBI Caps and Nomura

subscribe.styick_header_txt: Aadhar Housing Finance Limited is going public with a fresh issue and offer for sale. The issue opens on 08th May 2024.​​
subscribe.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/fAGthrZqn8k" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: The company has reported Return on Assets (RoA) of 4.2% as of December 2023, which notably surpasses its two nearest competitors. Aavas Financiers reported an RoA of 3.28% as of March 2024, while Home First Finance recorded an RoA of 3.7% as of December 2023. The lender also enjoys a better spread on the loans given out. On TTM basis, the lender recorded spreads of 6.4% compared to Aavas Financiers’ 5.06% and Home First Finance’s 5.3%.

As of December 2023, 83% of the outstanding loan AUM were floating interest loans and the remaining 17% were fixed interest loans. The lender has opted for 100% long-term financing to avoid any asset-liability mismatch with an average tenure of 9.7 years (as of 31st December 2023).​

The proportion of loans extended to self-employed customers, as a share of the lender's outstanding loans, has been steadily increasing, rising from 36.2% in March 2021 to 42.8% in December 2023. This trend leads to better yields but exposes the lender to the risk of delayed payments and potential defaults. This can be witnessed from a 30bps increase in Gross NPAs to 1.4% compared to March 2021.

The lender is asking for a valuation of 3.2x its book value of December 2023. This is lower compared to the closest peer Aavas Financiers, which trades at a P/B ratio of 3.3x its book value of March 2024. Given that Aadhar Housing Finance operates at a higher spread, we suggest subscribing to the issue.

details: Objectives of the Issue Fresh Issue - Rs. 1,000 cr & ​Offer for Sale– Rs. 2,000 cr

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1.To meet future capital requirement of the lender for loan disbursement – Rs 750 crore
2. General corporate purposes and inorganic growth – Rs 250 crore

about: Aadhar Housing Finance Limited is a housing finance company with a focus on the low-income housing segment (ticket size < Rs 15 lac). As of 31st December 2023, the company managed assets of Rs 19,865 crore, making it the largest player in the lower-income category of housing loan providers.

The company was earlier promoted by the Wadhawan family, promoters of DHFL. The Wadhawan family sold its entire stake in the company to Blackstone backed BCP Topco VII in June 2019 for a total consideration of Rs 2,200 crore.

As of December 31, 2023, the lender operated in 20 states and UTs through a network of 487 branches including 109 sales offices. The average ticket size of the loans disbursed in the nine months ended December 2023 was Rs 10 lacs with an average loan-to-value ratio of 58.3%.

As of 31st December 2023, the top 5 states accounted for 61% of the total AUM. The company’s capital adequacy ratio (CAR) stood strong at 39.7%. Gross NPA’s for the same period stood at 1.4% whereas Net NPA’s stood at 1.0%.
The lender has grown its loan AUM from Rs 13,327 crore in FY2021 to Rs 19,865 crore in 9MFY2024, at a CAGR of 16%.
​For 9MFY2024, Net Interest Income stood at Rs 1,170 crore, growing from Rs 760 crore in FY2021 at a CAGR of 17%, in line with the AUM growth.
Interest spread for the lender improved from 5.0% in FY2021 to 6.4% for the trailing twelve months. Following which, NIMs for the trailing twelve months has improved to 9.0% from 5.8% in FY2021.
The lender has grown is profits from Rs 340 crore in FY20221 to Rs 545 crore in FY2023 at a CAGR of 27%.

subscribe.styick_header_txt: GPT Healthcare is going public with a fresh issue and offer for sale. The issue opens on 22nd February 2024.​​​​​​

A notable aspect of GPT Healthcare's financial management is its prudent debt reduction strategy. The company has significantly reduced its debt from Rs 123 crore to Rs 55 crore over the years. This debt reduction not only strengthens the company's financial position but also provides room for further improvement in net profit margins.

The company is asking for a PE of 39x and a market cap to sales of 4x which is lower as compared to its listed peers who command higher valuations.
