about: Emcure Pharmaceuticals is an Indian pharmaceutical company based out of Pune, engaged in developing and manufacturing of pharmaceuticals including oral (solids and liquids), injectibles and biotherapeutics. The company majorly caters to gynecology and antiviral (HIV) therapeutic areas in India and is the largest pharma company to do so.

The company has an international presence in over 70+ countries and exports majorly to the European nations and North America. The company is present in the therapeutic areas of Gynecology, Antiviral, Cardiovascular, Respiratory, Gastrointestinal, etc. among others.
The company operates 13 manufacturing facilities across the states of Maharashtra, Gujarat, Sikkim and Karnataka and the union territory of Jammu and Kashmir, in India.
The company’s revenue grew by 14% between FY2022 and FY2024 and stood at Rs 6,658 crore.
In FY2024, the company’s Return on Net Worth stood at 16.87%, a decline from 21.27% and 33.32% recorded in FY2023 and FY2022, respectively.
For FY2024, the operating margins for the company stood at 19.01%, coming down from 20.24% and 23.54% recorded in FY2023 and FY2022, respectively.
The Net profit margin of the company stood at 7.86% for FY2024, coming down from 9.31% and 11.81% recorded in FY2023 and FY2022, respectively.
The company has consistently generated positive cash flow from operations in the last three fiscal years. The company reported a CFO of Rs 1,097 crore in FY2024, which is 86% of EBITDA.
​The company has a debt of Rs 2,335 crore (incl. lease liabilities) as of 31st March 2024.

avoid.styick_header_txt: Bansal Wire Industries Limited is going public with a fresh issue. The issue opens on 3rd July 2024.​​​​​
avoid.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/p1PfuH9GJ3c" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: The company operates with a business model where it procures raw materials from suppliers by entering into contracts, but the price is finalized as per market conditions. On the other hand, the company carries out its production upon receiving an order at a pre-agreed prices and any fluctuation in the raw material prices may lead to inconsistent losses or profits.

2.header: Heavy Capex to put a strain on future profitability
desc: The company plans to establish the country's largest single-location steel wire manufacturing facility in Dadri, UP, with a projected cost of Rs 449 crore. Out of this amount, the company has already invested Rs 358 crore in FY2024. This significant capital expenditure will strain profitability in the medium term due to increased depreciation costs.​

The company exports its products to several countries including Brazil, France, Germany, Italy, etc. among others and has a well diversified customer base of 5000+ customers. Except for a group company and one dealer company, no other customer contributes for more than 5% of the company’s total revenue.

Based on the FY2024 financials, the company is asking for a PE of 51x and a market cap-to-sales of 1.62x. Compared to its peers, which are operating at higher margins, are trading at an average PE of about 40x. We, therefore, suggest not subscribing to the issue.

details: Objectives of the Issue Fresh Issue – Rs 745 cr

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. Repayment or prepayment of all or a portion of certain outstanding borrowings availed by the company – Rs 453 crore​​
2. Investment in subsidiaries for the purpose of repayment or prepayment of all or a portion of certain of its outstanding borrowings – Rs 94 crore​
3. Funding the Working Capital requirements of the company – Rs 60 crore​
4. General corporate purposes - Rs 138 crore
​

about: Bansal Wire Industries is engaged in the manufacturing of steel wires broadly categorized into high carbon steel wires, mild (low) carbon steel wires and stainless-steel wires. The company along with its material subsidiary, Bansal Steel & Power, provides over 3000+ SKUs.

High carbon steel wires are made with 0.3% to 1% of carbon and are known for its exceptional strength and durability, whereas the low carbon steel wires are made with 0.05% to 0.25% of carbon and are known for its ductibility and malleability. These products find use in springs, cutting tools, power & transmission, agriculture, construction consumer durables, hardware, automotive, etc. among others.

The company operates out of its 4 manufacturing facilities located in the National Capital Region (Delhi NCR) with 3 facilities located in Ghaziabad (UP) and 1 facility located in Bahadurgarh (Haryana). The company has an installed capacity of 259,000 MTPA.

The company caters to 22 states and UTs in the country with a major presence in the regions of Delhi, Haryana, Maharashtra and UP with revenues of 64.8% being derived from these states for the year ended March 2024.
The company’s revenue grew by 12% between FY2022 and FY2024 and stood at Rs 2,466 crore.
In FY2024, the company’s Return on Net Worth stood at 21.19%, a decline from 23.71% and 29.92% recorded in FY2023 and FY2022, respectively.
For FY2024, the operating margins for the company stood at 6.04%, up from 4.73% and 5.13% recorded in FY2023 and FY2022, respectively.
The Net profit margin of the company stood at 3.19% for FY2024, coming down from 2.47% and 2.60% recorded in FY2023 and FY2022, respectively.
The company has not been able to consistently generated positive cash flow from operations in the last three fiscal years. The company reported a negative CFO of Rs 537 crore in FY2024.
The company has a debt of Rs 681 crore (incl. lease liabilities) as of 31st March 2024.

avoid.styick_header_txt: Vraj Iron and Steel Limited is going public with a fresh issue. The issue opens on 26th June 2024.​​​
avoid.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/WwsXowhvy28" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: The company is witnessing a growing contribution from its top-5 and top-10 customers to its revenues. For the nine months ending December 2023, the top-5 customers accounted for 41.5% of revenues (up from 38.1% in FY2021), while the top-10 customers accounted for 63.8% of revenues (up from 58.3% in FY2021). The largest customer alone contributed 13.84% of revenues in FY2023.

The company sells its products to industrial clients through traders and agents without engaging in long-term contracts. Goods are supplied on an order basis, which may result in challenges in accurately predicting future revenues and financial requirements.​

3.header: High Volatility in the Steel industry
desc: The steel industry is inherently a volatile one with factors such as changes in domestic and international demand and supply, changes in international production and capacity, geopolitical situations, freight and transportation costs, etc. among others, greatly impacting business. The prices of TMT Bars, Sponge Iron and MS Billets have gone down for the nine months ended December 2023.

4.header: Better operational efficiency compared to peers
desc: The company operated at an EBITDA margin of 15.4% for FY2023, compared to 11.8% reported by its closest listed peer Shyam Metallics. The company also recorded ROE of 38.3% for FY2023 compared to 13.06% recorded by Shyam Metallics.

Based on annualized financials, the company is seeking a PE ratio of 11.5x and a market cap-to-sales ratio of 1.7x. This ask is reasonable when compared to its closest peer, Shyam Metallics, which currently trades at a PE ratio of 17.8x and a market cap-to-sales ratio of 1.38x. However, due to the significantly smaller scale of operations, we recommend avoiding the issue.

details: Objectives of the Issue Fresh Issue – Rs 171 cr

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. Repayment/prepayment of borrowings from HDFC Bank – Rs 70 crore​​
2. Funding capital expenditure for the expansion project at the Bilaspur plant – Rs 59.5 crore​
3. General corporate purposes – Rs 41.5 crore
​

about: Vraj Iron and Steel is a company engaged in the manufacturing of Sponge Iron, Mild Steel Billets (MS Billets) and TMT Bars under the brand “Vraj”.

The company operates through two manufacturing plants located in Raipur and Bilaspur in the state of Chhatisgarh spread across 53 acres. As of 31st December 2023, the total capacity of the manufacturing facilities stood at 231.6 kilo tonnes per annum (KTPA). The company has installed a 5MW power plant for captive use at its facility in Raipur.

The company is going through an expansion phase in which they are adding capacities for Sponge Iron (115 KTPA) and MS Billets (153 KTPA) at its facility in Bilaspur which are expected to become operational in Q4FY2025 and Q1FY2026, respectively. The company is also planning a 15 MW power plant for captive use in the Bilaspur facility.
The company’s revenue grew by 77% between FY2021 and FY2023 and stood at Rs 515.7 crore. Revenues for the first nine months of FY2024 stood at 301.3 crore.​
In FY2023, the company’s Return on Net Worth stood at 38.32%, an improvement from 32.94% and 19.01% recorded in FY2022 and FY2021, respectively.
For 9MFY2024, the operating margins for the company improved from 15.8% in FY2023 to 21.6%. But this is significantly higher compared to 12% and 10% recorded in FY2022 and FY2021, respectively.
​The Net profit margin of the company stood at 14.8% for 9MFY2024, up from 10.5% recorded in FY2023.
​The company has consistently generated positive cash flow from operations in the last three fiscal years. The company reported a CFO of Rs 62.9 crore in FY2023, which is 77% of EBITDA.
The company has a debt of Rs 51 crore (incl. lease liabilities) as of 31st December 2023.

issue_details.Promoters: KISHORE RAJARAM CHHABRIA, BINA KISHORE CHHABRIA, RESHAM CHHABRIA JEETENDRA HEMDEV, BINA​CHHABRIA ENTERPRISES PRIVATE LIMITED

avoid.styick_header_txt: Allied Blenders and Distillers Limited is going public with a fresh issue and offer for sale. The issue opens on 25th June 2024.​​​​
avoid.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/OHdCCIBO7dc" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: The company has more of its brands in the popular (mass) segment and less in the premium segment compared to its peers such as United Spirits and Radico Khaitan. For the first nine months of FY2024, the company registered gross margins of close to 36%, which is 700 bps lower compared to Radico Khaitan and 1100 bps lower compared to United Spirits recorded in FY2024.

2.header: Over-dependence on the Officer’s Choice brand
desc: The company operates two whiskey brands named “Officer’s Choice” and “Sterling Reserve”. Whiskey contributes up to 96% of the total revenues and “Officer’s Choice” in particular, constitutes to 73% of the total revenues in 9MFY2024. This dependence has been reducing since FY2021 when it contributed 84% of the total revenues.​

3.header: 3rd Largest IMFL player in the country
desc: The company operates majorly in the mass premium segment and is the 3rd largest player in the Indian IMFL market (by volume) with a market share of 8%, just behind United Spirits and Pernod Ricard with market share of 23% and 17%, respectively.

Based on annualized financials, the company is asking for a PE of 1395x and a market cap-to-sales of 2.3x. The company has not been able to generate good profits for the past 4 years. Operating majorly in the mass premium segment, the company isn’t able to generate profits and ends up breaking even in terms of profits. Its competitors are premiumizing its offerings and hence are able to generate good profits for themselves. Hence, we suggest avoiding to this issue.

details: Objectives of the Issue Fresh Issue – Rs 1000 cr & Offer for Sale – Rs. 500 cr

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. Prepayment and scheduled re-payment of certain portion of outstanding borrowings availed by the company – Rs 720 crore​
2. General corporate purposes
​

about: Allied Blenders and Distillers is the country’s third largest Indian-made Foreign Liquor manufacturer behind United Spirits and Pernod Ricard. The company manufactures whiskey under brands such as “Officer’s Choice”, “Sterling Reserve” and “ICONiQ”.

The company is engaged in the manufacturing of five categories of IMFL namely whiskey, brandy, rum, vodka and gin. The company’s products have a presence in 30 states across 79,329 retail outlets with exports to 14 international markets such as in Middle East, North America, Africa, Asia and Europe.

The company operates a distillery located in Rangapur, Telangana spread over an area of 25,000 square meter with a distillation capacity of 60 million liters per year. The company operates through 32 bottling facilities, nine of which are owned by the company, others being contracted from third-party bottlers out of which five are on an exclusive basis and the rest 18 are on a non-exclusive basis.
The company’s revenue grew by 11.4% between FY2021 and FY2023 and stood at Rs 7,106 crore. Revenues for the first nine months of FY2024 stood at 5,911 crore.​
In FY2023, the company’s Return on Net Worth stood at 0.39%, whereas ROCE stood at 25.87%.​
​For 9MFY2024, the operating margins for the company improved from 6.23% in FY2023 to 7.27%. But this is lower compared to 9.07% and 7.73% recorded in FY2021 and FY2022, respectively.
The Net profit margin of the company stood at 0.17% for 9MFY2024, up from 0.05% recorded in FY2023 and FY2022.
​The company has consistently generated positive cash flow from operations in the last three fiscal years. The company reported a CFO of Rs 230 crore in FY2023, which is 117% of EBITDA.
The company has a debt of Rs 809 crore (incl. lease liabilities) as of 31st December 2023.

issue_details.Promoters: KRISHAN LALIT BANSAL, ASHIMA BANSAL AND DDE PIPING COMPONENTS PRIVATE LIMITED

avoid.styick_header_txt: DEE Development Engineers Limited is going public with a fresh issue and offer for sale. The issue opens on 19th June 2024.​​​
avoid.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/A3JqwTyEzgo" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: For the year ended FY2023, the company recorded ROE of 3.14% and a ROCE of 3.91%, which is significantly lower compared to its competitor having ROE and ROCE of 8.96% and 9.66%, respectively. The company has also been piling up debt over the years with Net Debt to Equity ratio climbing up consistently from 0.49x in FY2021 to 0.85x in 9MFY2024.

2.header: Low utilization in the Palwal I facility
desc: The Palwal I facility produces induction-bended pipes majorly catering to the power sector including nuclear power. Due to a lack of power projects, the facility has witnessed a low capacity utilization of around 5.5% for the past 4 years.​

For 9MFY2024, the company recorded EBITDA margins of 12.45% compared to 8.28% recorded by its peer IGSEC Heavy Engineering in the same period. Due to low utilization at the Palwal I facility, depreciation of the assets continue without much revenue generation. Despite higher margins, PAT margins stood at 2.63% for the company compared to 4.2% for its competitors.

4.header: Reducing yet high concentration from top customers
desc: The top customer contribution to their revenues came down from 19% in FY2021 to 12.46% in 9MFY2024. Consequently, for 9MFY2024, the top-10 customer concentration stood at 66% (down from 77% in FY2021) and top-20 customer concentration stood at 86% (down from 93% in FY2021).

Based on annualized financials, the company is asking for a PE of 73x and a market cap-to-sales of 2.6x. It’s closest listed peer in India, ISGEC Heavy Engineering is currently trading at a PE of 35x and market cap-to-sales of 1.45x. The company is operating at a much lower scale to its competitor and has lower return ratio metrics which does not justify the premium valuation. We, therefore, suggest avoiding this issue.

details: Objectives of the Issue Fresh Issue – Rs 325 cr & Offer for Sale– Rs. 93.01 cr

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. Funding the working capital requirement of the company – Rs 75 crore
2. Repayment of debt in full or partially – Rs 175 crore​
3. General corporate purposes - Rs 75 crore
​

about: DEE Development Engineers is an engineering company involved in the process of manufacturing process piping systems for industries such as oil & gas, power and chemicals. The product portfolio of the company includes high-pressure piping systems, piping spools, modular skid piping systems, Longitudinally Submerged Arc Welded (LSAW) pipes, etc. among others.

Apart from piping solutions, the company also provides engineering services which include 3D modelling and layout design, pipe size and pressure calculations, carrying out stress tests, estimating suitable piping tonnage, etc. The company also produces wind turbine towers and industrial chimneys.

The company has 7 manufacturing facilities. 3 of which are located in Palwal (Haryana), with one each in Anjar (Gujarat), Barmer (Rajasthan), Numaligarh (Assam) and Bangkok (Thailand). Additional to this, they have set up an engineering facility in Chennai.
As of December 2023, the total production capacity stood at 94,500 MT with capacity utilization reaching 51.5% in the nine months ended March 2024.

The company recorded revenues of Rs 595 crore in FY2023, witnessing a growth of 29% over FY2022, following a consistent increase in its executable order book. Revenues for 9MFY2024 stood at Rs 546 crore.
​In FY2023, the company’s ROCE stood at 3.91%, remained flat compared to 3.99% reported in FY2022.
The company improved its operating margins from 1.81% and 2.28% in FY2021 and FY2022, respectively, to 3.49% in 9MFY2024.
The Net profit margin of the company stood at 2.63% for 9MFY2024, an expansion of 45bps from FY2023.
The company has consistently generated positive cash flow from operations in the last three fiscal years. The company reported a CFO of Rs 69.7 crore in 9MFY2024, which is 103% of EBITDA.
The company has a debt of Rs 430 crore as of 31st December 2023.

avoid.styick_header_txt: Akme Fintrade Limited is going public with a fresh issue. The issue opens on 19th June 2024.​​​​
avoid.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/VIHKGii-KAw" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: The lender operates in the states of Rajasthan, Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh, and Gujarat with just 12 branches across these states. The financing space is already competitive with many regional players having strong foothold in the SME lending space. As a result, the company has not been able to grow its AUM over the years. The AUM as of 31st December 2023 stood at Rs 379 crore, a drop of 10% from its AUM in FY2021.

The lender has not been increasing its number of branches over the years. The lender has majority of its presence in Rajasthan with 50% of its branches in the state, 69% of the loans outstanding and 76% of the Interest Income originating from Rajasthan​

As of 31st December 2023, 79% of the loans outstanding were business loans which are extended to the self-employed category of people. With higher income uncertainty of this group, it makes the segment riskier for lending.
The lender operates in Vehicle financing and small business loans which are majorly securitized loans. The lender therefore has a strong capital adequacy ratio of 42.02% as of 31st December 2023.

The lender is asking for a valuation of 2.36x its book value of December 2023, which is lower compared to some of its listed peers. The scale of operations of the lender is far lower compared to some of its established peers and that does not give us confidence in the lender’s operations. We, therefore, suggest avoiding this issue.

details: Objectives of the Issue Fresh Issue – Rs 132 cr

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. Augmenting the capital base of the lender – Rs 132 crore​
​

about: Akme Fintrade, an RBI-registered NBFC operating under the brand name "Aasaan Loans," focuses on providing lending solutions tailored to rural and semi-urban areas. The lender primarily offers business and vehicle loans to small business owners.
The lender operates in four Indian states—Rajasthan, Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh, and Gujarat—with 12 branches and 25 points of contact, having served 200,000 customers to date.

The lender operates through a “hub & spoke” model wherein the major operations are carried out from their registered office in Udaipur, Rajasthan. The loans are sourced from its branches and points of contacts which are located in the 4 states and credit assessment and loan disbursal is done from the registered office.

The company recorded interest income of Rs 50.77 crore in 9MFY2024. The lender recorded an interest income of Rs 63.10 crore in FY2023, which came down from Rs 64.86 crore in FY2022 and Rs 84.16 crore in FY2021.
​For FY2023, the lender’s ROE stood at 7.72% whereas ROA stood at 4.05%.​
As of 31st December 2023, the lender’s Gross NPA stood at 3.94% whereas Net NPA stood at 1.94%. Provision Coverage Ratio (PCR) stood at 50.85%, improving from 24.66% in FY2023.
Average yield on the loan book stood at 17.89% for FY2023 whereas the cost on borrowings stood at 13.56%. NIM for the year ended March 2023 stood at 10.05%.
As of 31st December 2023, the Capital Adequacy Ratio stood at 42.02%.

avoid.styick_header_txt: Kronox Lab Sciences Limited is going public with an offer for sale. The issue opens on 3rd June 2024.​​
avoid.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/0wsJmXskZuM" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: The company has avoided entering into long-term contracts with any of its clients and depend upon purchase orders from time to time. This may lead to poor capacity planning, over capacity addition and lack of clear revenue projections in the future. The company is now considering to enter long-term contracts and has ongoing engagements with certain customers.

The industry involves a long process for customer acquisition and product approval and the gestation period is high. A typical product approval cycle involves 1-2 months of sample testing, 6-9 months of lab scale testing, 12-18 months of regulatory filings and approvals and 2-3 months of production and delivery. This leads to higher working capital requirements. ​

Top 10 customers contributed to 45.2% of the revenues in 9MFY2024. This is a significant reduction from 56.32% recorded in FY2021. Top 20 customer contribution has also come down from 71% in FY2022 to 58.5% in 9MFY2024. Out of the total 592 customers served in the last 4 years, the company witnessed 141 (23.8% of 592) repeat customers.

On an annualized basis, the company is seeking a valuation of 24.5x its profits. The company is significantly smaller in size to its listed peers such as Tatva Chintan Pharma, TANFAC Industries, Neogen Chemicals, Sigachi Industries and DMCC Specialty.
The peers are trading at an average P/E of 67. Kronox Labs has the highest operating and profit margins among the listed companies. But taking into consideration the size of the company and the inherent nature of the chemical business is making us issue an Avoid rating on the company.

details: Objectives of the Issue Offer for Sale– Rs. 130.15 cr
No objectives as the issue is purely an Offer For Sale.​

about: Kronox Lab Sciences is engaged in the manufacturing of high-purity specialty chemicals used extensively in the manufacturing of APIs as well as excipients (inactive ingredient) in the pharmaceutical industry, reagents for scientific research, ingredients used in nutraceutical, agrochemical formulations and personal care products, etc.
The company has a product portfolio of more than 185 products supplied to customers in India as well as exported to over 20 countries globally.​
Its share of revenues from exports have increased from 20.6% in FY2021 to 25.1% in 9MFY2024. They have grown at a CAGR of 37% between FY2021 and FY2023.
The company has served 592 customers in the past 4 years, out of which 141 customers amounting to 23.8%, have placed repeat orders with the company.

The company has 3 manufacturing units located at Vadodara in Gujarat, which are close to seaports of Mundra, Kandla and Hazira. As of 31st December 2023, the installed capacity stood at 7,242 TPA. They have also acquired a land parcel in Dahej for future capacity expansion.

The company’s revenue for FY2023 stood at Rs 96 crore, growing at a CAGR of 24% between FY2021 and FY2023. Revenues for the nine months ended December 2023 stood at Rs 68 crore, down 9% over 9MFY2023.

The company operated at an EBITDA margin of 30% in 9MFY2024, which is an improvement of 722bps over FY2023. ​This was due to lower costs of raw materials in the period leading to an improvement of 516bps in the gross margins.

Consequently, the Net profit margin of the company stood at 22.6% for 9MFY2024, an expansion of 556bps from FY2023. PAT margins have been improving consistently from 15.39% in FY2021 to 17.04% in FY2023.
​The company registered a Return on Net Worth of 37.19% for the year ended March 2023.
​The company has consistently generated positive cash flow from operations in the last three fiscal years. The company reported a CFO of Rs 19.6 crore in FY2023, which is 89% of EBITDA.
As of 31st December 2023, the company is debt-free.

issue_details.Promoters: Mascot Capital, JNK Global, Goutam Rampelli and Dipak Bharuka.

avoid.styick_header_txt: JNK India Limited is going public with a fresh issue and offer for sale. The issue opens on 23rd April 2024.​​
avoid.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/qRCB30aCT3A" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: JNK Global holds a strategic investment in the company. However, despite the heating equipment market boasting a value of around USD 42 billion (~ Rs 3.5 lac crore) worldwide, the company's reported sales for FY2023 amounted to just Rs 1006 crore, indicating a market share of less than 1%. The parent company, being comparatively minor on the global stage, doesn't appear to offer any significant economic benefits.

The company largely outsources its domestic projects to numerous SMEs across the country. This practice could potentially encourage many of these small-scale entities to independently pursue projects, thereby intensifying competition within the market. Given that the fabrication of heaters is a business with relatively narrow profit margins, the existing margins appear unlikely to sustain over the long term.​

3.header: High amount of inventory and receivables
desc: Due to substantial inventories and outstanding receivables, the company faces a significant demand for working capital. It has experienced negative operating cash flows for FY2023 and the first nine months of FY2024, with a notable increase in working capital from Rs. 34 crore in FY2021 to Rs. 182 crore in 9MFY2024.

Based on the FY2023 financials, the company is seeking a PE ratio of 50x and a market cap-to-sales ratio of 5.6x. These valuations seem expensive, given the ordinary nature of the business along with strained working capital situation. Hence, we recommend not subscribing to this issue.

details: Objectives of the Issue
Fresh Issue & Offer for Sale– Rs. 649.47 cr​

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. Funding Working Capital requirements – Rs 263 crore​​
2. General Corporate Purposes – Rs 37 crore
​​

about: JNK India is engaged in the business of manufacturing process fired heaters, reformers and cracking furnaces, which are majorly used in processing industries such as oil & gas refineries, petrochemical and fertilizer facilities.
The company has, over years diversified into flares and incinerator systems and have been developing capabilities in the renewable sector with green hydrogen.
The company’s business model involves collaboration with the customers from initial consultation, design & specifications and final installation of the product.

As of December 31, 2023, JNK India has catered to 21 customers in India and 8 overseas, which include 7 of the 12 oil refining companies in India. The company’s clientele include IOCL, Tata Projects, Rashtriya Chemicals & Fertilizers, etc. among others.
The company’s revenue has compounded at 72% from FY2021 to FY2023.
​In FY23, The company’s Return on Net Worth stood at 47.7%.
The Net profit margin of the company stood at 18.24% in 9MFY2024, up 686bps on FY2023. This is a result of no freight charges in 9MFY2024, which is event-based.
The Net profit margin of the company stood at 18.24% in 9MFY2024, up 686bps on FY2023. This is a result of no freight charges in 9MFY2024, which is event-based.
The company had generated positive operating cashflows for FY2021 and FY2022, but operating cashflows turned negative in FY2023 and 9MFY2024, due to higher levels of receivables and inventory piling.
The company had a debt of Rs 68 crore as of 31st December 2023.

avoid.styick_header_txt: Vodafone Idea is going public with a fresh issue. The issue opens on 18th April 2024.​​​

1.header: Low ARPU due to higher 2G base
desc: Of the 22.3 crore subscribers, 42% of the subscribers are on 2G networks. As per the management’s commentary, ARPU from 2G subscribers is 1/3rd of ARPU derived from 4G customers. The company recorded ARPU of Rs 145 for 9MFY2024 which is significantly lower compared to Rs 208 for Airtel and Rs 182 for Jio in the same period.

2.header: Lower Operating margins compared to the industry
desc: The telecom operator has recorded margins of 40% for the nine months ended December 2023. Historical margins have been around the 40% mark, which are way below the industry standards of 50%. With majority subscribers being on 2G, there could be some scope for an improvement, given the company is able to convert these subscribers into 4G and 5G, going ahead.​

The telecom operator, as of 29th February 2024, owed in total a sum of Rs 1,95,810 crore arising out of deferred spectrum auctions. Subject to the “Telecom Reform Package” announced in September 2021, a moratorium of 4 years was provided. The company has an obligation to make annual instalment payments of Rs 24,747 crore for the next 8 years, failing which the company will further have to dilute its stake to the Government (who already owns 32% of the company).​

The company is running losses for the last 8 years. As per TTM sales, the company is asking for a valuation of 1.7x of sales. This is less compared to the other listed and profitable players such as Bharti Airtel trading at 4.85x of TTM sales and Bharti Hexacom trading at 6.35x its TTM sales. We therefore recommend to not subscribe to this issue.

details: Objectives of the Issue
Fresh Issue – Rs. 18,000 cr​

The Objectives of the Offer are for:
1. Purchase of equipment for the expansion of our network infrastructure by: (a) setting up new 4G sites; (b) expanding the capacity of existing 4G Sites and new 4G sites; and (c) setting up new 5G sites – Rs 12,750 crore​​
2. Payment of certain deferred payments for spectrum to the DoT – Rs 2,175 crore​​
3. General Corporate Purposes – Rs 3,075 crore
​​

about: Vodafone Idea is the third largest telecom player in India with over 22.3 crore subscribers as of 31st December 2023. It has a subscriber market share of 19.3% in India, declining from 29.8% recorded in FY2020.

The company operates in 22 telecom circles and has presence in 487,000 towns, providing broadband services in over 342,200 of them, facilitated by 183,400 distinct tower locations. This expansive network covers a population of approximately 1.2 billion individuals nationwide.
The company offers voice, data and broadband services in the country. They have a strong enterprise business with value-added offerings such as IoT and cloud services.

The company offers music and gaming options on its newly launched Vi App. They also offer a diverse range of content created through collaboration with content creators and OTT players. The company has also integrated a job and education platform on its Vi App.
As of 31st December 2023, the company held an aggregate spectrum of 8,005 MHz to be used across 2G, 3G, 4G and 5G technologies.
​The company’s revenue has degrown at a CAGR of 1.4% since FY2020.
Owing to losses, the company’s Return on Net Worth has been negative for the past few years.
The Operating margin of the company stood at 39.9% in 9MFY2024, flat over FY2023 and down 174 bps in FY2022 respectively.
The company has consistently generated positive cash flow from operations in the last three fiscal years. The company reported a CFO of Rs 18,869 crore in FY2023, which is 147% of EBITDA.
The company’s interest cost is very high. For the past 2 years, the interest cost was over 120% of CFO.
The company’s outstanding debt (excl. deferred payments) as of 29th February 2024, stood at Rs 6,019 crore.

issue_details.Promoters: Bharti Airtel, Telecommunications Consultants India Limited​(TCIL)
issue_details.Lead Manager: ​SBI Capital, Axis Capital, BOB Capital Markets, ICICI Securities & IIFL Securities

avoid.styick_header_txt: Bharti Hexacom Limited is going public with an offer for sale. The issue opens on 03rd April 2024.​​
avoid.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/JcZ-35tUfyI" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

1.header: Divergent Approaches to Acquiring Telecom Spectrum
desc: During the 2022 5G telecom auction, the company opted out of applying for the 700 MHz frequency band, citing financial constraints. In contrast, its competitor, Reliance Jio, seized the opportunity to acquire the 700 MHz and 800 MHz bands, recognizing their suitability for 5G networks.

2.header: Excessive dependence on a limited number of suppliers
desc: The company sources 68% of its towers from Indus Towers (an affiliate company of Bharti Airtel). Further, top 5 suppliers account to 74% of the gross block addition in 9MFY2024, increasing from 65% in FY2023.​

3.header: Possible merger with Bharti Airtel in the future
desc: Bharti Airtel, being a majority shareholder in the company with a 70% stake, we anticipate a potential merger between Bharti Airtel and Bharti Hexacom given the synergies they might draw from each other.​

As per the TTM financials, the company is asking for a PE of 59x and a market cap-to-sales of 4.1x. These valuations are on par with its peers in the telecom industry and its parent company Bharti Airtel. ​​​

Bharti Hexacom, being a subsidiary of Bharti Airtel, the second largest telecom company in India, needs to trade at a discount to its parent company given the scale Bharti Airtel operates at. Hence, we do not recommend subscribing to this IPO as of now.

details: Objectives of the Issue
No objectives as the issue is a complete offer for sale.​

about: Bharti Hexacom is a communications solution provider offering consumer mobile services, fixed-line telephone and​ broadband services under the “Airtel” brand. It serves customers in Rajasthan and the North-Eastern states of Arunachal Pradesh, Manipur, Meghalaya, Mizoram, Nagaland and Tripura.
The company has access to Airtel’s comprehensive portfolio of digital infrastructure and services such as Airtel Xstream, Airtel Black, Airtel Wynk (music streaming), etc.
​For the nine months ended December 2023, the company holds a revenue market share of 40.4% and 52.7% in Rajasthan and North-East circle, respectively.
Share of postpaid customers for the company increased from 2.7% in March 2023 to 3.1% in December 2023.​

As of December 2023, the company utilized 24,874 towers out of which 5,092 are owned and the remaining 19,782 towers are leased. 13,432 or 68% of the leased towers are sourced from Indus Towers, an affiliate company of its promoters (Bharti Airtel).
The company's revenue has grown at 43% over the last two years.
In FY23, The compan's Return on Net Worth was 13.8%.

The Net profit margin of the company is 5.4% in 9MFY2024, down 295bps recorded in FY2023, due to tax adjustments for previous years and a one-time interest charge on revenues due to change in nature of expenditure of Variable License fees from revenue to capital.

The company recorded an extraordinary gain of ₹ 1,951 crore in profits during FY2022 on account of commercial settlement with a service provider. They also recorded an extraordinary charge of ₹ 169 crore in FY2022 on account of license renewal, spectrum usage and tax reconciliation in different states.
The company has consistently generated positive cash flow from operations in the last three fiscal years. The company reported a CFO of Rs 2,930 crore in 9MFY2024, which 104% of the net profits.
​The company has a debt of Rs 9,432 crore as of 31st December 2023.

issue_details.Promoters: Sanjay Mehta, Ashley Mehta, Aleena Mehta & Kavita Sharma​

avoid.styick_header_txt: SRM Contractors Limited is going public with a fresh issue. The issue opens on 26th March 2024.​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​
avoid.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/euZGl7Eyoow" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

desc: The company’s major clients include government agencies such as National Highways & Infrastructure Development Corporation Limited (NHIDCL), Ministry of Road Transport and Highways (MoRTH), Border Road Organization (BRO) and Public Work Department, Jammu & Kashmir, among others. Top 5 clients of the company contribute 80% of the company’s revenue in 9MFY2024.

The operations of the company are fully concentrated in the UTs of Jammu & Kashmir and Ladakh. The company has just started diversifying into other states with projects being awarded from the neighbor states of Uttarakhand and Himachal Pradesh.​

3.header: Lower operating margins compared to peers
desc: The company operates at an EBITDA margin of 13% (excl. OI) for 9MFY2024, compared to its closest peers having EBITDA margins upwards of 22%.​

As per the FY2023 financials, the company is asking for a PE of 26x and a market cap-to-sales of 1.6x. These valuations are above one of its better performing rival G R Infraprojects, trading at a PE of 11x and market cap-to-sales of 1.3x. Hence, we do not recommend subscribing to this IPO as of now.​​​

about: SRM Contractors is an engineering, construction and development company based out of Jammu & Kashmir. The company has executed multiple road, tunnel and slope stabilization projects in the difficult terrain of union territories of Jammu & Kashmir and Ladakh.
​The company undertakes projects in either of the three ways- (1) on an item rate basis, (2) as an EPC contractor or (3) as a subcontractor.

Being a class A contractor with the Public Works Department (J&K), the entity is pre-qualified to bid independently on projects of contract value up to ₹300 crore and ₹500 crore for EPC contracts pertaining to construction of roads (including bridges) and for construction of tunnel, respectively.

The company incorporated in September 2008, till date, has completed 38 infrastructure construction projects having an aggregate value ₹ 1,412 crore. It includes 32 road projects, 3 tunnel projects and 1 slope stabilization project.
The company’s revenue has grown at 88% over the last two years.
In FY23, The company’s Return on Net Worth was 35%.
The Net profit margin of the company is 9% in 9MFY2024, up 274bps and 232bps on FY2023 and FY2022 respectively.

The company recorded an extraordinary gain of ₹ 5.62 crore in profits during 9MFY2024 due to a one-time surge in earnings from one of its joint ventures. However, we anticipate this would not continue in the future.
The company has consistently generated positive cash flow from operations in the last three fiscal years. The company reported a CFO of Rs 22 crore in 9MFY2024, which 77% of net profits.
The company has a debt of Rs 42 crore as of 31st December 2023.

1.header: Client Concentration and increasing attrition rates
desc: Krystal Integrated Services is involved in the business of providing outsourced services such as maintaining buildings, cleaning, maintaining payrolls, etc. The company has seen growth in both topline and bottom line over the last two years but the company has certain concerns.
The company is mainly a B2B player and the margins are very thin in this business.

Another concern is that the company’s biggest expense is its employee’s salary and if employees keep leaving, it is costly for the company as they must spend on recruitment. The attrition rates of this company have been increasing since FY21 to FY23 from 22% to 31%. Because of this the company’s margins have come under pressure, showing a declining trend.

The company despite reporting profit has reported negative cash flow from operations due to significantly higher receivables. The company’s inability to report positive cash flow from operations deprives them to use its cash to expand its services.

The company derives 80% of its revenue from its top 10 customers indicating high risk in case any of the customers decides to leave. Ideally a company would be better off having its revenue sources spread out between as many customers.
The company is asking for a PE of 26x and a market cap-to-sales of 1.4x. These valuations seem fair but considering the above concerns, we recommend avoiding this IPO.​

about: Krystal Integrated Services is recognized as one of India’s leading integrated facilities management services companies, with a primary focus on sectors such as healthcare, education, public administration (including state government entities, municipal bodies, and other government offices), airports, railways, metro infrastructure, and the retail industry.

Their comprehensive range of integrated facility management service offerings caters to multiple sectors. They provide soft services such as housekeeping, sanitation, landscaping, and gardening, along with hard services like mechanical, electrical, and plumbing maintenance. Additionally, they specialize in solid, liquid, and biomedical waste management, pest control, façade cleaning, and other services including production support, warehouse management, and airport management services (including multi-level parking and airport traffic management).
Furthermore, Krystal Integrated Services offers staffing solutions, payroll management, private security, manned guarding services, and catering services to their wide-ranging customer base., 2023.

The company reported positive CFO in FY22, FY23, and FY23 showing healthy cash generation. The company reported negative cash flow from operations in H1FY24 due to increase in receivables.

desc: The company first started into the dealership business by partnering with Maruti Suzuki in 1984. Today, Popular Vehicles is the seventh largest distributor for Maruti Suzuki in the country. They further ventured into the 2-wheeler and 3-wheeler market by partnering with Ather and Piaggio in 2021.

The company is recording good volumes and top-line for the past few years, but this trend is not supporting the Operating margins of the company as can be witnessed by 119bps fall in the margins from FY2021 to FY2023. Its listed peer, Landmark Cars, is operating at better margins yet trading at par with Popular Vehicles & Services.​

about: Popular Vehicles & Services is one of India’s leading automobile dealer. The company caters  to the complete life cycle of vehicle ownership, right from the sale of new vehicles, servicing and repairing vehicles, distributing spare parts and accessories, to facilitating sale and exchange of preowned vehicles, operating driving schools and facilitating the sale of third-party financial and insurance products.

avoid.styick_header_txt: Gopal Snacks is going public with an offer for sale. The issue opens on 6th March 2024.​​​​​​​​​​​​​
avoid.video_iframe: <iframe  class="iframevideonew" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/mT53jYsnD6E" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

1.header: Low product diversification and low presence across India
desc: Gopal Snacks is involved in the business of manufacturing and selling snacks such as Gathiya, Namkeen, snacks, wafers. The company’s topline hasn’t expanded significantly over the last three fiscals but it has seen significant improvement in margins. The net profit margin has expanded from 2% in FY21 to 8% in FY23 which is quite impressive. But the company has a few concerns.

Gopal Snacks is a Gujarat-based company and so derives 75% of its revenue from Gujarat. This means that it lacks a significant presence across India as compared to its peers who have a Pan India presence. Ideally, investors would prefer companies that derive revenues from diversified geographies. The company also heavily relies on its 3 top products which contribute to 90% of its revenue, this puts the company at significant risk if its top products don’t perform well.

Another concern is that despite the company tripling its capacity from FY22 to FY23, the company marginally grew its revenue by 3% in FY23 while its peers grew much faster during the same period. This was due to lower sales of its biggest products Ghatiya and Namkeen. The company saw improved margins but mainly due to reducing the grammage in its ₹5 and ₹10 packets and lower input costs.

The company was paying 12% GST on snack pellets but when an audit was conducted by the GST department, they claim that the company should pay 18%. The authorities have filed a complain against the company over this.

The company is asking for a PE of 44x and a market cap-to-sales of 3.4x. These valuations seem fair considering that its peers are trading at higher valuations but we believe that the company has few products and very less presence in India, and considering the case filed against them by the GST authority, we recommend avoiding this IPO.​

avoid.styick_header_txt: JG Chemicals is going public with a fresh issue and offer for sale. The issue opens on 5th March 2024.​​​​​​​​​​​​

1.header: Depending on just one product and Industry
desc: JG Chemicals is involved in the business of manufacturing and supplying zinc oxide that has various applications in the rubber, pharma, and agriculture industries. But, the company derives 90% of its revenue from Rubber making it depend heavily on this one industry for growth. The revenue and profit of the company have grown well over the last three fiscals, but the margins of the company were showing signs of a slight decline. Even in the first 9 months of FY24, the revenue, and net profit when annualized are poised to show negative growth in both top line and bottom line. This is mainly attributed to fall in zinc oxide prices globally, a result of a fall in zinc prices which is a key raw material.

JG Chemicals is involved in the business of manufacturing and supplying zinc oxide that has various applications in the rubber, pharma, and agriculture industries. But, the company derives 90% of its revenue from Rubber making it depend heavily on this one industry for growth. The revenue and profit of the company have grown well over the last three fiscals, but the margins of the company were showing signs of a slight decline. Even in the first 9 months of FY24, the revenue, and net profit when annualized are poised to show negative growth in both top line and bottom line. This is mainly attributed to fall in zinc oxide prices globally, a result of a fall in zinc prices which is a key raw material.
The company also has one product which is zinc oxide, and it just sells different grades of it. Any fluctuations in demand could adversely affect the revenues of the company in the future.
On a positive note, the company has been reporting positive cash flow from operations since FY22 and reported a CFO of Rs 67 crore which is ideal for a firm looking to expand.

If we annualize FY24, the company is asking for a PE of 35x and a market cap-to-sales of 1.2x. These valuations seem unattractive, and we believe there is little room for capital appreciation. Hence, we recommend avoiding this IPO.​

about: JG Chemicals, India's leading zinc oxide manufacturer, boasts the largest production capacity and revenue in the industry, primarily utilizing the French process, a dominant technology globally. With a substantial market share of approximately 30% as of March 2022, JG Chemicals offers over 80 grades of zinc oxide, positioning itself among the top ten manufacturers worldwide.

Its zinc oxide finds application across a wide range of industries, including rubber (tyre & other rubber products), ceramics, paints & coatings, pharmaceuticals & cosmetics, electronics & batteries, agro-chemicals & fertilizers, speciality chemicals, lubricants, oil & gas, and animal feed. avoid.styick_header_txt: Mukka Proteins is going public with a fresh issue. The issue opens on 29th February 2024.​​​​​​​​​​

desc: Mukka Proteins is involved in the manufacturing and selling of fish meal, fish oil and fish soluble paste which are raw materials to manufacture animal fees, aquafeed and pet food. These raw materials also find use cases in consumer products such as soaps, medicines for Omega 3. The company’s financials over the last two years have shown a CAGR of 39% and 108% respectively which is impressive but this company has a few concern.
A concern is that the Top 10 customers account for 75% of the total revenue, this is quite risky for the business in case any client decides to cease business with them.
Another concern is that this business does not require high technology and so barriers to entry are very low which could increase the competition and hence, reduce margins going forward.

The company has struggled with cash flow generation in FY23 and H1FY24 as the company reported negative cash flow from operations of Rs 20 crore and Rs 54 crore, respectively. This was due to significant increase in receivables. Negative cash flow from operations deprives the firm of the ability to grow organically.

The company cannot be directly compared to its listed peers as they deal in the finished products using the raw material that Mukka Protein produces but in comparison to unlisted peers, the company isn’t the best in terms of margins.

As per FY23, the company is asking for a PE of 18x and a market cap-to-sales of 0.7x. These valuations seem fair but with such low margins, we don’t believe the company would provide significant capital appreciation going forward and Hence, we recommend avoiding this IPO.​

The company's products are also utilized in soap manufacturing, leather tanneries, and paint industries.

The company serves both domestic and international markets, exporting its products to over 10 countries, including Bahrain, Bangladesh, Chile, Indonesia, Malaysia, Myanmar, Philippines, China, Saudi Arabia, South Korea, Oman, Taiwan, and Vietnam.​

avoid.styick_header_txt: Bharat Highways Infrastructure is going public with a fresh issue. The issue opens on 28th February 2024.​​​​​​​​​

desc: Bharat Highways InvIT is a specialized trust focused on managing and investing in a diversified portfolio of infrastructure assets across India, primarily roads. GR Infraprojects was the company that constructed the highway projects through its seven SPV’s and now it is transferring it to Bharat Highways InvIT. Now the company will receive annuity from the NHAI on a regular basis so the company has no risk cash flow going forward.

The company has also provided the estimated Cash flow operations up until FY26. The company will generate Rs 1,016 cr in FY24, Rs 906 cr in FY25, and Rs 940 cr in FY26. after deducting interest and expenses, the company will distribute this as dividend among investors.

But the concern here is that if we look at another company that went public in 2021 which has massively underperformed the benchmarks despite the market giving substantial returns during this period. The cash flows will keep decreasing as the assets gets depleted. So we believe that this is not a story worth investing in.
The company has a debt of Rs 3,684 crore. Now the company is going to use Rs 2400 crore out of the Rs 2500 crore issue just to reduce this debt after which it will still have a debt of Rs 1127 crore.

Normally, Invit are valued based on the future cash flows. Here chances of capital appreciations are less and only way one can look forward to have money is dividend which will decline as time progresses due to decline in the cash flow of the company. Hence, we recommend avoiding this IPO.​

avoid.styick_header_txt: Platinum Industries is going public with a fresh issue. The issue opens on 27th February 2024.​​​​​​​

1.header: Client Concentration and lack of high technology in the business
desc: Platinum Industries specializes in manufacturing Polyvinyl Chloride (PVC) stabilizers, Chlorinated PVC additives, and lubricants primarily used in PVC and CPVC pipe production. These additives enhance the quality and durability of PVC and CPVC pipes while reducing the risk of corrosion. While the company previously focused on producing lead-based stabilizers, it has transitioned to non-lead-based stabilizers due to safety concerns associated with lead.

In recent years, Platinum Industries has exhibited promising financial performance. Revenue and net profit have experienced significant growth, with a CAGR of 61% and 179%, respectively, over the past two years. Notably, the net profit margin stood at an impressive 16% in FY23, which would attract investor attention. But despite this the company has several concerns regarding customer concentration. The company relies very heavily on its top 5 customers who make up 82% of the company’s total revenue. This leaves the company the company vulnerable to significant revenue loss in case a client decides to not continue.
This business is not a high-tech business and doesn’t not require significant R&D, in such a case why should company demand for such high valuations.
The company has only one manufacturing unit located in Palghar, Maharashtra. This makes it difficult for the company to ship products across India.

As per FY23, the company is asking for a PE of 25x and a market cap-to-sales of 4x. We believe that these valuations are expensive for a business with so many risks, hence we recommend avoiding this IPO.​

2. Capital Expenditure in Maharashtra Plant​

about: Platinum Industries is involved in the business of manufacturing and selling of Polyvinyl Chloride stabilizers, Chlorinated Polyvinyl Chloride, and Lubricants.​

PVC stabilizers are chemical additives used in the production of polyvinyl chloride (PVC) based products to enhance the performance and durability of PVC. These stabilizers enhance the thermal stability of PVC by allowing it to withstand heat without significant degradation or loss of physical properties. They prevent the discoloration, embrittlement and degradation of PVC caused by UV exposure, ensuring the longevity and aesthetics of PVC-based applications. It also improves the mechanical properties of PVC, such as its impact strength, tensile strength, and flexibility
The current capacity of the company stands at 26.950 MTPA
​The company’s revenue has grown at 61% over the last two years and net profit at 179%
In FY23, The company’s Return on Capital Employed in FY23 was 56%
​The Net profit margin of the company is 16% in FY23 which has improved in the last two years. The NPM was 5% in FY21.
The company has consistently generated positive cash flow from operations except for FY22 when the company reported a negative cash flow from operations mainly due to increase in Accounts receivable.
​The company has a debt of Rs 11 crore which is negligible

avoid.styick_header_txt: Exicom Tele Systems is going public with a fresh issue and an offer for sale. The issue opens on 27th February 2024.​​​​​​​​

1.header: Client Concentration and decline in revenue
desc: Exicom Tele Systems specializes in Control Power Systems providing power distribution and EV charging. The Control Power systems business contributes to 70% of the company’s revenue while the rest is derived from EV.

The company’s financials haven’t grown that well in the last two years with revenue declining in FY23 as compared to FY22 numbers. None of its peers experienced such a decline in FY23 revenue, in fact they saw revenue growth. The company also struggles with a very low net profit margin of less than 1% which will seem very unattractive to investors.
The company’s top 5 customers make up 57% of the revenue which poses risk on the business as it could lead to significant business losses in case one of those companies decides to not continue.
Another concern is that the company has been generating volatile cash flow from operations which doesn’t ensure stability in the firm.

As per FY23, the company is asking for a PE of 270x and a market cap-to-sales of 2.3x. Despite the company made significant profit in H1FY24, we are using FY23 numbers for valuation as we do not know how sustainable this profit is. Hence, we recommend avoiding this IPO.​

about: Established in 1994, Exicom Tele Systems stands as a pioneering force in the realm of power management solutions, with its headquarters nestled in India. With a steadfast commitment to innovation and sustainability, the company operates across two distinct business verticals, each dedicated to driving positive change in the energy landscape.

The first vertical, the Critical Power Solutions business, epitomizes Exicom Tele Systems' expertise in designing, manufacturing, and servicing DC Power Systems and cutting-edge Li-ion based energy storage solutions. These offerings play a pivotal role in delivering comprehensive energy management solutions to telecommunications sites and enterprise environments, both within India and abroad.

In parallel, Exicom Tele Systems' Electric Vehicle Supply Equipment (EV Charger) solutions business exemplifies its foresight and innovation in enabling the transition towards sustainable transportation. As one of the earliest entrants into the EV Chargers manufacturing segment in India, the company has not only pioneered groundbreaking technologies but also captured a significant market share. As of March 31, 2023, its market dominance stood at an impressive 60% in the residential charging segment

avoid.styick_header_txt: Juniper Hotels is going public with a fresh issue. The issue opens on 21st February 2024.​​​​​

1.header: Crippling Debt and consistently reporting losses
desc: Juniper Hotels operates several prominent hotels across India, including the Grand Hyatt Mumbai, Hyatt Regency Ahmedabad, Andaz Delhi, and Hyatt Delhi Residencies. Despite significant revenue growth in recent fiscal years, the company has consistently reported losses. Even in H1FY24, the losses exceeded those of FY23.

The primary concern lies in the company's substantial debt burden. With total borrowings amounting to Rs 2,253 crore, this represents a considerable liability compared to the company's revenue, which stood at just Rs 717 crore in FY23. The weight of interest payments from this debt has contributed significantly to the company's ongoing losses.

Additionally, Juniper Hotels faces revenue concentration risks, with a significant portion of its revenue derived from the Grand Hyatt Mumbai and Delhi properties, accounting for 91% of the total revenue.

Despite maintaining a commendable occupancy rate of 74%, which is among the best in the industry. But while other companies with similar occupancy rates are profitable, Juniper Hotels continues to struggle.

As per FY23, the company is asking for a market cap-to-sales of 11x. These valuations seem very expensive for a company that has consistently reported losses and hence, we would advise avoiding this IPO.​

2. General corporate purposes​​

about: Juniper Hotels owns and operates multiple hotels such as the Grand Hyatt Mumbai, Azad Delhi and Hyatt Delhi residencies, Hyatt Regency Ahmedabad. The company benefits from a long-standing partnership with Hyatt Hotels Corporation, a globally recognized premier hospitality brand. This partnership spans over 40 years and is unique in India. The company is the only hotel development entity in India with which Hyatt has a strategic investment.The Saraf Group and Two Seas Holdings own 95% of the stake while the rest is owned by Juniper Investments.

The company recently acquired Chartered Hotels Private Ltd which had three hotels. This acquisition added 430 keys to the portfolio of the company taking it to a total of 1836 keys as of 30th September, 2023.
The company’s revenue has grown at 93% over the last two years while the profit of the company has remained negative​

avoid.styick_header_txt: Vibhor Steel Tubes is going public with a Fresh issue. The issue opens on 13th February 2024.​​​​

1.header: Customer Concentration Risk and inconsistent cash flow from operations
desc: Vibhor Steel Tubes operates in the manufacturing of steel products, including ERW pipes, Galvanized pipes, and Hollow Section pipes. These products find applications in various sectors such as oil and gas transportation, water transportation, construction, etc. The company's primary customer is Jindal Pipes, for which it manufactures and sells products under the brand name 'Jindal Star'. Despite reporting growth in revenue and net profit, there are significant concerns that investors should consider.

One major issue is the company's EBITDA per tonne, a key efficiency metric in the steel industry, which is lower compared to its competitors. This indicates that the company may have lower operational efficiency and profitability margins compared to its peers.

Another significant concern is the company's consistent struggle to generate positive cash flow from operations. Even in H1FY24, the company reported negative cash flow from operations of Rs 8 crore. This ongoing negative cash flow reduces the company's ability to internally finance expansion and forces it to rely more heavily on debt to fund capital expenditures, which could increase financial risk in the long term.

The most alarming issue is the heavy reliance on a single client, Jindal Pipes, which contributes 93% of the company's total revenue as of March 2023. This concentration of revenue from one client exposes Vibhor Steel Tubes to significant risk, as any adverse decision or change in business terms by Jindal Pipes could have a severe impact on the company's financial stability and operations.

The company is asking for a PE of 13.6x and a market cap to sales of 0.3x which in comparison to its listed peer is quite fair but considering the above issues related to the company, we recommend avoiding this IPO.​

avoid.styick_header_txt: Rashi Peripherals is going public with a Fresh issue. The issue opens on 7th February 2024.​​​​

desc: Rashi Peripherals is involved in the business of distribution of products such as computing devices, graphic cards, CPUs, and motherboards. They also provide cloud solutions to clients. The company’s topline and bottom line have shown little to no growth over the last two years, as the revenue increased marginally whereas the net profit declined by 32% as compared to FY23. Even the net profit margin is very low at 1.5%. The cash flow from operations of the company has consistently been negative in the last 3 fiscal years. This was due to an increase in receivables and higher inventory. This deprives the firm from expanding organically.

This is a very low margin business and it won’t attract the attention of many investors. The company has been on a decline over the last three years, if we look at its EBITDA Margin, it has been declining over the last three fiscals when it was 3.6% in FY21 which has now declined to 2.8% in FY23. The decline in the financials indicates that the company is struggling with efficiency, and we don’t expect it to improve significantly going forward.

Even the debt of the company is mounting over the last three years, the company had a debt of Rs 489 in FY21 crore and as of September 2023, the debt of the company stands at Rs 1400 crore which could further lower the net profit margin going forward.

As per FY23, the company is asking for a PE of 17x and a market cap to sales of 0.2x which seems quite fair. But looking at the declining trend in margins of the company, we believe this stock won’t provide any capital appreciation to investors. Hence, we recommend avoiding this IPO.​

avoid.styick_header_txt: Epack Durable is going public with a Fresh Issue & Offer for Sale. The issue opens on 19th January 2024.​​​​

desc: Epack Durable operates in the manufacturing sector, specializing in Room air conditioners and additional components such as cooktops, mixer-grinders, and water dispensers. While the company has experienced overall growth in both its top line and bottom line since FY21, there are notable concerns regarding its financial performance. Specifically, the net profit margin has remained consistently low, hovering around 2%. In H1FY24, the company reported an even lower net profit margin of 0.3%, primarily attributed to escalating input costs. The erratic cash flow from operations further adds to the apprehension of investors.

The industry itself is characterized by slim profit margins, exemplified by the 0.3% profit margin reported by Epack Durable. Such meager profitability may deter potential investors who seek more lucrative opportunities.

A major issue facing the company is the substantial concentration of its revenue sources. In FY21, the top 10 customers contributed only 34% of the total revenue; however, this figure has surged to 62% in H1FY24. This heightened dependency on a limited number of key customers exposes Epack Durable to significant risks. Any adverse decision by one of these key customers to cease business with the company could have severe repercussions.

As per FY23, the company is asking for a PE of 68x and a market cap-to-sales of 1.4x. These valuations seem fair but considering the volatility of its financials and low profitability, we recommend avoiding this IPO.​

avoid.styick_header_txt: Jyoti CNC is going public with a Fresh Issue. The issue opens on 9th January 2024.​​​

1.header: Very low profitability volatile cash flows
desc: Jyoti CNC is involved in the business of manufacturing Computer Numerical Control (CNC) Machines, which are automated machines used in large-scale manufacturing across industries such as aerospace, defense, auto components, and the medical sector. The company’s financials have improved in the last two years, but the profit margins reported by the company are negligible. The company reported a profit of Rs 15 crore in FY23, but in H1FY24, the company has managed to generate only a profit of Rs 3.35 crore. If we annualize this, the profit would be 50% less than FY23. Not many investors will be willing to put their money into a company with deteriorating financials.

Even the cash flows of the company are very volatile, as it reported a CFO of Rs 26 crore in FY21, which increased to Rs 39 crore in FY22 but then fell to Rs 12 crore. In H1FY24, the company reported negative cash flow from operations. Lack of cash flow generation deprives a firm of the ability to expand organically.

The company also has very high debt of Rs 821 crore as of September 2023, which is significant for a company that had a turnover of Rs 929 crore in FY23. The company is already reporting negligible margins, and with such an amount of debt, it is unlikely that the company could increase profits significantly anytime soon. The company reported losses in FY21 and FY22, while it did report a profit in FY23. We don’t think it can be sustained going forward.
As per FY23, the company is asking for a PE of 501x and a market cap-to-sales of 8x which is very expensive and there is no room for capital appreciation in this IPO. Hence, we recommend avoiding it​

avoid.styick_header_txt: Azad Engineering is going public with a Fresh Issue & offer for Sale. The issue opens on 20th December 2023.​​

1.header: Negative cash flow and exorbitant valuations
desc: Azad Engineering specializes in forging and manufacturing machined components for Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs). Despite experiencing notable revenue growth, the company faces significant challenges in its financial performance. In FY23, Azad Engineering witnessed a substantial 71% decline in net profit compared to FY22, resulting in a meager net profit margin of 3%. This decline will raise concerns among potential investors.

Moreover, the cash flow from operations, which was positive in FY21 and FY22, has turned negative in FY23 and the first half of FY24. This negative cash flow impedes the company's ability to pursue organic expansion. The company's financial constraints limit its strategic options for growth.

In terms of efficiency, Azad Engineering lags behind its peers with a Return on Equity (ROE) of 4.2%, the lowest in its industry. This low ROE suggests inefficiency in utilizing shareholders' equity to generate profits. Addressing this inefficiency is crucial for the company's long-term sustainability and attractiveness to investors.

Additionally, the company carries a substantial debt burden of Rs 324 crore, a significant amount relative to its FY23 revenue of Rs 261 crore. This high level of debt poses a potential risk to the company's financial stability, especially if its performance does not improve in the future.

As per FY23, the company is asking for a PE of 365x and a market cap to sales of 12x which in comparison to its peers is very expensive and considering that the company is struggling with cash flow, profitability and consistency, we recommend avoiding this IPO.​

The company is asking for a PE of 23x and a market cap-to-Sales of 3.6x which in comparison to its listed peers, seems expensive considering that most of the companies products are not rated highly, we recommend you to avoid this IPO​

avoid.styick_header_txt: RBZ Jewellers is going public with a Fresh Issue. The issue opens on 19th December 2023.​​​​​​​​​​​

1.header: ​​Negative cash flow and lack of Pan India Presence
desc: RBZ Jewellers specializes in manufacturing gold, diamond, and silver jewelry, primarily catering to bridal use. Over the past two years, the company has experienced significant growth, with revenue and net profit both more than doubling during this period. However, the company faces notable challenges, particularly concerning cash flow volatility, negative cash flow from operations in FY21 and FY23, and an ongoing issue of increasing inventory levels.

Even in the first half of FY24, the company reported a negative cash flow from operations of Rs 5 crore, primarily attributed to the growing inventory that the company struggles to sell. This poses a potential threat to the company's financial health if inventory levels are not effectively managed in the future.

The company plans to allocate a substantial portion of its proceeds toward working capital expenses and repaying loans to promoters, rather than focusing on expansion initiatives. This strategic choice may not be appealing to potential investors. Additionally, a notable concern is that the company has not registered the brand name 'Harit Zaveri.' This lack of brand protection means that if any promoter decides to leave, they could potentially start a new business using the same name.

Geographically, the company's presence is limited to Gujarat, lacking a Pan India footprint. This places RBZ Jewellers at a disadvantage compared to its listed peers who enjoy a nationwide presence. The absence of a broader market reach could impact the company's competitiveness and growth potential in comparison to its competitors.
The company is asking for a PE of 14x and a market cap-to-Sales of 1.4x which in comparison to its listed peers, seems fair but considering the above concerns, we recommend you avoid this IPO​

avoid.styick_header_txt: Fedbank Financial Services is going public with a Fresh issue & Offer For Sale. The issue opens on 22nd November 2023.

desc: Fedbank Financial Services, a subsidiary of Federal Bank, specializes in MSME and gold loans, showcasing commendable growth in both top and bottom lines over the past two years. Despite its focus on the underserved MSME sector in India, the company has lagged behind its peers in various financial metrics.

One notable metric is the Net Interest Margin (NIM), standing at 8.25%, which, at first glance, appears promising. However, a comparative analysis with industry peers reveals an underperformance in this crucial area (Manappuram has an NIM of 11.5%, Aptus Valley 13.1%,Five Star Business 20.6%) Several competitors with similar business models are reporting higher NIMs while maintaining lower GNPA and NNPA. This raises concerns about Fedbank Financial Services' operational efficiency and risk management.

Furthermore, the company exhibits the second-highest levels of GNPA and NNPA at 2.0% and 1.6% respectively among its peers, indicating potential challenges in asset quality management. The Return on Assets (ROA) of the company is also the lowest among its competitors, reflecting less effective utilization of its assets to generate profits.

Investor caution is warranted as the company experienced a rise in NPAs in the first quarter of FY24 at 1.76% as compared to 1.6% at the end of March 2023. This uptick in NPAs may deter investors, considering the significance of asset quality in the financial sector.

Fedbank Financial Services is seeking a Price to Book (P/B) ratio of 3.3x, a valuation that appears relatively steep when compared to its listed counterparts. The financial performance and metrics, especially when lagging behind peers in key areas such as Net Interest Margin (NIM) and asset quality, raises concerns about justifying a higher valuation. Hence, we would advise you to avoid this IPO.

1.header: Good revenue growth but a major decline in net profit
desc: IRM Energy, a player in the City gas distribution business, has experienced remarkable revenue growth over the last three years, with a fivefold increase. However, the company's net profit in FY23 saw a 50% decline compared to FY22 when the company performed exceptionally well. The primary reason for this decline was the company incurring higher input costs due to geopolitical instability in Ukraine and Russia.

The company’s decline in net profit of 50% would’ve been justified if the peers experienced a similar situation but no other peer has seen a decline in net profit of such magnitude. In fact, most competitors saw a growth in net profit in FY23. Also, the ROE of the company is below average as most peers have reported an ROE of 20% or more.

In March 2023, IRM Technology's request for a PE ratio of 33x and a Market Capitalization-to-Sales ratio of 2x appears relatively high when compared to competitors. This is notable given their lower profit margins. The industry typically sees an average PE ratio of around 20 and a market cap-to-sales ratio of less than 1x. These metrics indicate limited potential for capital appreciation.

1.header: Good growth but below industry average financials
desc: Plaza Wires is a company that has demonstrated solid financial growth over the past two years, with its revenue and net profit increasing by 12% and 33%, respectively. This growth can be attributed to a notable decrease in the company's raw material costs as a percentage of its revenue, which has led to improved profit margins. However, it's important to note that even with these improvements, Plaza Wires still lags behind its peers in terms of profit margins.

Plaza Wires operates in a highly competitive industry with numerous players, and as such, it operates in a low-margin business environment. This competitive landscape limits the company's ability to significantly expand its profit margins

An additional point of concern is the decline in the Cash flow from Operation (CFO) . While the CFO had previously shown positivity in the financials over the last two years, there has been a decline in FY23, with the CFO decreasing from Rs 11 crore to Rs 8.6 crore.
The company's family-run nature raises concerns about potential corporate governance issues. Also, the size of the issue is only Rs 71 cr which won't attract the attention of the investors.

Plaza Wires is currently seeking a Price-to-Earnings (PE) ratio of 31x and a market capitalization-to-sales ratio of 1.3x, which is relatively expensive compared to its industry peers. However, the question arises as to why the company should command such high valuations when its financial performance is not superior to that of its competitors. Hence, we advise you to avoid this IPO.

avoid.styick_header_txt: Updater Services is going public with a Fresh Issue and Offer for Sale. The issue opens on 25th September 2023.​​​​

1.header: Good revenue growth but declining bottom line
desc: Despite experiencing a substantial 32% growth in revenue over the past two years, the company faced a decline in its net profit in FY23 compared to FY22. This decline in profitability is mirrored in the diminishing margins of the company, with both EBITDA and net profit margins exhibiting a downward trajectory. It's worth noting that this industry operates on narrow profit margins, with most competitors reporting profits in the range of 2% to 3% as of March 2023.

Furthermore, the company grapples with a severe employee retention issue, evident in an alarming attrition rate of 78%. This high turnover rate not only reduces overall productivity but also escalates recruitment costs, which can further erode profitability as employee expenses accounted for 65% of the total revenue in FY23.

On a positive note, the company plans to significantly reduce its debt by allocating a portion of the issue proceeds to repay a substantial portion of their existing debt, which stands at Rs 176 crore as of March 2023. However, it's important to note that this debt reduction alone may not lead to a significant expansion of their profit margins, particularly since the finance cost currently represents only a modest 0.6% of total revenue.

The company is asking for a PE of 57x and a market cap to sales of 1x which in comparison to listed peers seems very expensive. If the company is not being able to report better financials than its competitors, then why should they demand higher valuations? This leaves no room for capital appreciation and hence, we advise you to avoid this IPO
